original: gzungs bar bshad pa dang / 'dzin par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs bar bshad pa dang / 'dzin par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the retention

original: ji ltar gzung bar bshad ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar gzung bar bshad ce na //
translated: How is the retention explained?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar gnyis po de na med pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar gnyis po de na med pa la //
translated: As the two do not exist in that way,

original: gnyis po de dag nye bar dmigs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag nye bar dmigs pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the two, the apprehended and the apprehender, are perceived.

original: dper na rta dang glang po de snang ba'i rgyu rdo dang shing la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par dmigs shing snang ste /
analyzed: dper na rta dang glang po de snang ba'i rgyu rdo dang shing la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par dmigs shing snang ste /
translated: For example, although the two, the apprehended and the apprehender, do not exist in a stone or a piece of wood, which are the causes of the appearance of a horse and an elephant, the apprehended and the apprehender are perceived and appear.

original: de na rta dang glang po la sogs par snang ba ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de na rta dang glang po la sogs par snang ba ni gzung ba'o //
translated: The appearance of a horse and an elephant, etc. in that [stone or piece of wood] is the apprehended.

original: ma rig pas khebs pa'i byis pa rnams bdag cag gis rta dang glang po 'di dag mthong ngo snyam du sems pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pas khebs pa'i byis pa rnams bdag cag gis rta dang glang po 'di dag mthong ngo snyam du sems pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The thought of the childish, who are covered by ignorance, that 'we see these horses and elephants', is the apprehender.

original: gsung rab kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsung rab kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate the scriptures, it is said:

original: keng rus gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: keng rus gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa ni //
translated: The retention of a skeleton and a reflection

original: nor phyir gnyis su bshad pa ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nor phyir gnyis su bshad pa ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is explained as two for the sake of error.

original: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod la sogs par song nas keng rus la brtags pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod la sogs par song nas keng rus la brtags pa'o //
translated: The beginner yogi/ni goes to a charnel ground and so forth and examines a skeleton.

original: de ltar ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du bsgoms pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du bsgoms pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na /
translated: In that way, in accordance with the way it is examined, it is cultivated and at the time of samƒÅdhi,

original: keng rus la sogs pa sems kyi gzugs brnyan sems la snang ngo //
analyzed: keng rus la sogs pa sems kyi gzugs brnyan sems la snang ngo //
translated: the mental image of a skeleton and so forth appears to the mind.

original: keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan yod pa ma yin pa la snang pas na nor pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan yod pa ma yin pa la snang pas na nor pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the image of a skeleton does not exist and appears, it is called ‚Äúmistaken.‚Äù

original: de ltar nor pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar nor pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis su bshad de /
translated: In that way, because it is mistaken, it is explained as two:

original: gzung bar bshad pa dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bshad pa dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the explained object and the subject.

original: ji ltar gnyis su bshad ce na //üîΩde'i phyir / ji ltar de na gnyis med la //üîΩgnyis su nye bar dmigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis su bshad ce na // de'i phyir / ji ltar de na gnyis med la // gnyis su nye bar dmigs pa bzhin //
translated: How is it explained as two?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩJust as there is no duality there,üîΩbut duality is apprehended.

original: dper na keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba'i gnas nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su nye bar dmigs @179b shing snang ste /
analyzed: dper na keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba'i gnas nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su nye bar dmigs @179b shing snang ste /
translated: For example, in the place where the image of a skeleton appears, although the duality of object and subject does not exist, the duality of object and subject is apprehended and appears.

original: keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan ni gzung ba'o //
translated: The reflection of a skeleton is the apprehended object.

original: de la dmigs par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that perceives it is the apprehending subject.

original: de dang 'dra bar gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis snang ba gzung 'dzin gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis snang ba gzung 'dzin gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although the dependent nature appears as the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, it does not exist as the entity of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject. This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe duality does not exist therein.‚Äù

original: chos gang nor pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: chos gang nor pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of error is this:

original: de bzhin yod dang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin yod dang med pa'i phyir //
translated: because it exists and does not exist in that way,

original: yod med bye brag med pas na //üîΩyod dang med pa sgyu ma 'dra //
analyzed: yod med bye brag med pas na // yod dang med pa sgyu ma 'dra //
translated: there is no distinction between existence and nonexistence;

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: existence and nonexistence are like a magical creation.

original: chos ni rnam pa gnyis te mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang / gnyen po'i phyogs tha dad pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos ni rnam pa gnyis te mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang / gnyen po'i phyogs tha dad pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is twofold: the Dharma of afflicted phenomena, such as desire, which is the counteragent, and the Dharma of purified phenomena, such as faith, which is the counteragent.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin par yod pa lta bur snang bas na nor pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin par yod pa lta bur snang bas na nor pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Afflicted phenomena such as attachment also exist as the nature of the apprehended and apprehender, but they appear as if they do not exist. Therefore they are said to be characterized by error.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag ni yod par yang sgyu ma'i yod pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag ni yod par yang sgyu ma'i yod pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Those phenomena that are discordant factors exist like the existence of an illusion.

original: med pa yang sgyu ma'i med pa dang 'dra la /
analyzed: med pa yang sgyu ma'i med pa dang 'dra la /
translated: They do not exist like the nonexistence of an illusion.

original: yod med bye brag med pa yang sgyu ma'i yod med bye brag med pa dang 'dra bas na yod pa dang med pa sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir chos de thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod med bye brag med pa yang sgyu ma'i yod med bye brag med pa dang 'dra bas na yod pa dang med pa sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir chos de thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra zhes bya'o //
translated: They are not differentiated as existent or nonexistent like the nondifferentiation of the existence and nonexistence of an illusion. Therefore because existence and nonexistence are like an illusion, all phenomena are said to be like an illusion.

original: ji ltar yod pa sgyu ma dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa sgyu ma dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: How is existence like an illusion?

original: dper na sgyu ma rta dang glang por 'dra bar snang ba tsam med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma rta dang glang por 'dra bar snang ba tsam med pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, the mere appearance of an illusion as a horse or an elephant is not nonexistent.

original: yod bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba de dag kyang snang ba tsam du 'khrul par med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba de dag kyang snang ba tsam du 'khrul par med pa ma yin te /
translated: While existing, the appearance of the apprehended and apprehender is not nonexistent as mere appearance.

original: yod pas na yod pa yang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pas na yod pa yang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Since it exists, existence is like an illusion.

original: ji ltar med pa sgyu ma dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa sgyu ma dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: How is nonexistence like an illusion?

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po 'dra bar snang yang rta nyid kyi rang bzhin dang glang po nyid kyi rang bzhin dang med pa de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba de dag snang yang gzung ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dzin pa'i rang
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po 'dra bar snang yang rta nyid kyi rang bzhin dang glang po nyid kyi rang bzhin dang med pa de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba de dag snang yang gzung ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dzin pa'i rang
translated: Just as a horse or an elephant in an illusion appears to be like a horse or an elephant, but does not exist as the intrinsic reality of a horse or the intrinsic reality of an elephant, in the same way, although the appearance of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject exists, it does not exist as the intrinsic reality of the apprehended object and the intrinsic reality of the apprehending subject.

original: bzhin nyid du grub par med pas na med pa yang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhin nyid du grub par med pas na med pa yang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, nonexistence is also like an illusion.

original: yod med bye brag med pa ji ltar sgyu ma lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: yod med bye brag med pa ji ltar sgyu ma lta bur zhe na /
translated: How is there no difference between existence and nonexistence in the case of an illusion?

original: dper na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang por snang ba tsam du zad kyang rta dang glang po'i rang bzhin nyid med pas yod pa dang med pa bye brag med pa dang / gang na glang po rta'i rang bzhin med pa de na rta dang glang por snang ba tsam yod pas yod pa dang med par bye brag med do //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang por snang ba tsam du zad kyang rta dang glang po'i rang bzhin nyid med pas yod pa dang med pa bye brag med pa dang / gang na glang po rta'i rang bzhin med pa de na rta dang glang por snang ba tsam yod pas yod pa dang med par bye brag med do //
translated: And where there is no intrinsic reality of horses and elephants, there is no difference between their existence and non-existence, because there is merely the appearance of horses and elephants.

original: de dang 'dra bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa snang ba tsam du yod pas na gzung 'dzin gyi rang bzhin med @180a * //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa snang ba tsam du yod pas na gzung 'dzin gyi rang bzhin med @180a * //
translated: In the same way, there is no difference between the existence and non-existence of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, because there is merely the appearance of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: pas yod ba dang med ba bye brag med pa dang / gzung 'dzin rang bzhin med pa la /
analyzed: pas yod ba dang med ba bye brag med pa dang / gzung 'dzin rang bzhin med pa la /
translated: And where there is no intrinsic reality of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject,

original: snang ba tsam yod pas med pa yod pa bye brag med de /
analyzed: snang ba tsam yod pas med pa yod pa bye brag med de /
translated: there is no difference between their existence and non-existence, because there is merely the appearance of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: de bas na yod pa dang med pa bye brag med pa yang sgyu ma lta bur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na yod pa dang med pa bye brag med pa yang sgyu ma lta bur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the absence of difference between existence and non-existence should be understood as being like an illusion. This is the meaning.

original: yod pa dang med pa de gnyis kyi bye brag med pas na med pa yang ma yin yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de gnyis kyi bye brag med pas na med pa yang ma yin yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since there is no distinction between those two, existence and nonexistence, it is said that ‚Äúit is not nonexistent and not existent.‚Äù

original: snang ba tsam du yod kyang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba tsam du yod kyang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it exists as mere appearance but does not exist intrinsically, it is not existent.

original: rang bzhin med kyang snang ba tsam du yod pas na med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin med kyang snang ba tsam du yod pas na med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is without intrinsic nature but exists as mere appearance, it is not nonexistent. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams sgyu ma lta bur bstan nas gnyen po'i chos rnams kyang sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams sgyu ma lta bur bstan nas gnyen po'i chos rnams kyang sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught that the discordant classes are like an illusion, in order to teach that the remedial classes are also like an illusion, it is said:

original: gnyen po'i chos ni gang yin pa //üîΩde bzhin med dang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos ni gang yin pa // de bzhin med dang med pa'i phyir //
translated: What are the remedial classes?üîΩSince they do not exist in reality and do not exist,

original: de bzhin med pas mtshan ma med //
analyzed: de bzhin med pas mtshan ma med //
translated: they are signless.

original: sgyu ma 'dra bar bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma 'dra bar bstan pa yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: They are taught to be like an illusion.

original: de'i gnyen po'i chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the remedial classes are threefold.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang / bshad par bya ba'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang 'thob par bya ba'i chos mngal du 'jug pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang / bshad par bya ba'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang 'thob par bya ba'i chos mngal du 'jug pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phenomena to be accomplished are the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment such as the applications of mindfulness, the phenomena to be explained are the twelve branches of excellent speech and the phenomena to be obtained are the entry into the womb and so on.

original: chos de dag kyang mtshan nyid med cing sgyu ma dang 'dra bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mtshan nyid med cing sgyu ma dang 'dra bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: These phenomena are also taught to be illusionlike and devoid of characteristics.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang ji ltar byis pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur brtags pa ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang ji ltar byis pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur brtags pa ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The thirty-seven phenomena of the factors of enlightenment to be accomplished do not exist as they are apprehended by the childish as the apprehender and the apprehended and thus they are like an illusion.

original: de bzhin med dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin med dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the phrase do not exist as such.

original: bshad par bya ba'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyang ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshul du bshad pa ltar yod pa ma yin pas sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyang ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshul du bshad pa ltar yod pa ma yin pas sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The Dharma to be explained, the twelve branches of the scriptures, also do not exist as the Bhagavat explained them in the manner of names, phrases, and letters, and so they are like a magical creation.

original: de ni med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with ‚Äúbecause they do not exist.‚Äù

original: 'thob par bya ba'i chos sangs rgyas kyi mngal du 'jug pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bstan pa yang ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas na sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'thob par bya ba'i chos sangs rgyas kyi mngal du 'jug pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bstan pa yang ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas na sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The Dharma to be attained, the teachings on entering the womb of a buddha, complete enlightenment, nirvana, and so on, also do not exist as they are taught, and so they are like a magical creation.

original: de ni de bzhin med pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin med pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with ‚Äúbecause they do not exist in that way.‚Äù

original: de chos de dag mtshan nyid med cing rang bzhin yod pa yang ma yin par snang bas na sgyu ma lta bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de chos de dag mtshan nyid med cing rang bzhin yod pa yang ma yin par snang bas na sgyu ma lta bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because those dharmas appear to be without characteristics and not to exist essentially, they are not like a magical creation.

original: gal te @180b kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
analyzed: gal te @180b kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
translated: If the side of affliction is like a magical creation,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin na rnam par byang ba'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bus kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bur ji ltar spang snyam pa la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin na rnam par byang ba'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bus kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bur ji ltar spang snyam pa la /
translated: If the side of purification is also like an illusion, how can the side of purification, which is like an illusion, eliminate the side of affliction, which is like an illusion?

original: de'i phyir / dpe'i don du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dpe'i don du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that a verse is stated for the sake of the meaning of the example.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bu yin yang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bus spang du rung bar dpe bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bu yin yang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs sgyu ma lta bus spang du rung bar dpe bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although the side of affliction is like an illusion, it is suitable to eliminate it with the side of purification, which is like an illusion. The meaning of the example is taught.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rgyal po dag / sgyu ma'i rgyal po gzhan gyis pham //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rgyal po dag / sgyu ma'i rgyal po gzhan gyis pham //
translated: Just as an illusory king is defeated by another illusory king,üîΩso the bodhisattvas,

original: gang gis chos kun mthong ba yi //
analyzed: gang gis chos kun mthong ba yi //
translated: who see all phenomena,

original: rgyal sras de dag nga rgyal med //
analyzed: rgyal sras de dag nga rgyal med //
translated: are free from pride.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: dper na sgyu ma'i rgyal po'i mthu chud du la la zhig 'khor dang bcas te gnas 'ga' zhig na 'dug pa las sgyu ma'i rgyal po mthu dang ldan pa 'khor dang bcas pa la la zhig gis gnas 'ga' zhig na 'dug pas sgyu ma'i rgyal po mthu chungüîΩdu pham ste /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i rgyal po'i mthu chud du la la zhig 'khor dang bcas te gnas 'ga' zhig na 'dug pa las sgyu ma'i rgyal po mthu dang ldan pa 'khor dang bcas pa la la zhig gis gnas 'ga' zhig na 'dug pas sgyu ma'i rgyal po mthu chung du pham ste /
translated: For example, a powerful illusory king, together with his retinue, resides in a certain place. Another powerful illusory king, together with his retinue, defeats the first king, who is of little power, together with his retinue, and expels him from his place.

original: pham par byas nas gnas nas bton pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas lta bu ste /
analyzed: pham par byas nas gnas nas bton pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas lta bu ste /
translated: In the same way, the store consciousness is like a place.

original: de na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa na gnas pa ni sgyu ma'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: de na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa na gnas pa ni sgyu ma'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The consciousnesses of the eye, etc., together with the afflictions, which reside in it, are like the illusory king.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rgyal po dbang dang ldan pa de bzhin du de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gzhan skye ba la dbang bas na rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dbang dang ldan pa de bzhin du de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gzhan skye ba la dbang bas na rgyal po lta bu'o //

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams sgyu ma'i rgyal po lta bu la /

analyzed: de'i 'khor gyi sems las byung ba rnams ni sgyu ma'i rgyal po'i 'khor lta bu ste / kun gzhi la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dge ba'i phyogs spangs pa ni sgyu ma'i rgyal po gcig gis gcig pham par byas pa lta bu yin no zhes byang chub sems dpa' gang gis khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos gnyis la nga
translated: The mental factors that are its retinue are like the retinue of an illusory king.üîΩThe afflictions that exist in foundation consciousness are like one illusory king defeating another.

translated: The supreme knowers, the Buddhas, have taught those conditioned

translated: the six internal sense spheres, the six external sense spheres, and the three, the Dharma of explanation, the Dharma of abiding in concentration, and the intentional assumption of existence,

analyzed: de yang 'du byed de dag dang dpe re res sbyar te bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de la mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du yang nang gi skye mched drug ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du yang nang gi skye mched drug ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The six internal sense spheres, from the eye sense sphere to the mind sense sphere, are like illusions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgyu ma'i glang po dang mig la sogs pa la bdag dang sems can dang srog med kyang bdag dang sems can srog lta bur snang ba de bzhin du nang gi skye mched drug la yang bdag dang sems can srog med mod kyi bdag sems can dang srog lta
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po dang mig la sogs pa la bdag dang sems can dang srog med kyang bdag dang sems can srog lta bur snang ba de bzhin du nang gi skye mched drug la yang bdag dang sems can srog med mod kyi bdag sems can dang srog lta
translated: In the same way, although the six inner sense bases do not have a self, sentient beings and life, they appear as if they are a self, sentient beings and life.

original: bur snang bas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: bur snang bas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore they are like an illusion.

original: gzugs nas chos kyi bar du phyi'i skye mched drug ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzugs nas chos kyi bar du phyi'i skye mched drug ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: The six outer sense bases from form to mental objects are like a dream.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rmi lam na snang ba'i gzugs dang sgra dang bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes par kun du longs spyod pa'i yul lta bur snang yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du da ltar dngos su gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnam parüîΩshes pa'i yul du snang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam na snang ba'i gzugs dang sgra dang bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes par kun du longs spyod pa'i yul lta bur snang yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du da ltar dngos su gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i yul du snang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the forms, sounds, women, men and so on that appear in a dream appear as objects that are enjoyed by consciousness but do not exist, in the same way, although forms, sounds and so on actually appear as objects of consciousness now, they do not exist.

original: rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore they are like a dream.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
translated: Mind and mental factors are like a mirage.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩA mirage is not water but appears as if it were water.

original: smig rgyu chur med kyang chu lta bur nor par byed pa de bzhin du sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag yod pa ma yin kyang sngon po ser po lta bur nor bar 'dzin pa'i phyir smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu chur med kyang chu lta bur nor par byed pa de bzhin du sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag yod pa ma yin kyang sngon po ser po lta bur nor bar 'dzin pa'i phyir smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: Likewise, although these things such as blue and yellow do not exist, they are apprehended as if they were blue and yellow, like a mirage.

original: yang mig gi skye mched nas yid @181b kyi skye mched kyi bar du nang gi skye mched drug ni gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang mig gi skye mched nas yid @181b kyi skye mched kyi bar du nang gi skye mched drug ni gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
translated: The six internal sense bases from the eye sense base to the mind sense base are like reflections.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩA reflection in a mirror does not exist but appears as if it were a reflection in a mirror due to the power of form.

original: me long gi nang gi gzugs brnyan yod pa ma yin yang gzugs kyi dbang gis me long gi nang du'ang gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du da ltar gyi nang gi skye mched drug po de dag kyang tshe snga ma'i las kyi dbang gis snang bas na gzugs
analyzed: me long gi nang gi gzugs brnyan yod pa ma yin yang gzugs kyi dbang gis me long gi nang du'ang gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du da ltar gyi nang gi skye mched drug po de dag kyang tshe snga ma'i las kyi dbang gis snang bas na gzugs
translated: Likewise, these six internal sense bases of the present appear due to the power of karma in a former life.

original: brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a reflection.

original: yang gzugs nas chos kyi bar du phyi'i skye mched drug ni mig yor lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang gzugs nas chos kyi bar du phyi'i skye mched drug ni mig yor lta bu ste /
translated: The six external sense-spheres, from visible form to dharmas, are like a reflected image.

original: mig yor zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir grib ma la bya'o //
analyzed: mig yor zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir grib ma la bya'o //
translated: In this context, a reflected image is a shadow.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gdugs dang lus la sogs pa'i dbang gis grib ma byung bde bzhin du phyi'i skye mched kyang nang gi skye mched kyi grib ma yin te /
analyzed: gdugs dang lus la sogs pa'i dbang gis grib ma byung bde bzhin du phyi'i skye mched kyang nang gi skye mched kyi grib ma yin te /
translated: Just as a shadow arises by the power of a parasol, a body, etc., so the external sense-spheres are the shadow of the internal sense-spheres.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pas ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pas ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug 'byung ngo //
translated: The six internal sense-spheres, eye, etc., arise from the consciousness of the store-consciousness.

original: de las ni phyi'i skye mched drug snang zhing 'byung bas na phyi'i skye mched drug ni mig yor lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las ni phyi'i skye mched drug snang zhing 'byung bas na phyi'i skye mched drug ni mig yor lta bu'o //
translated: Since the six external sense-spheres appear and arise from that, the six external sense-spheres are like a reflected image.

original: bshad pa'i chos thams cad ni brag ca lta bu ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos thams cad ni brag ca lta bu ste /
translated: All the taught dharmas are like an echo.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brag ca yang sgra'i rang bzhin du med mod kyi rna ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur zhing rna bas mnyan du yod pa dang 'dra bar ji snyed du de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin yang rna ba'i spyod yul
analyzed: brag ca yang sgra'i rang bzhin du med mod kyi rna ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur zhing rna bas mnyan du yod pa dang 'dra bar ji snyed du de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin yang rna ba'i spyod yul
translated: An echo is not a sound, but it is the object of the ear, and it is heard by the ear.üîΩIn the same way, although all things are not as they are described by the Tathagata, they are the object of the ear, and they are heard by the ear.

original: du 'gyur zhing rna bas mnyan du rung ba'i phyir brag ca lta bu'o //
analyzed: du 'gyur zhing rna bas mnyan du rung ba'i phyir brag ca lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, they are like an echo.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i chos rnams ni chu zla'i gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i chos rnams ni chu zla'i gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
translated: The dharmas of one who is in samadhi are like the reflection of the moon in water.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?üîΩThe reflection of the moon appears in water and earth.

original: chu dang sa pa'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan snang ba dang 'dra bar ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa ni chu dang sa pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chu dang sa pa'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan snang ba dang 'dra bar ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa ni chu dang sa pa lta bu ste /
translated: In the same way, the one-pointed samadhi is like water and earth.

original: de las mtha' dag skye mched dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams snang bas chu'i zla ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las mtha' dag skye mched dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams snang bas chu'i zla ba lta bu'o //
translated: From it, the bases of totality and the bases of overcoming appear. Therefore, it is like the moon in water.

original: bsams bzhin du srid par 'dzin pa ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par 'dzin pa ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: The taking up of existence through will is like a magical creation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dper na sprul ba gnas gcig nas gcig tu yang chags pa dang zhe sdang mi bskyed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du tshe gcig nas gcig tu len cing 'dzin kyang chags pa dang zhe sdang mi skye bas na sprul pa lta
analyzed: dper na sprul ba gnas gcig nas gcig tu yang chags pa dang zhe sdang mi bskyed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du tshe gcig nas gcig tu len cing 'dzin kyang chags pa dang zhe sdang mi skye bas na sprul pa lta
translated: Just as an emanation does not generate attachment or aversion when moving from one place to another, in the same way, a bodhisattva does not generate attachment or aversion when taking up and holding one life after another for the sake of sentient beings.

original: bu'o // shes bya'i yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bu'o // shes bya'i yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on the investigation of the knowable.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The knowable is twofold:

original: 'jig rten gyi chos dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos te /üîΩchos gang dag ni 'jig rten gyi chos /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos te / chos gang dag ni 'jig rten gyi chos /
translated: mundane dharmas and supramundane dharmas.üîΩWhat dharmas are mundane?

original: chos gang dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yin pa brtags @182a * //
analyzed: chos gang dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yin pa brtags @182a * //
translated: What dharmas are supramundane?

original: pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The two verses beginning with ‚Äúfalse imagination‚Äù explain this.

original: yang dag min rtog zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag min rtog zhes bya ba la /
translated: False imagination is the mundane.

original: yang dag pa ma yin la kun du rtog pa ni gang chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'thob pa'i rjes su mthun ba ma yin pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin la kun du rtog pa ni gang chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'thob pa'i rjes su mthun ba ma yin pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: Imagined reality is not real, but is imagined.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi sems can rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun du rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi sems can rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun du rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa zhes bya'o /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal refers to the imagination of the apprehended object and apprehending subject of sentient beings from the desire realm up to the summit of existence, which is not in conformity with the attainment of the expanse of reality and nonconceptual intuition.

original: yang dag min yang yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min yang yang dag min //
translated: The imagination of what is not real and not unreal

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the imagination of the ordinary person.

original: yang dag pa yang ma yin yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i rtog pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa nas brtsams te mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chadüîΩkyi rtog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa yang ma yin yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i rtog pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa nas brtsams te mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chad kyi rtog pa la bya ste /
translated: The imagination of what is not real and not unreal refers to the imagination of the ordinary person from the time of listening to and reflecting on the excellent teaching, and so on, up to the supreme mundane level of the stage of action in faith.

original: de'i tshe na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa yod pas na yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa yod pas na yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called not real because it has the imagination of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rtogs par bya ba dang rjes su mthun zhing de'i rgyu lta bur gnas pas na yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rtogs par bya ba dang rjes su mthun zhing de'i rgyu lta bur gnas pas na yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called neither correct nor incorrect because it is similar to and acts as a cause for the realization of the dharmadhatu and supramundane wisdom.

original: mi rtog ces bya ba la mi rtog pa ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtog ces bya ba la mi rtog pa ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Nonconceptual refers to the nonconceptual wisdom of the dharmadhatu suchness and supramundane wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de gnyis la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa med bas na mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrtog min mi rtog pa ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa med bas na mi rtog pa zhes bya'o // rtog min mi rtog pa ma yin //
translated: Because those two are called nonconceptual because they do not conceive of apprehended objects, apprehending subjects and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is neither conceptual nor nonconceptual.

original: rtog pa yang ma yin mi rtog pa yang ma yin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'i dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: rtog pa yang ma yin mi rtog pa yang ma yin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'i dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: It is neither conceptual nor nonconceptual refers to the pure mundane wisdom that is obtained subsequent to nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ye shes de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur rtog ba med pas na mi rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur rtog ba med pas na mi rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since there is no conception of such gnosis as subject and object, it is called nonconceptual.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni chos kyi dbyings la rtogs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni chos kyi dbyings la rtogs te /
translated: Nonconceptual gnosis realizes the dharmadhatu.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la ni dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs pas na gzung 'dzin du rtog pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la ni dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs pas na gzung 'dzin du rtog pa med do //
translated: And since nonconceptual gnosis is the object of pure mundane gnosis, there is no conception of subject and object.

original: mi rtog pa yang ma yin pa ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni chos thams cad la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur rtog pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtog pa yang ma yin pa ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni chos thams cad la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur rtog pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Nor is it nonconceptual, because it has the conception that the general and specific characteristics of phenomena are like illusions and mirages.

original: thams cad shes par bya ste brjod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad shes par bya ste brjod // ces bya ba la /
translated: All should be known and expressed.

original: bzhi po 'di thams cad ni shes par bya ba'i yul yin zhes brjod de /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di thams cad ni shes par bya ba'i yul yin zhes brjod de /
translated: All these four are said to be the objects of knowledge,

original: shes par bya ba yang de tsam las lhag pa med @182b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par bya ba yang de tsam las lhag pa med @182b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no more than that to be known.

original: de yang dag pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dag pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be known to be unreal.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses investigating the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Affliction, action, and birth are the thoroughly afflicted.

original: ji ltar na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: How is there affliction?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa brtag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa brtag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The investigation of the characteristics of affliction is called the investigation of the thoroughly afflicted.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa na rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa na rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: The noble path and nirvana are the completely purified.üîΩHow is there purification?

original: ji ltar na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa brtag pa ni rnam par byang ba yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa brtag pa ni rnam par byang ba yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The investigation of the characteristics of purification is called the investigation of the completely purified.

original: de gnyis btsal ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis btsal ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Two verses are taught for the investigation of those two.

original: rang gi khams las gnyis su snang //
analyzed: rang gi khams las gnyis su snang //
translated: From one's own realm, there is the appearance of duality.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: khams sa bon dang rgyu zhes bya ba ni don gcig ste /
analyzed: khams sa bon dang rgyu zhes bya ba ni don gcig ste /
translated: realm, seed, and cause are synonyms.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa ni rang gi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa ni rang gi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The store-consciousness together with the impressions of the grasped and grasper is called one's own realm.

original: gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags las gzung bar yang snang 'dzin par yang snang bas na gnyis su snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags las gzung bar yang snang 'dzin par yang snang bas na gnyis su snang ba'o //
translated: Since it appears as the grasped and the grasper from the impressions of the grasped and grasper, it is the appearance of duality.

original: ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig 'jug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig 'jug / ces bya ba la /
translated: It is associated with the passions and ignorance.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang bar yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang bar yang ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only the appearance of the grasped and grasper.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i dus na ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa lhan cig 'byung zhing snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i dus na ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa lhan cig 'byung zhing snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the time of the appearance of the grasped and grasper, ignorance and the passions arise together and appear. This is the meaning.

original: 'jug ces bya ba'i don ni de ltar snang ba las 'khor bar skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug ces bya ba'i don ni de ltar snang ba las 'khor bar skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the word associated is that, since it appears in this way, it is born in samsara. This is the meaning.

original: de lam rig pa ni ma rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lam rig pa ni ma rig pa nyid do //
translated: The path of ignorance is ignorance itself.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgras ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig ba dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgras ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig ba dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste /
translated: The word passions refers to desire, anger, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: nyon mongs pa drug la bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug la bya ba'am /
translated: The six afflictions are meant,üîΩor the ten afflictions: desire, anger, pride, ignorance, the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, wrong view, the esteeming of views, the esteeming of morality and asceticism, and

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang /üîΩthe tshom ste nyon mongs pa bcu la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang / the tshom ste nyon mongs pa bcu la bya'o //
translated: doubt.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa smos kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang dngos sum smos kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang smos pa lta bur bstan to //üîΩnyon mongs pa drug dang / bcu'i nang du ma rig pa yang 'dus mod kyi ma rig pa bkar te logs shig tu smos pa ni nyon mongs @183a * //
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa smos kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang dngos sum smos kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang smos pa lta bur bstan to // nyon mongs pa drug dang / bcu'i nang du ma rig pa yang 'dus mod kyi ma rig pa bkar te logs shig tu smos pa ni nyon mongs @183a * //
translated: Here, although the secondary afflictions and the ten envelopers are not explicitly mentioned, they are taught as if they were mentioned, since the afflictions are mentioned.

original: pa thams cad la dbang byed par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa thams cad la dbang byed par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although ignorance is included among the six and the ten afflictions, ignorance is mentioned separately in order to teach that it is the master of all the afflictions.

original: rmongs pa med pa la ni nyon mongs pa mi skye rmongs pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa la ni nyon mongs pa mi skye rmongs pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Afflictions do not arise in the absence of delusion, because afflictions arise from delusion.

original: rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Conceptualization arises.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa lta bur gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa na ma rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / lhan cig tu rtog pa 'byung ba la rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa lta bur gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa na ma rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / lhan cig tu rtog pa 'byung ba la rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, when there is the conceptualization of subject and object, like form, sound, and so on, the arising of conceptualization is called the arising of conceptualization.

original: rang gi khams las gnyis su snang ba zhes bya bas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa la rtog pa bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi khams las gnyis su snang ba zhes bya bas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa la rtog pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe appearance of duality from one‚Äôs own realm‚Äù indicates the conceptualization that is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig 'jug / ces bya bas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la rtog pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig 'jug / ces bya bas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la rtog pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúco-arising with ignorance and the afflictions‚Äù indicates the conceptualization that is the afflictive obscuration.

original: rdzas gnyis dag ni rnam par spangs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas gnyis dag ni rnam par spangs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two substances are completely abandoned.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang yang rdzas gnyis rnam par spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang yang rdzas gnyis rnam par spangs pa yin te /
translated: Here, although there is the appearance of subject and object, the two substances are completely abandoned.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin yang med 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin yang med 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no intrinsic nature of the apprehended and there is no intrinsic nature of the apprehender.

original: de ltar shes na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su btsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shes na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su btsal ba yin no //
translated: If one knows that, one has investigated the characteristics of the afflictions.üîΩObtaining a special object

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa yi //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa yi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The special attainment of the object.üîΩüîΩ

original: gang gong du chos kyi dmigs pa thob pa bshad pa nyid dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gong du chos kyi dmigs pa thob pa bshad pa nyid dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Obtaining a special object is called obtaining the object of Dharma that was explained above.

original: de yang so so'i skye bo'i dus nas nyan pa dang sems pa byed pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de yang so so'i skye bo'i dus nas nyan pa dang sems pa byed pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, from the time of being an ordinary person, beginning with listening and reflecting,

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa chos mchog man chad nas chos thams cad ni sems las gyur pa yin no zhes shes pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par thob ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa chos mchog man chad nas chos thams cad ni sems las gyur pa yin no zhes shes pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par thob ba zhes bya ste /
translated: knowing that all phenomena are mental is called obtaining a special object, from the stage of devoted engagement up to the supreme mundane state.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa'i gang zag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa'i gang zag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that a person who has obtained a special object.

original: rang gi khams nas zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa'i las bstan te rnam par rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang gi khams dang rgyu'i chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi khams nas zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa'i las bstan te rnam par rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang gi khams dang rgyu'i chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid de /
translated: One‚Äôs own realm indicates the function of attaining the first stage, because the realm of the wisdom of imagination is the reality of the Dharma-element, the cause.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma-element is called a realm because it is the cause of the arising of all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de bas na dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang mngon pa'i chos bsdu ba las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang mngon pa'i chos bsdu ba las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga and the Abhidharmasamuccaya explain:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyu thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na khams zhes bya'o zhes bshad de //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyu thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na khams zhes bya'o zhes bshad de //
translated: It is called a realm because it is the cause of the arising of all the causes of the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, pratyekabuddha, and Buddha.

original: gnas pa ni ming gi phung po bzhi la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni ming gi phung po bzhi la gnas pa ste /
translated: Abiding is abiding in the four aggregates of form, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs nas /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du gnyis su @183b med par gnas pa ni ming la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du gnyis su @183b med par gnas pa ni ming la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: abiding in the non-duality of the nature of the Dharma-element is called abiding in name.

original: don du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnyed nas ming la gnas bar gzhag go //
analyzed: don du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnyed nas ming la gnas bar gzhag go //
translated: In fact, having attained nonconceptual gnosis, one should rest in the name.

original: rnal 'byor phyir zhes pa la rnal 'byor ni goms bar byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor phyir zhes pa la rnal 'byor ni goms bar byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The yogi/nƒ´, because of yoga. Yoga is taken to mean familiarization.

original: sa dang por rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnyed nas sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad bsgom pa'i lam na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid la bsgom pa'am zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa la bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor paüîΩzhes bya'o // de nyid gnyis med snang 'jug pa //
analyzed: sa dang por rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnyed nas sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad bsgom pa'i lam na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid la bsgom pa'am zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa la bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor pa zhes bya'o // de nyid gnyis med snang 'jug pa //
translated: Having attained nonconceptual gnosis on the first ground, from the second ground up to the tenth ground, the path of meditation is the meditation on that very nonconceptual gnosis or the meditation on the union of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is called ‚Äúyoga.‚ÄùüîΩThen, at the time of the buddha ground, having transformed the basis, that very nonconceptual mind is free from nonconceptuality and becomes nonconceptual.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na gnas gzhan du gyur nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang bral te rnam par mi rtog par gyur nas gnyis su med pa mngon sum du byas pa ni gnyis med snang 'jug pa
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na gnas gzhan du gyur nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang bral te rnam par mi rtog par gyur nas gnyis su med pa mngon sum du byas pa ni gnyis med snang 'jug pa
translated: The direct realization of nonduality is the engagement of the appearance of nonduality.

original: zhes bya'o // des na sems rnam pa grol ba dang shes rab rnam par grol ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // des na sems rnam pa grol ba dang shes rab rnam par grol ba 'thob ste /
translated: Thus, one attains the liberation of mind and the liberation of wisdom.

original: de phan chad nams kyang gnyis su snang ba la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de phan chad nams kyang gnyis su snang ba la mi 'jug go //
translated: From that point on, one never engages in dualistic appearances.

original: dper na ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the example, it says:

original: mda' dang pags pa bzhin du'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mda' dang pags pa bzhin du'o // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like an arrow and like leather.

original: dper na mda' mes bsregs na drod la bab par byas te /
analyzed: dper na mda' mes bsregs na drod la bab par byas te /
translated: For example, when an arrow is heated by fire, it is made pliable.

original: drang bor bsrang ba de nams kyang phyis yon por 'gyur ba dang / bags pa khengs pa /
analyzed: drang bor bsrang ba de nams kyang phyis yon por 'gyur ba dang / bags pa khengs pa /
translated: When it is straightened, it will never become crooked again.

original: chu dang mar la sogs pas bskus nas rtsis zhen par byas te /
analyzed: chu dang mar la sogs pas bskus nas rtsis zhen par byas te /
translated: When leather is moistened with water, oil, and so forth, it is made pliable.üîΩWhen it is stretched on a frame, it will never become swollen and rough again.

original: 'jam por byas na phyis khengs shing rtsub por mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du zhi gnas ni chu dang snum lta bu /
analyzed: 'jam por byas na phyis khengs shing rtsub por mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du zhi gnas ni chu dang snum lta bu /
translated: In the same way, ≈õamatha is like water and oil.

original: sngon 'dod chags dang zhe snang la sogs pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pas sems rtsub por byas ba bsgom pa'i lam na zhi gnas chu dang snum lta bur bsgom pas sems gnyen por byas te /
analyzed: sngon 'dod chags dang zhe snang la sogs pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pas sems rtsub por byas ba bsgom pa'i lam na zhi gnas chu dang snum lta bur bsgom pas sems gnyen por byas te /
translated: Previously, by improper conceptualization of attachment, hostility, and so on, the mind was made rough. On the path of meditation, by cultivating serenity and insight like water and oil, the mind is made gentle.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar sems rnam par grol ba thob na slar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rtog pa la zhugs na sems khengs pa dang rtsub po rnams su nams kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar sems rnam par grol ba thob na slar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rtog pa la zhugs na sems khengs pa dang rtsub po rnams su nams kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one attains the mind completely liberated on the Buddha ground, the mind never again becomes inflated or rough, even if one engages in improper mental activity.

original: sngon las dang po'i tshe na yod pa dang med pa dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta ba ngan pas lta ba yon por byas pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi dus na lhag mthong bsgom pa'i mes lta ba ngan pa bsal te /
analyzed: sngon las dang po'i tshe na yod pa dang med pa dang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta ba ngan pas lta ba yon por byas pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi dus na lhag mthong bsgom pa'i mes lta ba ngan pa bsal te /
translated: Previously, when one was a beginner, one had a crooked view by viewing things such as existence and nonexistence, permanence and impermanence, and so on. On the path of meditation, the fire of cultivating insight eliminates the crooked view.

original: lta ba drang por byas nas sangs rgyas kyi sar shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pa na de phan chad nams kyang lta ba ngan pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba drang por byas nas sangs rgyas kyi sar shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pa na de phan chad nams kyang lta ba ngan pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having straightened out one‚Äôs view, when one attains the level of buddhahood, the perfection of wisdom is liberated. The meaning is that from then on one will never again engage in bad views.

original: rnam par byang ba'i @184a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i @184a * //
translated: Having straightened out the view, when one attains the liberation of wisdom on the Buddha ground, it means that from then on one will never again engage in bad views.

original: mtshan nyid de ltar btsal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de ltar btsal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of purification should be sought in that way.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam yongs su btsal ba la tshigs su bcad ba gnyis te zhes bya ba la /üîΩrnam par rig pa tsam gyi sgras ni sems las byung ba rnams kyang gzung ste /üîΩtsam gyi sgras ni sems las byung ba tsam du zad kyi phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs yod pa ma yin par 'gog go //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam yongs su btsal ba la tshigs su bcad ba gnyis te zhes bya ba la / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi sgras ni sems las byung ba rnams kyang gzung ste / tsam gyi sgras ni sems las byung ba tsam du zad kyi phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs yod pa ma yin par 'gog go //
translated: Two verses investigating mere representation.üîΩThe term mere representation also includes mental factors.üîΩThe term mere indicates that there are only mental factors, and it refutes the existence of external form and so on.

original: sems tsam du smra ba kha cig ni rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya bas sems tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: sems tsam du smra ba kha cig ni rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya bas sems tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Some proponents of mind only say that mere representation means that there is only mind, and that external form does not exist.

original: sems las ma gtogs par sems las byung ba'i chos dang phyi'i yul rnams med kyang med par 'dod do //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs par sems las byung ba'i chos dang phyi'i yul rnams med kyang med par 'dod do //
translated: The mental factors and external objects do not exist apart from mind, but they are not held to be nonexistent.

original: 'di'i skabs su de gnyi ga la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su de gnyi ga la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: In this context, both are held to be objects of the mind.

original: khams gsum thams cad ni sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad kyi phyi'i chos med do zhes brtag cing shes par bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad ni sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad kyi phyi'i chos med do zhes brtag cing shes par bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Two verses on the investigation and understanding that the entire threefold world is merely mind and mental factors, and that external reality does not exist

original: sems ni gnyis su rab tu snang //
analyzed: sems ni gnyis su rab tu snang //
translated: Mind appears as a duality,

original: zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ;
translated: but that duality does not exist.

original: sems kyi sgras ni kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi sgras ni kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba rnams la bya ste /
translated: The word mind refers to the consciousnesses, such as the store consciousness, and to the mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su snang bar zad kyi sems las logs shig na med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su snang bar zad kyi sems las logs shig na med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the appearance of the duality of subject and object is merely the mind and mental factors, and that they do not exist apart from the mind.

original: yang na sems nyid gzung 'dzin du snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: yang na sems nyid gzung 'dzin du snang bar zad kyi /
translated: Or else, the mind itself appears as subject and object.

original: de las ma gtogs par sems las byung ba dang / gzung 'dzin med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs par sems las byung ba dang / gzung 'dzin med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Apart from that, there are no mental factors and no subject-object dichotomy.

original: de bzhin chags la sogs pa snang bar 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin chags la sogs pa snang bar 'dod //
translated: Likewise, attachment and so forth are held to appear.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa sems las snang ba de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs ba'i chos kyang sems nyid la snang bar 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa sems las snang ba de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs ba'i chos kyang sems nyid la snang bar 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as subject and object appear from the mind, so also the phenomena of defilement such as attachment are held to appear in the mind itself.

original: dad pa la sogs par snang yang //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs par snang yang //
translated: Faith and so forth appear,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams kyang sems nyid la snang bar 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩnyon mongs dge chos yod ma yin //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams kyang sems nyid la snang bar 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to // nyon mongs dge chos yod ma yin //
translated: Even the virtuous phenomena such as faith are held to appear in the mind itself.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are no defiled or virtuous phenomena.

original: sems nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos kyang sems la snang bar zad kyi sems ma gtogs pa logs shig na dmigs pa'i yul lta bur yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos kyang sems la snang bar zad kyi sems ma gtogs pa logs shig na dmigs pa'i yul lta bur yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that from the mind itself, afflictions such as desire and virtuous phenomena such as faith appear to the mind, but apart from the mind, they do not exist as objects of observation.

original: sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa'i mtshan @184b nyid du ni sems las byung ba rnams med pa ma yin bar 'dod do //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa'i mtshan @184b nyid du ni sems las byung ba rnams med pa ma yin bar 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that mental factors do not exist apart from the mind as characteristics that possess the mind.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba gnyis pa ltar na ni sems nyid la sa nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba lta bur snang gi sems las ma gtogs par sems las byung ba yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba gnyis pa ltar na ni sems nyid la sa nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba lta bur snang gi sems las ma gtogs par sems las byung ba yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: According to the second proponent of vij√±aptimƒÅtra, the mind itself appears as afflictions and virtues like mental factors, but apart from the mind, it is asserted that mental factors do not exist.

original: sems nyid sna tshogs snang ba ste //
analyzed: sems nyid sna tshogs snang ba ste //
translated: The mind itself appears as various things.

original: zhes bya ba la kun gzhi nyid rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la kun gzhi nyid rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ste /
translated: The meaning of that is that the foundation consciousness itself appears as various aspects.

original: 'dod chags su snang ba dang / gti mug tu snang ba dang / zhe sdang du snang ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos su snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsna tshogs pa yi rnam par 'jug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags su snang ba dang / gti mug tu snang ba dang / zhe sdang du snang ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos su snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // sna tshogs pa yi rnam par 'jug / ces bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúappear as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate phenomena‚Äù is that they appear as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate phenomena.

original: sems nyid dus gcig tu dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs ting nge 'dzin lta bur snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems nyid dus gcig tu dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs ting nge 'dzin lta bur snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúappear in various ways‚Äù is that they appear as faith, effort, wisdom, meditative stabilization, and so forth.

original: snang ba dngos dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snang ba dngos dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúappear as entities and nonentities‚Äù is that they appear as entities and nonentities.

original: sems las 'dod chags la sogs par snang ba dang / dad pa la sogs par snang ba yang snang ba tsam du yod pas na snang ba tsam gyi dngos por ni yod pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdngos po med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems las 'dod chags la sogs par snang ba dang / dad pa la sogs par snang ba yang snang ba tsam du yod pas na snang ba tsam gyi dngos por ni yod pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdngos po med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúappear as entities‚Äù is that they appear as entities that exist merely as appearances, such as desire and so forth that appear from the mind, and faith and so forth that appear from the mind.üîΩThe meaning of the phrase ‚Äúappear as nonentities‚Äù is that they appear as nonentities that exist merely as appearances, such as the nonexistence of desire and so forth that appear from the mind, and the nonexistence of faith and so forth that appear from the mind.

original: snang ba tsam du yod kyang 'dod chags dang dad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam du yod kyang 'dod chags dang dad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Although they exist as mere appearances, since desire, faith, etc. do not exist in reality, they are called ‚Äúunreal.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / de la chos kyi min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la chos kyi min zhes bya ba la /
translated: in that, there is no reality of things.

original: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dang pa la sogs pa snang ba tsam du yod kyi dngos po med pas na gzhan dbang de la chos de dag gi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dang pa la sogs pa snang ba tsam du yod kyi dngos po med pas na gzhan dbang de la chos de dag gi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Thus, desire, etc. and faith, etc. exist as mere appearances, but since they are unreal, there is no reality of those things in that relative reality.

original: snang ba tsam de la snang yang chos kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba tsam de la snang yang chos kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, although they appear as mere appearances, there is no reality of things in that mere appearance. This is the meaning.

original: mtshan nyid yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are eight verses on the investigation of characteristics.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de brtag pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa brgyad kyis ston te //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de brtag pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa brgyad kyis ston te //
translated: In order to investigate the characteristics of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, and the characteristics of contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena, he teaches with eight verses.

original: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang mdor na mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid dang mtshon byed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang mdor na mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid dang mtshon byed dang gsum mo //
translated: In brief, the characteristics of those phenomena are threefold: the characterized, the characteristic, and the characteristic-mark.

original: gcig gis ni mdor bstan to //
analyzed: gcig gis ni mdor bstan to //
translated: One verse summarizes.

original: lhag mas ni bshad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag mas ni bshad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rest explain.

original: tshigs bcad brgyad las tshigs bcad dang pos ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mdor bstan to //üîΩtshigs @185a * //
analyzed: tshigs bcad brgyad las tshigs bcad dang pos ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mdor bstan to // tshigs @185a * //
translated: Among the eight verses, the first verse summarizes the characteristics of phenomena.üîΩThe remaining seven verses

original: bcad lhag ma bdun gyis ni mdor bstan pa'i don de nyid rgyas par zhib du 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcad lhag ma bdun gyis ni mdor bstan pa'i don de nyid rgyas par zhib du 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: explain in detail the meaning that was summarized.

original: mtshon bya dang ni mtshan nyid dang // mtshon byed rab tu dbye bas ni //
analyzed: mtshon bya dang ni mtshan nyid dang // mtshon byed rab tu dbye bas ni //
translated: The characterized, the characteristic, and the characteristic-mark,

original: sems can rnams la phang dags phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phang dags phyir //
translated: are distinguished in order to delight sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bshad //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bshad // ces bya ba la /
translated: The Buddhas have fully explained them.

original: mtshon cha rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshon cha rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds of symbols are:

original: gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas te 'di ni mtshan nyid gsum gyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas te 'di ni mtshan nyid gsum gyi gzhi yin no //
translated: form, mind, mental functions, the motivating dispositions not associated with mind, and the uncompounded. These are the bases of the three realities.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three kinds of reality are:

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the imagined, the interdependent, and the fulfilled.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds of reality are:

original: gzhi dang / 'jog pa dang / snang ba dang / me long dang / gnas so //
analyzed: gzhi dang / 'jog pa dang / snang ba dang / me long dang / gnas so //
translated: the base, the placement, the appearance, the mirror, and the abode.

original: de gsum phye ste bstan na ni mtha' yas te mdo tsam du na rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: de gsum phye ste bstan na ni mtha' yas te mdo tsam du na rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
translated: If these three are analyzed and explained, they are infinite. But in brief, they are established as three.

original: de la mtshon bya dang / mtshan nyid gnyis ni shes par bya ba'i yul lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la mtshon bya dang / mtshan nyid gnyis ni shes par bya ba'i yul lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, the symbolized and the reality of the symbol are like the object to be known.

original: mtshon byed ni shes par bya ba'i ye shes te /
analyzed: mtshon byed ni shes par bya ba'i ye shes te /
translated: The reality of the symbol is the knowledge that knows the object to be known.

original: de bas na 'og nas kyang mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid gnyis mtshon par byed cing shes par byed pas na mtshon byed ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'og nas kyang mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid gnyis mtshon par byed cing shes par byed pas na mtshon byed ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòindicating‚Äô is used because it indicates and causes the indicated object and the characteristic to be known.‚Äù

original: mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid dang mtshon byed gsum ni ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid dang mtshon byed gsum ni ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the three‚Äîthe indicated object, the characteristic, and the indicating‚Äîtaught?

original: de gsum yang sems can la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de gsum yang sems can la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: These three are taught by the Buddha in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bshad de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
