analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bshad de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: mtshon bya bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshon bya bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the indicated object,

original: sems gang lta bar bcas pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems gang lta bar bcas pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe mind that is accompanied by views,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems kyi sgras ni rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi sgras ni rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs bstan pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúmind‚Äù indicates consciousness, and ‚Äúaccompanied by views‚Äù indicates form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems 'di rnam pa gnyis su snang ste /
analyzed: sems 'di rnam pa gnyis su snang ste /
translated: This mind appears in two aspects:

original: gzung bar snang ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzung bar snang ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba'o //
translated: it appears as the apprehended object and it appears as the apprehending subject.

original: de la dbang po lnga dang yul lnga lta bur snang ba ni gzung bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po lnga dang yul lnga lta bur snang ba ni gzung bar snang ba ste /
translated: Among these, that which appears as the five sense faculties and the five sense objects is the appearance as the apprehended object.

original: des ni gzugs bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gzugs bstan to //
translated: This indicates form.

original: 'dzin par snang ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug du snang ste /
analyzed: 'dzin par snang ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug du snang ste /
translated: The appearance of grasping is the six consciousnesses, from the eye consciousness to the mind consciousness.

original: des ni sems bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems bstan to //
translated: This indicates the mind.

original: lta bar bcas zhes bya ba'i lta ba'i sgras ni sems las byung ba rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: lta bar bcas zhes bya ba'i lta ba'i sgras ni sems las byung ba rnams la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúview‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúalong with the views‚Äù refers to the mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba rnams la ci'i phyir lta ba zhes bya ba zhen /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams la ci'i phyir lta ba zhes bya ba zhen /
translated: Why are the mental factors called ‚Äúviews‚Äù?

original: sems las byung ba thams cad ni gsal zhing rgod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad ni gsal zhing rgod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: All mental factors are by nature clear and active, so they are called ‚Äúviews.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni sems las byung @185b ba'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems las byung @185b ba'i chos bstan to //
translated: This indicates the mental factors.

original: de'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand their bases‚Äù meansüîΩthe bases.

original: de'i gnas zhes bya ba la sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bstan te /
analyzed: de'i gnas zhes bya ba la sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bstan te /
translated: The bases are the formations that are not associated with the mind.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang sems dang gzugs dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs las byung bas na de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang sems dang gzugs dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs las byung bas na de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the formations that are not associated with the mind arise from the states of the mind, form, and the mental factors, they are called ‚Äútheir bases.‚Äù

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: nam gzugs dang sems las byung ba gsum 'dus nas bsgribs te /
analyzed: nam gzugs dang sems las byung ba gsum 'dus nas bsgribs te /
translated: When form and the three mental factors are combined, they obscure the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe meditative attainment of cessation is the cessation of mind and mental factors that is other than the cessation of form.üîΩThe five aggregates that are produced are called birth.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'gog pa'i gzugs las 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang / phung po lnga skyes pa la skye ba zhes bya ba dang / gzugs kyi phung po skra dkar la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du gyur pa la rga ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'gog pa'i gzugs las 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang / phung po lnga skyes pa la skye ba zhes bya ba dang / gzugs kyi phung po skra dkar la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du gyur pa la rga ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The transformation of the form aggregate into the characteristics of white hair and so on is called aging.

original: de ltar na de gsum gyi gnas la 'du byed sems dang mi ldan par gdags par zad do //üîΩmi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na de gsum gyi gnas la 'du byed sems dang mi ldan par gdags par zad do // mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus these three are merely imputed to be formations that do not possess mind.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni 'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / ma brtags par 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni 'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / ma brtags par 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
translated: The unchanging is unconditioned space, analytical cessation, nonanalytical cessation and suchness.

original: 'dus ma byas la ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is unconditioned space called unchanging?

original: rnam par rig pa 'di las nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'dus ma byas su snang la /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di las nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'dus ma byas su snang la /
translated: Unconditioned space appears from this consciousness.

original: sems la snang ba'i nam mkha' la sogs pa mi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba med pas na 'dus ma byas la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems la snang ba'i nam mkha' la sogs pa mi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba med pas na 'dus ma byas la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Space, etc. that appear to the mind are not produced and do not perish, and so are not subject to change. Thus, they are called ‚Äúuncompounded and unchanging.‚Äù

original: de ni mdor na mtshon bya yin //
analyzed: de ni mdor na mtshon bya yin //
translated: In brief, they are the objects of illustration.

original: rab tu dbye ba tshad med do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba tshad med do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their divisions are limitless.

original: mdo tsam du na gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas lnga ni mtshon bya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo tsam du na gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang / 'dus ma byas lnga ni mtshon bya zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, the five‚Äîform, mind, mental factors, formations not associated with mind, and the uncompounded‚Äîare called ‚Äúobjects of illustration.‚Äù

original: lnga po de'i mtshan nyid re re nas phye nas ni dpag tu med pas tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po de'i mtshan nyid re re nas phye nas ni dpag tu med pas tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since their characteristics are divided into limitless categories, they are said to be ‚Äúlimitless.‚Äù

original: lnga po de ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gnas dang / rten yin pas na mtshon bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lnga po de ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gnas dang / rten yin pas na mtshon bya zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these five are the bases and supports of the three kinds of characteristics, they are called ‚Äúobjects of illustration.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsmra don ji bzhin 'du shes kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir / smra don ji bzhin 'du shes kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to explain the characteristics, he says:üîΩThe characteristics of the object of speech are the signs of the discriminations.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of characteristics.

original: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid dang / gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid dang / gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic, the other-dependent characteristic, and the perfected characteristic.

original: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The imagined characteristic is also threefold.

original: de bum pa dang snam bu zhes brjod pa ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: de bum pa dang snam bu zhes brjod pa ni smra ba'o //
translated: The expression is the statement ‚Äúpot‚Äù or ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: bum ba dang snam bu ni don to //
analyzed: bum ba dang snam bu ni don to //
translated: The object is the pot or the cloth.

original: ji bzhin gyi 'du shes ni sems las byung ba'i chos te /üîΩ'di ni bum pa nyid yin gyi 'di ni snam @186a * //
analyzed: ji bzhin gyi 'du shes ni sems las byung ba'i chos te / 'di ni bum pa nyid yin gyi 'di ni snam @186a * //
translated: The conception is the mental factor that thinks,

original: bu ma yin pa dang / 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ma yin zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bu ma yin pa dang / 'di ni sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ma yin zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is a pot, not a cloth,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is blue, not yellow.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma'i 'du shes pa'i yul du gyur pa bum ba dang snam bu dang ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'du shes pa'i yul du gyur pa bum ba dang snam bu dang ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa ste /
translated: The sign is the object that is the basis of the conception, such as a pot, a cloth, blue, yellow, and so on.

original: yul gang la brten nas 'du shes 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yul gang la brten nas 'du shes 'jug pa'o //
translated: The object is the basis on which the conception operates.

original: don du na tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams snam bu dang bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa la 'di ni bum pa 'di ni snam bu zhes rtog pa dang / rtog pa de'i yul bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: don du na tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams snam bu dang bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa la 'di ni bum pa 'di ni snam bu zhes rtog pa dang / rtog pa de'i yul bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: and the objects of that thought, the pot, the cloth, etc. are called the imagined identity.

original: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the one kind of imagined identity.

original: de'i bag chags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i bag chags zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the habitual propensities for that,

original: smra don ji bzhin gyi 'du shes kyi mtshan ma la de zhes rtog ste /
analyzed: smra don ji bzhin gyi 'du shes kyi mtshan ma la de zhes rtog ste /
translated: one thinks of them as the signs of the discriminations of the literal meanings.

original: de'i bag chags kun gzhi la rlan pa yang nam zhig na smra don ji bzhin gyi 'du shes 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na bag chags la yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i bag chags kun gzhi la rlan pa yang nam zhig na smra don ji bzhin gyi 'du shes 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na bag chags la yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The habitual propensities that are moistened in the fundamental consciousness also act as the cause for the arising of the discriminations of the literal meanings, so the habitual propensities are also called the imagined identity.

original: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of imagined identity.

original: de las kyang ni don snang ba //
analyzed: de las kyang ni don snang ba //
translated: And from that, the appearance of objects

original: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is the imagined identity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for that,

original: bag chags las nam tha snyad la mi mkhas pa byis pa rnams la ske dang sdeng sdeng po lto zlum po 'di la ming du bum pa zhes bya'o zhes smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes med par yang sems las bum pa lta bur snang la
analyzed: bag chags las nam tha snyad la mi mkhas pa byis pa rnams la ske dang sdeng sdeng po lto zlum po 'di la ming du bum pa zhes bya'o zhes smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes med par yang sems las bum pa lta bur snang la
translated: Just as a person who is not skilled in conventions, a child, is told, ‚ÄúThis round thing that is called a pot,‚Äù and without the idea of the meaning of the word, the mind appears as a pot,

original: / bum pa nyid yin par ni mi shes kyi bum pa mthong na ni 'di ci zhig yin no snyam par rtog pa 'byung na yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: / bum pa nyid yin par ni mi shes kyi bum pa mthong na ni 'di ci zhig yin no snyam par rtog pa 'byung na yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: and although one does not know it to be a pot, when one sees a pot, the thought ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù arises, that is the imagined characteristic.

original: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the threefold imagined characteristic.

original: de tshigs bcad de'i don mdor bsdus na /
analyzed: de tshigs bcad de'i don mdor bsdus na /
translated: The meaning of that verse in brief is this:

original: gang kun du rtog pa dang / rgyu gang las kun du rtog pa gnyis ka kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: gang kun du rtog pa dang / rgyu gang las kun du rtog pa gnyis ka kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid yin par ston to //
translated: Both the imagination and the cause of imagination are taught to be the imagined characteristic.

original: gang kun du rtog ce na tha snyad la mkhas pas 'di bum pa yin no zhes rtog pa dang / tha snyad la mi mkhas pas bum pa mthong ba na 'di ci zhig yin zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang kun du rtog ce na tha snyad la mkhas pas 'di bum pa yin no zhes rtog pa dang / tha snyad la mi mkhas pas bum pa mthong ba na 'di ci zhig yin zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: What is imagined? The expert in terminology imagines it to be a pot, and the one who is not an expert in terminology imagines it to be something when he sees a pot.

original: rgyu gang las kun du rtog pa de ni de'i bag chags las kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang las kun du rtog pa de ni de'i bag chags las kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The cause from which the imagination arises is the latent impressions of that.

original: smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes pa'i mtshan ma dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes pa'i mtshan ma dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sign of the perception of the meaning of the expression just as it is.

original: smra ba ni bum pa dang snam bu zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni bum pa dang snam bu zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression is the utterance ‚Äúpot‚Äù or ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: ji bzhin ba'i don gyi 'du shes ni bum pa zhes bya ba'i ming gi don ni lto zlum po ske sdeng sdeng po yin no zhes ming dang don du 'brel par shes shing rtog ste /
analyzed: ji bzhin ba'i don gyi 'du shes ni bum pa zhes bya ba'i ming gi don ni lto zlum po ske sdeng sdeng po yin no zhes ming dang don du 'brel par shes shing rtog ste /
translated: The perception of the meaning just as it is is the understanding and imagination that the meaning of the name ‚Äúpot‚Äù is a round belly with a narrow neck.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni 'du shes @186b de'i yul bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni 'du shes @186b de'i yul bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The sign of that perception is the object of that perception, such as a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one aspect of the characteristic of the imagined.

original: smra ba de yi bag chags dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba de yi bag chags dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The latent impressions of that expression.

original: smra ba'i sa bon kun gzhi la bsags te yod pa de yang nam zhig na rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pas na kun brtags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i sa bon kun gzhi la bsags te yod pa de yang nam zhig na rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pas na kun brtags zhes bya ste /
translated: The seed of speech is stored in the alaya, and that is also called imagined because it is the cause of discursive thought.

original: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two aspects of the characteristic of the imagined.

original: bag chags de las don gang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag chags de las don gang zhes bya ba la /
translated: From that habitual tendency, an object appears.

original: smra ba'i bag chags kun gzhi la bsags pa de las tha snyad mi mkhas pa rnams la bum pa dang snam bu lta bur snang ba yang kun brtags zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smra ba'i bag chags kun gzhi la bsags pa de las tha snyad mi mkhas pa rnams la bum pa dang snam bu lta bur snang ba yang kun brtags zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that from the habitual tendency of speech stored in the alaya, a pot and cloth appear to those unskilled in conventions, and that is also called imagined.

original: gang tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams las zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: gang tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams las zhes bya ba las /
translated: From that, the appearance of the name arises.üîΩFrom that, the appearance of the name arises.üîΩThe meaning is that from the habitual tendency of speech stored in the alaya, the name pot appears to those unskilled in conventions.

original: bum pa'i sgra ni lto dang zlum po la bya'o zhes bum ba'i ming dang don du 'brel pa ni mi shes pa'i byis pa shed ma bye ba rnams ni tha snyad la mi mkhas pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i sgra ni lto dang zlum po la bya'o zhes bum ba'i ming dang don du 'brel pa ni mi shes pa'i byis pa shed ma bye ba rnams ni tha snyad la mi mkhas pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The sound pot refers to a round container, and the connection between the name pot and its meaning is not understood by immature beings who have not yet developed the ability to understand such things. They are called unskilled in conventions.

original: smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes med par yang snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes med par yang snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even without the discernment of the meaning of expressions, there would be appearance.

original: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams la bum pa mthong ba na 'di ni bum pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes brjod pa med par yang bum pa mthong ba na'ang ci zhig yin no snyam du rtog pas yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes
analyzed: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams la bum pa mthong ba na 'di ni bum pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes brjod pa med par yang bum pa mthong ba na'ang ci zhig yin no snyam du rtog pas yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes
translated: With regard to those unskilled in conventions, when they see a pot, without saying ‚ÄúThis is a pot, not something else,‚Äù when they see a pot, they think ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù Therefore, it is the imagined characteristic.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la ji ltar brjod pa'i don gyi 'du shes ni sems las byung ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar brjod pa'i don gyi 'du shes ni sems las byung ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the discernment of the meaning of expressions, it is a mental factor.

original: smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes zhes bya ba'i don 'chad de bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par brjod pa'i bum pa dang snam bu'i dngos po mthong nas 'di ni bum pa yin gyi snam bu ma yin no zhes rtog pa ni sems lasüîΩbyung ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes zhes bya ba'i don 'chad de bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par brjod pa'i bum pa dang snam bu'i dngos po mthong nas 'di ni bum pa yin gyi snam bu ma yin no zhes rtog pa ni sems lasüîΩbyung ba'i chos yin te /
translated: This explains the meaning of the term discernment of the meaning of expressions as they are expressed. When one sees the entity of a pot or cloth that is expressed as a pot or cloth, the thought ‚ÄúThis is a pot, not cloth‚Äù is a phenomenon that is a mental factor.

original: de ltar rtog pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos smra ba ji bzhin pa'i don gyi 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a conception is called the ‚Äúnotion of the meaning as it really is‚Äù in accordance with the teaching of the mind-born son of the Buddha.

original: de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa ni de'i mtshan ma'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa ni de'i mtshan ma'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The object of that is its sign.

original: sems las byung ba de dag gi yul bum pa dang / snam bu dang / ser po dang / sngon po la sogs pa la de'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems las byung ba de dag gi yul bum pa dang / snam bu dang / ser po dang / sngon po la sogs pa la de'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object of those mental activities, such as the pot, cloth, yellow, blue, etc., is called its sign.

original: de ltar rgyu bag chags las gang yongs su brtags pa de gnyi ga kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du dgongs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu bag chags las gang yongs su brtags pa de gnyi ga kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du dgongs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, both that which is imagined from the cause, the habitual propensities, and that which is imagined, are considered to have the nature of the imagined.

original: rgyu bag chags la yang kun brtags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu bag chags la yang kun brtags zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause, the habitual propensities, is also called imagined,

original: kun brtags kyi chos snang ba'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos snang ba'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of the appearance of the imagined thing.

original: gang tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyis bum pa'o zhes btags pa dang / tha snyad la mi mkhas pa @187a * //
analyzed: gang tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyis bum pa'o zhes btags pa dang / tha snyad la mi mkhas pa @187a * //
translated: That which is designated as a pot by those skilled in conventional expressions, and as a pot by those unskilled in conventional expressions, is the same pot.

original: rnams kyis bum pa mthong ba 'di ni ci zhig yin snyam du rtog pa yang kun brtags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnams kyis bum pa mthong ba 'di ni ci zhig yin snyam du rtog pa yang kun brtags zhes bya ste /
translated: The thought What is this that sees the pot? is also called the imagined.

original: gzung 'dzin du rtog pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin du rtog pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is called the imagined because of the conception of subject and object.

original: de ltar na rgyu bag chags dang / yongs su brtags pa dang gnyi ga la kun brtags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu bag chags dang / yongs su brtags pa dang gnyi ga la kun brtags zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cause, the latent impressions, the complete imagination, and both are called the imagined.

original: kun brtags kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa ni /
translated: Another enumeration of the imagined is taught:üîΩThe objects are just like the names,

original: ming bzhin du ni don rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ming bzhin du ni don rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don kyang de bzhin du yod do zhes rtog pa ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdon bzhin ming ni rab tu snang//
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don kyang de bzhin du yod do zhes rtog pa ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to // don bzhin ming ni rab tu snang//
translated: The meaning is that the characteristic of the imagined is the conception that objects such as pots and cloth exist in the same way that the names pots and cloth are expressed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The name appears just like the object.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don ji ltar gzhag pa bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu'i ming yang yod do zhes rtog pa ni /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don ji ltar gzhag pa bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu'i ming yang yod do zhes rtog pa ni /
translated: Just as the object, such as a pot or a cloth, exists, so also the name pot or cloth exists.

original: don bzhin ming ni rab tu snang //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: don bzhin ming ni rab tu snang // zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the appearance of the name in accordance with the object.

original: 'di yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This also is the imagined characteristic.

original: yang dag ma yin rtog pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin rtog pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the imagination of what is unreal

original: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the imagined characteristic.

original: nam ming gi sgo nas don yod par rtog pa na ni ming yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nam ming gi sgo nas don yod par rtog pa na ni ming yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: When one imagines that the object exists by way of the name, then the name is the cause of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: nam don gyi sgo nas ming yod par rtog na ni don yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: nam don gyi sgo nas ming yod par rtog na ni don yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: When one imagines that the name exists by way of the object, then the object is the cause of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de ltar ming yod par rtog pa dang / don yod par rtog pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ming yod par rtog pa dang / don yod par rtog pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the imagination of the existence of the name and the imagination of the existence of the object are the imagined characteristic.

original: ming dang don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni ming dang don ji lta ba bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba la ming don ji lta ba bzhin pa'i don ston to //üîΩming ji bzhin par don yang de ltar yod par 'dzin pa ni ming ji bzhin pa dang / don ji 'dra bar ming yang de ltar yod par 'dzin pa ni don ci bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni ming dang don ji lta ba bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba la ming don ji lta ba bzhin pa'i don ston to // ming ji bzhin par don yang de ltar yod par 'dzin pa ni ming ji bzhin pa dang / don ji 'dra bar ming yang de ltar yod par 'dzin pa ni don ci bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase the realization of the name and referent just as they are indicates the meaning of the name and referent just as they are.üîΩ The phrase the name just as it is refers to the apprehension that the referent exists in just the same way as the name. The phrase the referent just as it is refers to the apprehension that the name exists in just the same way as the referent.

original: don dang ming du rab tu snang ba ni ming don ji bzhin par snang ba yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dang ming du rab tu snang ba ni ming don ji bzhin par snang ba yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase the appearance of the name and referent just as they are indicates the appearance of the name and referent just as they are.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i don ji ltar yod pa bzhin du ming yang de ltar yod par rtog pa dang / ming ji ltar yod pa bzhin du don yang de ltar yod do zhes rtog pa ni ming dang don bzhin du snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i don ji ltar yod pa bzhin du ming yang de ltar yod par rtog pa dang / ming ji ltar yod pa bzhin du don yang de ltar yod do zhes rtog pa ni ming dang don bzhin du snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase the appearance of the name and referent just as they are refers to the conception that the name exists in just the same way as the referent, such as a pot, exists, and the conception that the referent exists in just the same way as the name exists.

original: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di tsam zhig yongs su rtogs pa ste /üîΩde ni don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di tsam zhig yongs su rtogs pa ste /üîΩde ni don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase the thorough understanding of just this much is the imaginary nature indicates the imaginary nature.üîΩThe phrase this is the referent indicates the dependent nature.

original: kun brtags kyi chos kyang mdor na 'di tsam zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos kyang mdor na 'di tsam zhig tu zad de /
translated: In brief, imagined phenomena are exhausted in just this much.

original: yang na ni ming yod par rtog ming ni don yod par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ni ming yod par rtog ming ni don yod par rtog pa ste /
translated: Or else, name is imagined to exist, and the existent object is imagined to be the name.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams rtog na yang dag pa @187b gnyis la rtog pa tsam du zad kyi de las gzhan du brtag tu med pas na ming dang don gnyis la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams rtog na yang dag pa @187b gnyis la rtog pa tsam du zad kyi de las gzhan du brtag tu med pas na ming dang don gnyis la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even when ordinary beings imagine, it is exhausted in just the imagination of the two, the name and the existent object. Since there is nothing to imagine other than that, the name and the object are called the characteristics of the imagined.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de la ci'i phyir me long zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir me long zhes bya zhe na /

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //

analyzed: de la rgyu mthun pa'i chos la dmigs pas ni tshogs kyi lam bstan to //

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas ni sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas ni sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: The proper mental attention teaches the path of preparation.

original: sems kyi khams la gnas pas ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: sems kyi khams la gnas pas ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: The abiding in the element of the mind teaches the path of vision.

original: yod med don du mthong bas ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: yod med don du mthong bas ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: The seeing of existence and non-existence teaches the path of cultivation.

original: gnas kyis mthar thug pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: gnas kyis mthar thug pa'i lam bstan to //

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga'i rnal 'byor gyis ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga'i rnal 'byor gyis ste zhes bya ba la /

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor ces bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the union of serenity and insight is called yoga.

original: chos rnam pa lnga rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i rten dang gzhir gyur pas na rnal 'byor gyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa lnga rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i rten dang gzhir gyur pas na rnal 'byor gyis zhes bya'o //
translated: The five dharmas are the basis and foundation of the cultivation of yoga, and therefore it is called yoga.

original: de'i thugs su chud pa'i rgyu 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i thugs su chud pa'i rgyu 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba la /

original: sangs rgyas kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par thugs su chud pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par thugs su chud pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The realization of the Buddha of the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas is the cause.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The twelve branches of the scriptures are the result.

original: thugs su chud pa dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa dang gnyis su don mi mthun pa med pas na bshad pa'i chos thams cad la rgyu mthun pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thugs su chud pa dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa dang gnyis su don mi mthun pa med pas na bshad pa'i chos thams cad la rgyu mthun pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no difference in meaning between the realization and the explanation of the twelve branches of the scriptures, all the teachings that are explained are called the Dharma of natural outcome.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar gnas gzhan du gyur pa bshad pa'i don spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar gnas gzhan du gyur pa bshad pa'i don spyod pa'i phyir /

original: de bas mnyam pa nyid du gyur //
analyzed: de bas mnyam pa nyid du gyur //
translated: one becomes the same.

original: 'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa //
analyzed: 'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa //
translated: The stainless lineage of the noble ones

original: mtshungs dang khyad par 'dri ba med /üîΩlhag pa ma yin mtshan nyid 'dod //
analyzed: mtshungs dang khyad par 'dri ba med / lhag pa ma yin mtshan nyid 'dod //
translated: is not the same as or superior to it.

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: It is asserted to be the characteristic of non-excessive.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la 'phags pa'i rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la 'phags pa'i rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: The stainless realm of phenomena is called the lineage of the noble ones.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa na sangs rgyas thams cad dang sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid thob pas na mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa na sangs rgyas thams cad dang sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid thob pas na mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one enters the stainless realm, one attains the sameness of body, speech, and mind with all buddhas. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúsameness.‚Äù

original: @189b de'i tshe nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @189b de'i tshe nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, it is called stainless because the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience have been abandoned.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku la mi 'dra ba tha dad ba med pas na mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku la mi 'dra ba tha dad ba med pas na mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called similar because there is no difference in the liberation body of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas.

original: khyad par rnam pa lngas nyan thos dag pas 'phags pas na khyad par du gyur pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa lngas nyan thos dag pas 'phags pas na khyad par du gyur pa zhes bya'o /
translated: It is called distinctive because it is superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas in five ways.

original: khyad par rnam pa lnga ni rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / yongs su dag pa'i khyad par dang / chos kyi sku'i khyad par dang / longs spyod kyi khyad par dang / las kyi khyad bar ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa lnga ni rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / yongs su dag pa'i khyad par dang / chos kyi sku'i khyad par dang / longs spyod kyi khyad par dang / las kyi khyad bar ro //
translated: The five ways it is distinctive are distinctive in terms of purification, distinctive in terms of complete purification, distinctive in terms of the dharma body, distinctive in terms of enjoyment, and distinctive in terms of activity.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs ba na chos kyi dbyings la 'grib pa med pas na 'bri ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs ba na chos kyi dbyings la 'grib pa med pas na 'bri ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When afflictive emotions are abandoned, the dharmadhƒÅtu is not diminished, so it is called nondiminishing.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs skye ba na chos kyi dbyings la skye ba med pas na lhag ba ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs skye ba na chos kyi dbyings la skye ba med pas na lhag ba ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When the side of purification arises, it is called ‚Äúnon-excessive‚Äù because there is no arising in the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the uncontaminated dhƒÅtu is asserted to have such characteristics.

original: yang na mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa na dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis mnyam pa nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: yang na mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa na dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyis mnyam pa nyid du gyur te /
translated: Or, when it becomes sameness, the two‚Äîthe object of observation and the observer‚Äîbecome sameness.

original: gzung 'dzin gyi chos thams cad stong par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi chos thams cad stong par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena of apprehendeds and apprehenders are realized to be empty.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyangs pas /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyangs pas /
translated: Since it is purified of afflictions together with their predispositions,

original: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is the special purity.

original: rnam bar dag pa nyan thos pas khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: rnam bar dag pa nyan thos pas khyad zhugs te /
translated: The purity is distinguished from that of the Hearers.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams ni bag chags phra mo yang ma spangs pas gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa thob kyang spre'u mchongs byed dang / sngon smad 'tshong ma byed pa las phyis dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus na yang lhung bzed kyis ngos la lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams ni bag chags phra mo yang ma spangs pas gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa thob kyang spre'u mchongs byed dang / sngon smad 'tshong ma byed pa las phyis dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus na yang lhung bzed kyis ngos la lta bu ste /
translated: Since the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas have not abandoned even subtle predispositions, they are like the monkey-like arhat, and like the arhat who formerly was a prostitute, who even after attaining arhatship still looked at the street out of the corner of her eye.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags phra mo'i yang phra mo spangs pas na rnam par dag pa khyad zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags phra mo'i yang phra mo spangs pas na rnam par dag pa khyad zhugs pa'o //
translated: But because the TathƒÅgata has abandoned even the most subtle predispositions to affliction, his purity is especially exalted.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pas yongs su dag pa'i khyad par rnams dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pas yongs su dag pa'i khyad par rnams dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The special purity of the Buddha field,

original: nyan thos rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma sbyangs pa'i phyir sa gzhi shel dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa lta bur ston mi nus kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma sbyangs pa'i phyir sa gzhi shel dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa lta bur ston mi nus kyi /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas cannot display the ground of the Buddha field as if it were crystal, beryl, and so on, because they have not purified the Buddha field.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbyangs pas shel dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa lta bur ston nus pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbyangs pas shel dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa lta bur ston nus pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa khyad zhugs so //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are distinguished by their purity, because they are able to manifest a buddha-field like a crystal or beryl.

original: chos kyi sku yi khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yi khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The distinction of the Dharma Body

original: nyan thos rnams kyis chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pas rnam par grol ba'i sku tsam yod par zad kyi chos kyi sku med do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pas rnam par grol ba'i sku tsam yod par zad kyi chos kyi sku med do //
translated: The ≈örƒÅvakas have only the Body of Liberation, because they do not understand the selflessness of dharmas, and so they do not have the Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @190a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @190a * //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas

original: kyis ni chos la bdag med par rtogs pas na chos kyi sku mnga' ste /
analyzed: kyis ni chos la bdag med par rtogs pas na chos kyi sku mnga' ste /
translated: have the Dharma Body, because they understand the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de bas na chos kyi sku rnyed par khyad par zhugs so //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi sku rnyed par khyad par zhugs so //
translated: Therefore, they are distinguished by their acquisition of the Dharma Body.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi longs spyod la 'jug par byed pas longs spyod kyi khyad par dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi longs spyod la 'jug par byed pas longs spyod kyi khyad par dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The distinction of enjoyment, because they cause the enjoyment of the Dharma to be uninterrupted in the circle of the assembly.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i skus byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad par byed par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i skus byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad par byed par mi nus kyi /
translated: The Listeners are not able to cause the enjoyment of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle to be uninterrupted in the circle of the retinue of the Bodhisattvas with the Beatific Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad par byed pas na longs spyod kyis khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad par byed pas na longs spyod kyis khyad zhugs so //
translated: But the Tathagata does cause the enjoyment of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle to be uninterrupted in the circle of the retinue of the Bodhisattvas, and thus the Beatific Body is superior in enjoyment.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don bya ba sgrub pas na las kyi khyad par rnams so zhes bya ba la 'phags pa nyan thos dag gis sbrul pa'i skus dga' ldan gyi pho brang na gnas pa dang / shi 'pho bstan pa dang /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don bya ba sgrub pas na las kyi khyad par rnams so zhes bya ba la 'phags pa nyan thos dag gis sbrul pa'i skus dga' ldan gyi pho brang na gnas pa dang / shi 'pho bstan pa dang /
translated: The various activities are the activities of accomplishing the aims of sentient beings, such as dwelling in the Tusita heaven, etc. The Listeners, the Noble Ones, with the Emanation Body, dwell in the Tusita palace, demonstrate passing away,

original: mngon par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa bstan cing sems can gyi don sgrub mi nus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dga' ldan na bzhugs pa dang / lhums su gshegs pa dang mngon par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa sprul pa sna tshogs bstan pas las kyi khyad par gyis khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa bstan cing sems can gyi don sgrub mi nus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dga' ldan na bzhugs pa dang / lhums su gshegs pa dang mngon par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa sprul pa sna tshogs bstan pas las kyi khyad par gyis khyad zhugs so //
translated: and the Tathagatas, by means of various manifestations such as dwelling in the Tusita heaven, entering the womb, and attaining supreme enlightenment, are able to demonstrate the attainment of supreme enlightenment, etc., and to accomplish the aims of beings.

original: des ni mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: By this, the object of indication and the characteristic are understood.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i chos lnga po de dag la mtshon byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i chos lnga po de dag la mtshon byed ces bya ste /
translated: The five dharmas of the yogi are called the indication.

original: ci'i phyir mtshon byed ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshon byed ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called indication?

original: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid lnga po des mtshon bya rnam pa lnga dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum shes par byed pas na mtshon byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid lnga po des mtshon bya rnam pa lnga dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum shes par byed pas na mtshon byed ces bya'o //
translated: Because they indicate the five objects of indication by means of the five characteristics of wisdom and the three characteristics.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Six verses investigating liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms nas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spangs te mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byas pa ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms nas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spangs te mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byas pa ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The actualization of nirvana through the cultivation of the noble path and the abandonment of the afflictions and suffering is called liberation.

original: thabs gang ji ltar byas na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes brtags pa ni rnam par grol ba yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thabs gang ji ltar byas na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes brtags pa ni rnam par grol ba yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The investigation of the means by which nirvana is attained is called the investigation of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba tsam la tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba tsam la tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mere liberation is taught in six verses.

original: gnas don lus ni snang ba dag / shin tu gyur pa zag med pa'i //
analyzed: gnas don lus ni snang ba dag / shin tu gyur pa zag med pa'i //
translated: The transformation of the basis is the transformation of the appearance of the object, the body, and the place.

original: dbyings dang sa bon rab gyur phyir //
analyzed: dbyings dang sa bon rab gyur phyir //
translated: The transformation of the seed is the transformation of the realm and the seed.

original: de yang kun du 'gro ba'i gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang kun du 'gro ba'i gnas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that is the universal basis.

original: sa bon rab @190b tu gyur ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad rkang pa gsum gyis 'jug nas /
analyzed: sa bon rab @190b tu gyur ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad rkang pa gsum gyis 'jug nas /
translated: The three lines beginning with the transformation of the seed are the entry into the verse.

original: 'byung bar sngar smos la je bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar sngar smos la je bshad par bya ste /
translated: The arising was mentioned earlier and will be explained.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'am /
translated: It is the transformation of the seeds of the afflictions and the obscurations to knowledge together with their propensities.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi la sa bon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun gzhi la sa bon zhes bya ste /
translated: The alaya together with the habitual tendencies of subject and object is called the seed.

original: kun gzhi gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dang bral bas gnas gzhan du gyur na chos rnam pa gsum du yang gnas gzhan du gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dang bral bas gnas gzhan du gyur na chos rnam pa gsum du yang gnas gzhan du gyur te /
translated: When the alaya is free from the stains of subject and object and has transformed into something else, the three aspects are also transformed into something else.

original: gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are these three?

original: gnas su snang ba dang / don du snang ba dang / lus su snang ba'o //
analyzed: gnas su snang ba dang / don du snang ba dang / lus su snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance as the place, the appearance as objects and the appearance as a body.

original: de la gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten sa gzhi chen po ste /
analyzed: de la gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten sa gzhi chen po ste /
translated: The place is the great ground of the world, the container.

original: de gnas gzhan du gyur na ngom grog gam g-yang sa la sogs pa thag thug tu snang gi shel dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i sa gzhi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnas gzhan du gyur na ngom grog gam g-yang sa la sogs pa thag thug tu snang gi shel dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i sa gzhi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is transformed, it appears as a ground of crystal and lapis lazuli, rather than as uneven with ravines and precipices.

original: don ni gzugs nas chos kyi bar du yul drug la bya ste /
analyzed: don ni gzugs nas chos kyi bar du yul drug la bya ste /
translated: Objects refer to the six objects from form to mental objects.

original: de rnams gzhan du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus kyi tshe dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i longs spyod sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de rnams gzhan du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus kyi tshe dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i longs spyod sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: When they are transformed, they appear as the various enjoyments of the buddha level, such as wish fulfilling trees and so on.

original: / lus ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug la bya ste /
analyzed: / lus ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug la bya ste /
translated: The body is the six faculties, from the eye faculty to the mind faculty.üîΩWhen the six faculties are transformed, one is able to perform the function of all the faculties with any one of them, one obtains the twelve hundredfold qualities, one appears like the body of a buddha, and so forth.

original: dbang po drug gnas gzhan du gyur na dbang po gcig gis kyang dbang po thams cad kyi don byed nus pa dang / yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis 'thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku lta bur snang bar 'gyur ba dang / de ltar chos rnam pa gsum gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i zag pa med pa'i dbyings la rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po drug gnas gzhan du gyur na dbang po gcig gis kyang dbang po thams cad kyi don byed nus pa dang / yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis 'thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku lta bur snang bar 'gyur ba dang / de ltar chos rnam pa gsum gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i zag pa med pa'i dbyings la rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: These three aspects of Dharma are called liberation in the untainted expanse, which is the transformation of the basis.

original: rnam par grol ba'i gnas der ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyang 'jug la rang sangs rgyas kyang 'jug / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang 'jug pas na de'ang kun du 'gro ba'i gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i gnas der ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyang 'jug la rang sangs rgyas kyang 'jug / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang 'jug pas na de'ang kun du 'gro ba'i gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: That state of liberation is called the universal state because noble ≈õrƒÅvakas enter it, pratyekabuddhas enter it, and bodhisattvas enter it.

original: rnam par grol ba'i gnas su ni theg pa gsum gyi gang zag thams cad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i gnas su ni theg pa gsum gyi gang zag thams cad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the universal state because all the individuals of the three vehicles enter it.

original: rnam par grol ba rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /

original: zhes smos so //

analyzed: shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la bya ste /

analyzed: rnam bar rtog pa 'di ni sngon po yin ser po ma yin no zhes dpyod par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya ste /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: zhes bshad do //

analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis su rtog pa yang de dang mtshungs par rtogs te /
translated: Having understood that, he understands the two kinds of selflessness in the same way.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i lam rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i lam rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The same means that he understands the path free from the two extremes.

original: dbu ma'i lam rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He understands the middle way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: kun du brtags pa'i gang zag med pa dang / kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams med cing stong pa zhes bya bar zad kyi rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin par shes te /

translated: He understands that the imputed person does not exist and that the imputed phenomena are empty, but he does not understand that they do not exist in every way.

original: gzhan yang yongs su grub pa ni med pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su grub pa ni med pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, he understands that the consummate does not not exist.

original: 'dis ni skur pa'i mtha' ltung ba dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni skur pa'i mtha' ltung ba dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is free from the extreme of denial.

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang bral nas de nyid rab 'jug ces bya ste //
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang bral nas de nyid rab 'jug ces bya ste //
translated: Having thus become free from the extreme of superimposition, he enters reality.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang kun brtags kyi chos med pa'i sems tsam po mthong ba ni de nyid la rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang kun brtags kyi chos med pa'i sems tsam po mthong ba ni de nyid la rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: 'di yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi las bzod pa'i dus na rtogs te /

analyzed: de'i tshe na bzod pa rang bzhin med par khong du tshud par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar bzod pa'i dus na gzung ba med par khong du chud pas de kho na'i phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas na de nyid la rab tu 'jug pa zhes btags so //
translated: Thus, at the time of forbearance, one penetrates the non-existence of the apprehended, and one obtains the concentration which enters one aspect of reality. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúentry into reality.‚Äù

original: 'dzin par te zhes bya ba la bzod pa'i dus na gzugs la sogs pa spyi'i dngos po ni @192b med kyi 'dzin ba'i mtshan nyid sems tsam du zad do zhes khong du chud pas na 'dzin pa tsam sems so //
analyzed: 'dzin par te zhes bya ba la bzod pa'i dus na gzugs la sogs pa spyi'i dngos po ni @192b med kyi 'dzin ba'i mtshan nyid sems tsam du zad do zhes khong du chud pas na 'dzin pa tsam sems so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe apprehension‚Äù means that at the time of forbearance, one penetrates the fact that the general entity of form, etc. is merely mind, which has the characteristic of the apprehender. Therefore, the apprehension is the mind.

original: de'i phyir de la yid gnas phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yid gnas phyir //
translated: Therefore, because the mind abides in that,

original: zhes bya ba la ni gong du bshad pa lta bur na bzod pa'i dus na phyi'i yul mi dmigs kyi sems tsam la gnas pas de la yid gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ni gong du bshad pa lta bur na bzod pa'i dus na phyi'i yul mi dmigs kyi sems tsam la gnas pas de la yid gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the above, at the time of acceptance, as explained above, one does not perceive external objects, but abides in mind only, so it is said that the mind abides in that.

original: de la de mi snang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la de mi snang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that, it does not appear.

original: bzod pa'i dus na gzung ba'i chos phyi'i yul med par khong du chud ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na gzung ba med na de la 'dzin par byed pa'i sems kyang med do zhes sems tsam du 'dzin pa dang yang bral te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i dus na gzung ba'i chos phyi'i yul med par khong du chud ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na gzung ba med na de la 'dzin par byed pa'i sems kyang med do zhes sems tsam du 'dzin pa dang yang bral te /
translated: At the time of acceptance, one comprehends that the apprehended, external objects, do not exist, and at the time of the supreme mundane quality, one is also free from apprehending mind only, thinking that if the apprehended does not exist, the mind that apprehends it also does not exist.

original: de bas na de la mi snang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la mi snang zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that it does not appear in that.

original: de snang med pa grol ba mchog tu dmigs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de snang med pa grol ba mchog tu dmigs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: That nonappearance is supreme liberation, free from objectification.

original: de nas sa dang po'i dus na gzung ba yang mi snang 'dzin pa yang mi snang ste /
analyzed: de nas sa dang po'i dus na gzung ba yang mi snang 'dzin pa yang mi snang ste /
translated: Then, at the time of the first bhumi, the apprehended does not appear and the apprehender does not appear.

original: gzung 'dzin mi dmigs pa'i ye shes la gnas ba nyid grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin mi dmigs pa'i ye shes la gnas ba nyid grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Abiding in the wisdom that does not objectify apprehended and apprehender is called liberation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mchog tu dmigs pa gang zag tu dmigs pa dang / chos su dmigs pa gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir grol ba yin no /
analyzed: mchog tu dmigs pa gang zag tu dmigs pa dang / chos su dmigs pa gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir grol ba yin no /
translated: It is liberated because it is free from the two kinds of supreme reference, that is, reference to the individual and reference to phenomena.

original: de yang mtshungs par shes pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang mtshungs par shes pa ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the same in understanding.

original: bdag med pa gnyis su rtogs pa yang thams cad nas thams cad du med par rtogs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis su rtogs pa yang thams cad nas thams cad du med par rtogs par ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not that the understanding of the two kinds of selflessness is only an understanding of their nonexistence in every way.

original: mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i lam rtogs ba ni mtshungs par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i lam rtogs ba ni mtshungs par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding of the middle way, free from the two extremes, is called the same in understanding.üîΩIt is the same in apprehension.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'di ni 'dzin pa tsam mo snyam pa'i zhes bya ba la tsam gyi sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don yod pa ma yin par 'gog ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'di ni 'dzin pa tsam mo snyam pa'i zhes bya ba la tsam gyi sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don yod pa ma yin par 'gog ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúmerely‚Äù in ‚Äúmerely an apprehension‚Äù and ‚Äúmerely an understanding‚Äù negate the existence of objects such as form.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: It is merely mind and mental factors.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ni 'dzin pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ni 'dzin pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: There are no objects such as form that are other than that.

original: de'ang bzod pa'i dus na rtogs so //
analyzed: de'ang bzod pa'i dus na rtogs so //
translated: This is understood at the time of acceptance.

original: rnam par grol ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Another alternative is stated in order to teach the liberation of the mind.

original: gzhi dang tshogs dang gzhag yod na //
analyzed: gzhi dang tshogs dang gzhag yod na //
translated: The basis, the collection, and the placement exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gzhi yod pa dang / tshogs yod pa dang / gzhag pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi yod pa dang / tshogs yod pa dang / gzhag pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis, the collection, and the placement exist.

original: de la tshe 'dir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas /
analyzed: de la tshe 'dir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas /
translated: The basis is the reliance on a spiritual friend in this life,

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa byed pa ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa byed pa ni gzhi'o //
translated: and the practice of listening to the holy Dharma, reflection, and so on.

original: tshe rabs snga mar mos ba spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa ni tshogs so //üîΩmos pa spyod pa'i sa dag tu chos @193a * //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga mar mos ba spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa ni tshogs so // mos pa spyod pa'i sa dag tu chos @193a * //
translated: The collection is the accumulation of the collection of merit for one incalculable eon on the stage of action in faith in previous lives.

original: thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par tshul bzhin yid la byas ba ni gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par tshul bzhin yid la byas ba ni gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The placement is the proper mental attention to all phenomena as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial on the stage of action in faith.

original: de gsum dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gsum dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one possesses these three.

original: ming tsam du yang mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ming tsam du yang mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: One sees even as mere names.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the verse that goes:

original: de gsum dang ldan na drod dang rtse mo'i tshe na chos thams cad ming tsam du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gsum dang ldan na drod dang rtse mo'i tshe na chos thams cad ming tsam du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is endowed with those three, at the time of heat and peak, one sees all phenomena as mere names.

original: tshig tsam brjod pa tsam tha snyad tsam rnam par rtog ba tsam du zad par mthong ba'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig tsam brjod pa tsam tha snyad tsam rnam par rtog ba tsam du zad par mthong ba'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one sees that the nature of phenomena is not existent, seeing that they are mere words, mere expressions, mere conventions, and mere conceptual thoughts.

original: ming tsam du ni mthong ba ste //
analyzed: ming tsam du ni mthong ba ste //
translated: One sees that they are mere names.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the verse that goes:

original: de'i 'og tu bzod pa'i dus na chos thams cad sems tsam du mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod pa'i dus na chos thams cad sems tsam du mthong ste /

original: ming gi phung po bzhi tsam du zad kyi de las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang yang ma mthong bas na ming tsam du mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ming gi phung po bzhi tsam du zad kyi de las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang yang ma mthong bas na ming tsam du mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is merely the four aggregates of name, and one does not see any phenomena such as form that are separate from that. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúseeing that they are mere names,‚Äù

original: gzung ba rnams de'i tshe spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba rnams de'i tshe spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: de mthong de yang mthong mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de mthong de yang mthong mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: One sees that, and that too one does not see.

original: de nas 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na bzod pa'i tshe ming tsam du mthong ba de yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na bzod pa'i tshe ming tsam du mthong ba de yang ma mthong ste /
translated: Then, at the time of the supreme mundane quality of forbearance, one sees that even the mere name does not exist.

original: sems tsam du yod par 'dzin pa yang de'i tshe spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems tsam du yod par 'dzin pa yang de'i tshe spangs pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: gzung ba med pa yang yod par mi rigs par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands that it is illogical for the nonexistent apprehended to exist.

original: de ltar gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs nas sa dang po'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi dmigs pa'i dmigs su med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa nyid rnam par grol ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs nas sa dang po'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi dmigs pa'i dmigs su med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa nyid rnam par grol ba yin te /
translated: Thus, having abandoned the two, apprehended and apprehender, at the time of the first bhumi, one abides in the wisdom of nonobservation, which is the nonobservation of the apprehended and apprehender.üîΩIn order to teach another enumeration of liberation,

original: rnam par grol ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the text says:

original: sems 'di gnas ngan len dang bcas //
analyzed: sems 'di gnas ngan len dang bcas //

original: bdag tu lta ba'i zhags pas zin //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i zhags pas zin //

original: 'jug par 'gyur te ldog pa ni //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur te ldog pa ni //

original: de ni nang du gnas par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni nang du gnas par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba smos te /

original: sems 'di gnas ngan len dang bcas pas na 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems 'di gnas ngan len dang bcas pas na 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //

original: de la sems kyi sgras ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi sgras ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la bya'o //

original: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la gnas ngan len rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la gnas ngan len rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: ‚Äú Associated with negative reflex actions‚Äù means that there are two kinds of negative reflex actions:

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / sems kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / sems kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: negative reflex actions of the body and negative reflex actions of the mind.

original: de la lus kyi gnas ngan len ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi gnas ngan len ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni chags sems dang / gnod sems @193b dang ; yod med du rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The negative reflex actions of the mind are covetousness, malice, and false views.

original: yang na gnas ngan len rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na gnas ngan len rnam pa gnyis te /

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags so //

original: bcas zhes bya ba ni bag chags de gnyis dang ldan zhing 'brel bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcas zhes bya ba ni bag chags de gnyis dang ldan zhing 'brel bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù means that the two habitual propensities are connected with and possessed of that mind.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i zhags pas zin //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i zhags pas zin //
translated: Seized by the noose of the view of self.

original: zhes bya bas gnas ngan len gyi rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gnas ngan len gyi rgyu bstan te /

original: bdag tu lta ba ni gang zag la bdag tu lta ba dang / chos la bdag tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni gang zag la bdag tu lta ba dang / chos la bdag tu lta ba'o //
translated: The view of self is the view of a self in the individual and the view of a self in things.

original: ci tsam ci tsam gang zag la bdag yod pa dang / chos la bdag yod pa phyin ci log tu bltas pa de tsam du sems la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi gnas ngan len sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci tsam ci tsam gang zag la bdag yod pa dang / chos la bdag yod pa phyin ci log tu bltas pa de tsam du sems la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi gnas ngan len sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that one views the self in the individual and the self in things in a distorted way, to that extent the negative reflex action of the habitual propensities of the obscurations of the passions and the obscurations of the knowable is stored up in the mind.

original: ji srid du gnas ngan len gnyis dang ma bral ba de srid du 'khor bar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid du gnas ngan len gnyis dang ma bral ba de srid du 'khor bar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: As long as one is not free from the two negative reflex actions, one enters into sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: rgyun du 'khor bar skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun du 'khor bar skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One is born in sa·πÉsƒÅra in a continuous series.

original: 'khor ba las log ste 'khor bar mi skye ba ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las log ste 'khor bar mi skye ba ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The turning away from sa·πÉsƒÅra, the non-birth in sa·πÉsƒÅra, is called ‚Äúliberation.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: da ni nam sems nang du gnas par gyur pa na 'khor ba las ldog par 'dod do //
translated: Now, when the mind abides inwardly, one is said to turn away from cyclic existence.

original: sems nang du gnas pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su rtogs pa spangs nas gnyis su med pa'i sems tsam la sems gnas te gzung ba yang mi dmigs 'dzin pa yang mi dmigs par 'gyur ba na rnam par grol ba yin par 'dod de /

translated: Moreover, the mind abides inwardly when the mind abides in mere mind, having abandoned the discrimination of the duality of subject and object. When one does not perceive an object and does not perceive a subject, one is said to be liberated.

original: de ni sa dang po'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de ni sa dang po'i dus na'o //

analyzed: dngos po med 'dod yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa dang // rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin par brtags pa la yongs su tshol ba zhes bya'o //

original: de la chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la chos rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o // gzhan gyi dbang gi chos la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa ste /

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid gsum yod par rang bzhin med pas na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid gsum yod par rang bzhin med pas na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //

original: de brtag pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to//üîΩ@194a * // rang dang rang gi bdag nyid med //
analyzed: de brtag pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to// @194a * // rang dang rang gi bdag nyid med //
translated: The verse says:üîΩIt is without intrinsic reality,üîΩbecause it does not exist in its own nature,

original: bdag gi dngos la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos la mi gnas phyir //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rang zhes bya ba'i don ni rang nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to be without intrinsic reality because it does not exist in its own nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams skye ba'i tshe rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyis bskyed par zad kyi rang nyid kyis rang nyid bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams skye ba'i tshe rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyis bskyed par zad kyi rang nyid kyis rang nyid bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir te /

translated: That which arose previously does not arise again and the arising of later states does not generate other phenomena that are renowned in the same way as they are renowned.

original: de nyid mi skye ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid mi skye ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /

original: gang sngar skyes ba'i chos de dag skye ba med de de'i dngos por mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang sngar skyes ba'i chos de dag skye ba med de de'i dngos por mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /

original: 'khor ba na gang sngar skyes nas 'gags zin pa'i chos de dag slar yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gang sngar skyes nas 'gags zin pa'i chos de dag slar yang mi skye ste /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'gag pa'i chos ni med pa yin pas med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos ni med pa yin pas med pa ste /

original: slar yod pa'i dngos por mi skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: slar yod pa'i dngos por mi skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: They do not arise again as existent things.

original: ji ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgzhan mi skye ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir gzhan dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan mi skye ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir gzhan dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is said that one should cultivate patience with respect to phenomena that do not arise.üîΩTo elaborate on the meaning of other phenomena not arising, it says,

original: snga ma med pa'i rnam par mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: snga ma med pa'i rnam par mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes smos te /

original: 'khor ba na phyis skye ba'i chos rnams kyang gzhan yang skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba na phyis skye ba'i chos rnams kyang gzhan yang skye ba ma yin te /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
