analyzed: ji ltar grags pa'i chos phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa nyid skye bar zad kyi /
translated: Because phenomena that are well known, such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases and so on, arise.

original: sngon med pa'i sems can gsar du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i sems can gsar du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: New sentient beings who did not exist before do not arise.

original: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúpatience‚Äù also means ‚Äúpatience with respect to the non-production of things.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis te /
translated: ‚Äú Own-character‚Äù means the imagined nature.

original: de la nam yang skye ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nam yang skye ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Never produced‚Äù means that they are never produced.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mi skye ba ni kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin rnams la skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mi skye ba ni kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin rnams la skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚Äú Own-character‚Äù means that they are not produced.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: gang zag dang chos su brtags pa thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du thams cad nas thams cad du med na de nam yang skye ba dang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all the imagined persons and things are completely and totally non-existent, like the horns of a rabbit. They are never produced or arisen.

analyzed: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúpatience‚Äù also means ‚Äúpatience with respect to the non-production of things.‚Äù

analyzed: rang nyid mi skye ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi'o zhes bya ba la /

translated: ‚Äú Not produced from self‚Äù means the relative nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams ni //

analyzed: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúacceptance‚Äù means ‚Äúacceptance of the fact that phenomena do not arise.‚Äù

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The ‚Äútransformation‚Äù is the perfect [nature].

analyzed: de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba skye ba med do zhes bya ba la / gzhan du 'gyur @196a * //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i zab pa'i ye shes thob pa rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi mthong zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'phags pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi mthong ba yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: bye brag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku rnams te /
analyzed: bye brag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku rnams te /

original: bdag la bye brag tu skye ba med do zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bye brag tu skye ba med pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku ni rang bzhin gcig pa yin la /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kha cig ni chos kyi sku ci 'dra bar skyes kha cig ni ci 'dra bar skye ba lta bur mi mthun par skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not that some Buddhas are born with a Dharma Body of one kind and some with a Dharma Body of another kind, because there is no difference in the way they are born.

original: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of ‚Äúpatience with the non-production of things‚Äù is that one does not produce such a patience.

original: theg pa gcig yongs su tshol ba la yang tshigs su bcad pa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa gcig yongs su tshol ba la yang tshigs su bcad pa bdun no zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: mdo sde kha cig las ni gsum mo zhes bshad pa ni ci la dgongs she na /

original: gsung rab la sde rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsung rab la sde rnam pa gnyis te /

original: bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde dang // nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde dang // nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //

analyzed: de la theg pa gcig go zhes bshad pa ni sems can gyi don du dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pas ni bkri ba'i don zhes bya ba la /

original: theg pa gsum du gsungs pa ni nges pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum du gsungs pa ni nges pa'i don yin te /
translated: The teaching of three vehicles is of definitive meaning.

original: theg pa gsum yod pa las theg pa gcig tu bshad pa /
analyzed: theg pa gsum yod pa las theg pa gcig tu bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the one vehicle from among the three vehiclesüîΩis for the sake of the purpose of guiding sentient beings.

original: ci las dgongs te bshad pa'i dgongs pa brtags pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bdun rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci las dgongs te bshad pa'i dgongs pa brtags pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bdun rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The seven verses are composed in order to investigate the intention of the explanation.

original: chos dang bdag med grol ba mtshungs //üîΩtha dad rigs dang bsam gnyis thob //
analyzed: chos dang bdag med grol ba mtshungs // tha dad rigs dang bsam gnyis thob //
translated: The Dharma, selflessness, and liberation are the same.üîΩThe two kinds of lineage and aspiration are obtained.

original: sprul @196b ba dang ni mthar thug phyir //
analyzed: sprul @196b ba dang ni mthar thug phyir //

original: theg pa gcig pa nyid yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa gcig pa nyid yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: are the reason for the one vehicle.

original: theg pa gcig tu bshad pa'i dgongs pa ni chos mtshungs pa dang / bdag med pa mtshungs pa dang / grol ba mtshungs pa dang / rigs tha dad pa theg pa mtshungs pa dang / bsam pa gnyis thob pa dang / sprul pa'i phyir /

original: dang mthar thug pa'i phyir /

analyzed: don rnam pa bdun la dgongs nas theg pa gcig nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //

original: chos mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig ste /
analyzed: chos mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig ste /

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: chos mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig tu gsungs te /

original: ji lta zhe na ;
analyzed: ji lta zhe na ;

translated: Because there is no difference between the liberation of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, the liberation of the pratyekabuddha, and the liberation of the Buddha.

translated: In the s≈´tras it is said:

translated: The Bhagavan buddhas cause those of the sravaka type who are not definite in their lineage and who are free or not free from attachment to the desire realmüîΩto enter the path that is consistent with nirvana, which is meditation that emphasizes insight.

original: 'khor ba las mngon du lta ba'i snying rje chen po bsgoms pa'i lam la sbyor bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba las mngon du lta ba'i snying rje chen po bsgoms pa'i lam la sbyor bar mdzad do //
translated: They are joined to the path of meditation on great compassion that directly views samsara.

original: de la snying rje chen po'i lam bsgoms pas 'khor ba la zhe sdang zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du bltas bas lhag mthong gi lam 'dul bar byed la /
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po'i lam bsgoms pas 'khor ba la zhe sdang zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du bltas bas lhag mthong gi lam 'dul bar byed la /
translated: Since one cultivates the path of great compassion, one is not hostile to cyclic existence, and since one is oriented toward nirvana, one disciplines oneself in the path of insight.

original: 'khor ba la mngon du lta bar byed de /
analyzed: 'khor ba la mngon du lta bar byed de /
translated: One is oriented toward cyclic existence,

original: yang nas yang du 'khor ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni srid par yongs su bsngos pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du 'khor ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni srid par yongs su bsngos pas zhes bya'o //
translated: and one is oriented toward nirvana, since one is oriented toward the realm of existence by dedicating to existence.

original: de ltar snying rje chen po'i dbang gis 'khor bar skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje chen po'i dbang gis 'khor bar skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since one is born in cyclic existence by the power of great compassion,

original: de dag gi skye ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab par gzhag go //
translated: one's birth is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa skye ba'i phyir de'i 'phags pa'i lam 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa skye ba'i phyir de'i 'phags pa'i lam 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since one's birth is inconceivable, one's noble path is inconceivable.

original: 'phags pa de dag gi skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad pa yang lam dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye ba ni ma yin gyi 'phags pa'i lam nyid 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa na de dag gi skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag gi skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad pa yang lam dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye ba ni ma yin gyi 'phags pa'i lam nyid 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa na de dag gi skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur
translated: The explanation of the inconceivable births of those ƒÅryas is not that they are born through the power of the path and affliction, but that when the ƒÅrya path itself becomes the cause of birth in samsara, their birth becomes inconceivable.

original: ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ma bral ba gnyis 'khor bar skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ma bral ba gnyis 'khor bar skye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained that both those who are free from attachment and those who are not free from attachment have the characteristic of inconceivable birth in samsara,

original: da ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i sems can gyi don du 'khor bar ji ltar skye ba bstan ba'i phyir /üîΩgcig ni smon lam dbang dag gis //
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i sems can gyi don du 'khor bar ji ltar skye ba bstan ba'i phyir / gcig ni smon lam dbang dag gis //
translated: now, in order to demonstrate how those who are not free from attachment to the desire realm take birth in samsara for the sake of sentient beings,üîΩit is said:üîΩOne is born through the power of aspiration

original: skye bar kyang ni rab tu 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye bar kyang ni rab tu 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and also through the power of karma.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgras 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral bar rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba la bya ste /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgras 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral bar rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba la bya ste /
translated: The term one refers to those not free of attachment to the desire realm who are stream enterers and once returners.

original: de dag 'khor bar ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: de dag 'khor bar ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How do they take birth in samsara?

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ste /
translated: They take birth through the power of aspiration.

original: de yang 'di ltar khams gsum gyi sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong nas gang dang gang du sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod par mthong ba de bzhin de dag tu skye bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang de dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar khams gsum gyi sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong nas gang dang gang du sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod par mthong ba de bzhin de dag tu skye bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang de dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, having seen sentient beings of the three realms who are suffering, they aspire May I be born wherever I can benefit sentient beings and through the power of aspiration they are born there.

original: skyes nas sems can la phan pa dang / bde bar byas te /
analyzed: skyes nas sems can la phan pa dang / bde bar byas te /
translated: Having taken birth, they benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: accumulate the collections of merit and wisdom and attain enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'khor bar ji ltar skye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'khor bar ji ltar skye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate how those free of attachment to the desire realm take birth in samsara, the text says:

original: cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba ni //
analyzed: cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba ni //
translated: The other, nonreturners,

original: rnal 'byor gyi ni sbrul pas sgrub //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi ni sbrul pas sgrub //
translated: The yogi/nis are born by emanation.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The yogi/nis are born by emanation.

original: cig shos @201a * //
analyzed: cig shos @201a * //
translated: The other

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la bya ste /
translated: means those who are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de dag ni rang nyid 'khor bar mi skye ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas ting nge 'dzin gyi sprul pas sprul te /
analyzed: de dag ni rang nyid 'khor bar mi skye ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas ting nge 'dzin gyi sprul pas sprul te /
translated: They cultivate the concentration of not being born in cyclic existence themselves, and then emanate by the emanation of concentration.

original: sprul pa 'khor bar skyes nas sems can gyi don bsgrubs nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprul pa 'khor bar skyes nas sems can gyi don bsgrubs nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The emanations are born in cyclic existence and accomplish the welfare of sentient beings, and then, having accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, they become fully enlightened.

original: 'dod bzhin skye ba 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod bzhin skye ba 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: They take birth as they wish.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas skye ba ni ma yin gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas skye ba ni ma yin gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not born through karma and afflictions, but are born through the power of aspiration.

original: gong du 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ma bral ba gnyis zhan pa'o zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: gong du 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ma bral ba gnyis zhan pa'o zhes bshad pa la /
translated: The two, those who are free from attachment to the desire realm and those who are not free from attachment, were previously explained as being inferior.

original: ji ltar de gnyis zhan pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis zhan pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how these two are inferior,üîΩthe root text says:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of delight in nirvana,

original: de gnyis rmongs pa zhugs par dgongs //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de gnyis rmongs pa zhugs par dgongs // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: those two are considered to be deluded.

original: don mthong ba'i gang zag de gnyis kyang /
analyzed: don mthong ba'i gang zag de gnyis kyang /
translated: Those two persons who see the meaning

original: nyan thos kyi spyod pa 'khor ba la skyo ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum du lta ba la dga' bas na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi spyod pa 'khor ba la skyo ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum du lta ba la dga' bas na /
translated: are considered to be deluded because of their delight in the conduct of the sravakas, which is disenchantment with samsara and the direct realization of nirvana.

original: shes rab rtul ba dang dus ring por bla na med pa'i byang chub 'tshang rgya bar rmongs par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab rtul ba dang dus ring por bla na med pa'i byang chub 'tshang rgya bar rmongs par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are deluded because of their dull wisdom and because of the long time it takes for them to attain the unexcelled enlightenment of a buddha.

original: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / phyi phyir bdag gi sems la ni //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' zhe na / de'i phyir / phyi phyir bdag gi sems la ni //
translated: Why is there delight in nirvana?üîΩTherefore, it says:

original: kun du spyod pa sbyor pas so //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa sbyor pas so //
translated: Because of the application of the conduct of the mind of self

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: again and again.

original: bdag gi sems ni nyon mongs pa dang nyan thos kyi sems so //
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni nyon mongs pa dang nyan thos kyi sems so //
translated: The mind of self refers to the afflicted mind and the mind of the sravakas.

original: phyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Again and again means again and again.

original: don mthong ba'i nyan thos de dag yang nas yang du nyan thos kyi sems nyon mongs pa dang / 'khor bas skyo ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba yang nas yang du 'byung zhing de la kun du spyod cing sbyor la sems can gyi don mi byed pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du dga' ba zhes bya ste /üîΩde ltar gyur dang dad po nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang bshad /
analyzed: don mthong ba'i nyan thos de dag yang nas yang du nyan thos kyi sems nyon mongs pa dang / 'khor bas skyo ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba yang nas yang du 'byung zhing de la kun du spyod cing sbyor la sems can gyi don mi byed pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du dga' ba zhes bya ste / de ltar gyur dang dad po nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang bshad /
translated: Those sriivakas who have seen the truth repeatedly generate the sriivaka mind, and they repeatedly become weary of samsara and delight in nirvana. They repeatedly engage in and apply themselves to that, and they do not work for the welfare of living beings. Therefore they are called ‚Äúthose who delight in nirvana.‚Äù

original: de nas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du theg pa chen por zhugs nas 'tshang rgya bas yun ring por 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir zhan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du theg pa chen por zhugs nas 'tshang rgya bas yun ring por 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir zhan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúweak‚Äù because they are taught the sriivaka vehicle, and then they enter the Mahayana and become enlightened after a long time, three measureless kalpas.

original: nyan thos rigs ma nges pa rnam pa gnyis las don mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: nyan thos rigs ma nges pa rnam pa gnyis las don mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
translated: The sriivakas of unfixed potential are explained as being of two types: those who have seen the truth and those who have not.

original: don mthong ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don mthong ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who have seen the truth are also of two types:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / ma bral ba rnam pa gnyis su phye ba las de gnyis 'khor @201b par skyes te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / ma bral ba rnam pa gnyis su phye ba las de gnyis 'khor @201b par skyes te /
translated: The two types of persons who are not free from attachment to the desire realm and who are free from attachment to the desire realm are born in cyclic existence.

original: sems can gyi don byas nas bsong nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byas nas bsong nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags te /
translated: They benefit sentient beings, gather the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: ji ltang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ni bshang zin to //
analyzed: ji ltang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ni bshang zin to //
translated: and then attain manifest enlightenment.

original: da ni rigs ma nges pa theg pa chen bo'i don ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: da ni rigs ma nges pa theg pa chen bo'i don ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Now, those of unfixed potential who have not seen the meaning of the Great Vehicle

original: de ji ltar mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: are taught how they attain manifest enlightenment.

original: gang phyir don ma byas pa de //
analyzed: gang phyir don ma byas pa de //
translated: Since they have not accomplished their purpose,

original: sangs rgyas med 'byung bsam gtan don //
analyzed: sangs rgyas med 'byung bsam gtan don //
translated: they do not become buddhas, but they do attain the meaning of meditative concentration.

original: brtson zhing sprul pa sprul don du /
analyzed: brtson zhing sprul pa sprul don du /
translated: They strive to emanate emanations

original: de la brten nas byang chub thob //üîΩces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la brten nas byang chub thob // ces bya ba smos so //
translated: and attain enlightenment in dependence on them.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang yang ma bral /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang yang ma bral /
translated: Thus, those of the sravaka type who have not become free from attachment to the desire realm

original: bden pa yang ma mthong ba'i nyan thos kyi rigs ma nges pa de dag ni don ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa yang ma mthong ba'i nyan thos kyi rigs ma nges pa de dag ni don ma byas pa ste /
translated: and have not seen the truth have not accomplished their purpose.

original: so so'i skye bo'am /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'am /
translated: They are ordinary beings.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: They are the bodhisattvas who abide on the stage of action through faith.

original: don ma byas pa de dag 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha tshe ring po'i nang du skye'o //
analyzed: don ma byas pa de dag 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha tshe ring po'i nang du skye'o //
translated: Having died in the desire realm, they are reborn among the long-lived gods of the desire realm.

original: de ltar lha tshe ring po'i nang du 'dug 'dug pa las /
analyzed: de ltar lha tshe ring po'i nang du 'dug 'dug pa las /
translated: Having lived for a long time among the long-lived gods,

original: nam 'jig chen na ston pa sangs rgyas dang / de'i bstan pa la chos rnams nub ste med par gyur pa dang / slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: nam 'jig chen na ston pa sangs rgyas dang / de'i bstan pa la chos rnams nub ste med par gyur pa dang / slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar byed do //
translated: when the world is destroyed and the teaching of the Buddha, the Master, has disappeared, they are reborn again in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas /
translated: Having been reborn in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson zhing 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson zhing 'bad par byed do //
translated: they strive and exert themselves to attain the meditative concentrations of the form realm.

original: de'ang ci'i phyir bsam gtan la brtson zhe na ;üîΩsprul pa sprul pa /
analyzed: de'ang ci'i phyir bsam gtan la brtson zhe na ; sprul pa sprul pa /
translated: Why do they strive for the meditative concentrations?

original: 'dod pa'i don du bsam gtan la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don du bsam gtan la brtson par byed do //
translated: They strive for the meditative concentrations for the sake of emanations.üîΩHaving attained the meditative concentrations,

original: des sprul pa sprul nas /
analyzed: des sprul pa sprul nas /
translated: they emanate emanations.

original: sprul pa de la brten nas de sprul pas khams gsum du sems can gyi don byas nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskangs te /
analyzed: sprul pa de la brten nas de sprul pas khams gsum du sems can gyi don byas nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskangs te /
translated: The meaning is that, on the basis of that emanation, he emanates himself in the three realms, benefits sentient beings, and then, having augmented the collections of merit and wisdom,

analyzed: mjug tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he finally becomes fully enlightened.

original: 'di'i don zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi rigs ma nges pa ni bden pa'i don ma mthong ba'i gang zag 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi rigs ma nges pa ni bden pa'i don ma mthong ba'i gang zag 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The listener of unfixed potential is a person who has not yet seen the meaning of the truths.

original: slob par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo 'am /üîΩmos pa spyod pa'i sa pa na de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos su gyur nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: slob par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo 'am / mos pa spyod pa'i sa pa na de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos su gyur nas shi 'phos te /
translated: Having become a trainee,üîΩhe becomes a disciple of the Tathagata, dies and transmigrates, and is reborn among the long-lived gods of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha tshe ring po'i nang du skyes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha tshe ring po'i nang du skyes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas med pa'i dus na skyes te zhes bya ba ni lha tshe ring po'i nang nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs pa'i tshe skyes nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas med pa'i dus na skyes te zhes bya ba ni lha tshe ring po'i nang nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs pa'i tshe skyes nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When there is no Buddha, means when a Tathagata does not exist in the desire realm, even among the long-lived gods.

original: bsam gtan gyi don las brtson zhing sprul pa 'dod @202a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi don las brtson zhing sprul pa 'dod @202a * //
translated: He strives for the meaning of meditation and desires emanations.

original: de ; sprul pa de dag la brten nas rim gyis byang chub mchog thob po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ; sprul pa de dag la brten nas rim gyis byang chub mchog thob po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Based on those emanations, he gradually attains supreme enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas kyang //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas kyang //
translated: Even though born in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson zhing 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson zhing 'bad par byed do //
translated: he strives and exerts himself to attain the meditations of the form realm.

original: bsam gtan la yang ci'i phyir brtson zhing sprul pa 'dod pa'i phyir brtson par byed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan la yang ci'i phyir brtson zhing sprul pa 'dod pa'i phyir brtson par byed de /
translated: Why does he strive for meditation? He strives to desire emanations.

original: de bsam gtan gyis sprul pa sprul nas /
analyzed: de bsam gtan gyis sprul pa sprul nas /
translated: Having emanated through meditation,

original: sprul pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyis 'dod pa'i khams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sprul pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs kyis 'dod pa'i khams skyed par byed do //
translated: he creates various emanations through supernatural powers in the desire realm.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /

translated: The meaning of he seeks is that he seeks in order to inspire confidence in others who are learned, through his own expertise in the Sanskrit language, and in order to refute the non-Buddhists who are proud of their knowledge of grammar, and in order to become skilled in terminology by teaching and explaining many etymologies for a single meaning.

analyzed: gso ba rig pa byang chub sems dpa' tshol bar byed do //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: nang rig pa byang chub sems dpa' tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: nang rig pa byang chub sems dpa' tshol bar byed de /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rigs dang / sa bon la khams zhes bya ste /
translated: or the lineage of the six perfections, the seed of the perfections.

original: khams de dag ji ltar rgyas shing brtas par 'gyur ba bstan pa la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams de dag ji ltar rgyas shing brtas par 'gyur ba bstan pa la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The investigation of the elements is shown in thirteen verses, in order to show how those elements are developed and increased.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su bskang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su bskang ba'i phyir /
translated: The development of the element is the increase of the lineage.üîΩThe increase of the lineage is the increase of the seed.üîΩThe increase of the seed is the increase of the mental disposition.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin ba de nyid khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba @204a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin ba de nyid khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba @204a * //
translated: The increase of the mental disposition is the increase of the practice.üîΩThe increase of the practice is the increase of the perfections.üîΩThe increase of the perfections is the increase of the elements.

original: la ; ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: la ; ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the element of the perfections increased?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan par yid la byed pa logs nas 'byung ba rnams ltar yid la byas na de nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams dang / sa bon rgyas shing brtas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan par yid la byed pa logs nas 'byung ba rnams ltar yid la byas na de nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams dang / sa bon rgyas shing brtas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the element of the perfections and the seed of the perfections are increased and expanded by just that, when one attends to the six perfections in order to complete the six perfections, as they occur elsewhere.

original: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bstan pa zhes bya ba la /

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ba yid la byed pa yang tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ba yid la byed pa yang tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the attention that increases the element of the perfections is taught by thirteen verses.üîΩJoy in the cause, recollection of its nature,

original: rgyu dmigs nas ni dga' ba dang // gnas la de yi rjes dran dang // 'bras bu thun mong 'dod pa dang // ji ltar byang chub mos pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dmigs nas ni dga' ba dang // gnas la de yi rjes dran dang // 'bras bu thun mong 'dod pa dang // ji ltar byang chub mos pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Desire for the common result, and aspiration for enlightenment.

original: rgyu dmigs nas dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / gnas la de'i rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa dang / 'bras bu'i thun mong 'dod pa yid la byed pa dang / ji ltar byang chub tu mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dmigs nas dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / gnas la de'i rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa dang / 'bras bu'i thun mong 'dod pa yid la byed pa dang / ji ltar byang chub tu mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Attention to the cause, delighting in the realization of the cause; attention to the abode, remembering the latter; attention to the commonality of the result, the desire for enlightenment; attention to the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde yang rgyu rtogs pas dga' ba yid la byed pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // de yang rgyu rtogs pas dga' ba yid la byed pa nas /

original: bdag mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa'i bar du ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa'i bar du ste zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yang /

original: bdag tu mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa 'jug pa'i gnas 'byung ba'i bar dag ltar yid la byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang por bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs su mthong nas rgyu rtogs pa'i dga' bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba la /

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i rigs dang / sa bon nam pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs dang / sa bon dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des dang por bdag nyid la mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba yod dam med pa dang /

analyzed: mi za bar bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag rgyas shing brtas pa dang / rdzogs par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la byed do //
translated: Therefore, I will certainly make these transcendences grow, flourish, and reach fullness.‚Äù

original: yid la byed pa des kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams bdag dang pha rol gyi don du sbyor bas /

translated: Having generated the mind with that meaning, one applies the six perfections for one's own and others' aims.

original: 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attention that desires equal results.

original: rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing spyod par byed de /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing spyod par byed de /
translated: One who abides in the lineage generates the mind of enlightenment and practices the six perfections.

original: de'ang gang gi don du sbyor bar byed ce na bdag dang pha rol gyi don du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de'ang gang gi don du sbyor bar byed ce na bdag dang pha rol gyi don du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: For whose aim does one apply? One applies for one's own and others' aims.

original: ji ltar bdag dang pha rol gyi don du spyor bar byed pa ni 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya @205a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dang pha rol gyi don du spyor bar byed pa ni 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya @205a * //
translated: How does one apply for one's own and others' aims? It is called the attention that desires equal results.

original: ste ; des kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ste ; des kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And by that, the element of the perfections will increase.

original: 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa ji ltar yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa ji ltar yid la byed ce na /
translated: How does one attend to the desire for equal results?

original: de'i phyir / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gzhan dang thun mong du gyur cig / gzhan du ma gyur cig ces mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gzhan dang thun mong du gyur cig / gzhan du ma gyur cig ces mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúHe forms the aspiration, ‚ÄòMay these perfections be shared with others; may they not be otherwise.‚Äô

original: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag spyad pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa spyad pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po la sogs pa yang sems can dang bdag thun mong du spyod par gyur cig / gzhan du bdag 'ba' zhig spyod par ma gyur cig ces sems la sems shing mngon par 'du byed do
analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag spyad pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa spyad pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po la sogs pa yang sems can dang bdag thun mong du spyod par gyur cig / gzhan du bdag 'ba' zhig spyod par ma gyur cig ces sems la sems shing mngon par 'du byed do
translated: He thinks and forms the aspiration, ‚ÄòMay I practice these six perfections and may the fruits of practicing the six perfections, such as great wealth, be shared with sentient beings and myself; may they not be otherwise, may they not be practiced by myself alone.‚Äô

original: // de bas na 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa'i yid la byed par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // de bas na 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod pa'i yid la byed par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the mental attention that is the aspiration for the same result.

original: bdag gang gzhan gyi don la rab tu zhugs nas /
analyzed: bdag gang gzhan gyi don la rab tu zhugs nas /
translated: Having engaged in the welfare of others,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to always realize the meaning of reality, the method of being without afflictions,

original: de'i 'og tu ji ltar byang chub la mos pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ji ltar byang chub la mos pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, the conscientious attitude of devotion to enlightenment.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la zhugs pas kyang nyon mongs pas bcings nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don spyod mi nus pas de bas na nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ba'i thabs de kho na'i don rtag tu rtogs par bya dgos
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la zhugs pas kyang nyon mongs pas bcings nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don spyod mi nus pas de bas na nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ba'i thabs de kho na'i don rtag tu rtogs par bya dgos
translated: Even though one is engaged in the six perfections for the sake of self and other, one is bound by the afflictions and is unable to practice for the sake of self and other. Therefore, one must always realize the meaning of just that method for becoming free of the afflictions.

original: so // ji ltar na de kho na'i don rtag tu rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: so // ji ltar na de kho na'i don rtag tu rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How does one always realize the meaning of just that?

analyzed: ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub du bsngos te /

analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir mos pa yid la byas nas de rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the conscientious attitude of devotion to that, one realizes it.

analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu ji ltar byang chub la mos pa yid la byed pa ni bshad de /

analyzed: yid la byed pa des kyang pa rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad rim bzhin du shes par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the same way, one should understand all the rest in order.

analyzed: ji ltar gong du rigs la gnas pas byang chub du sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: As it was explained above, one should generate the Thought of Enlightenment in the lineage.

translated: Having generated the Thought of Enlightenment, one should keep in mind the application of the six perfections for the sake of self and other, and the common result.

translated: Having entered into the practice for the sake of self and other, one should keep in mind the aspiration for enlightenment in order to realize the method of non-affliction.

translated: All the rest of the mental attentions that will be explained below should be practiced in order, as explained above, in the order in which they are explained.

analyzed: ji ltar byang chub la mos pa yid la byed pa don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the extensive explanation of the mental attention of aspiration for enlightenment,

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúJust as the Lord Buddhas have manifestly awakened to the perfections,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚ÄúJust as the Tathagatas of the past, having practiced the six perfections, have manifestly awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment.‚Äù

original: mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub du mngon par sangs rgyas ba dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub du mngon par sangs rgyas ba dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúManifestly awakened‚Äù means: ‚ÄúJust as the present Lord Buddhas, having practiced the six perfections, have manifestly awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment.‚Äù

original: mngon par sangs rgyas par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising as manifest buddhahood‚Äù is that just as the Tathagatas of the future will attain manifest enlightenment in supreme enlightenment by practicing the six perfections, so too will I.

original: de ltar bdag kyang mos so zhes mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bdag kyang mos so zhes mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of dedicating in this way, one forms the aspiration.

original: ji ltar dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas mngon par sangs rgyas ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pas mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur cig ces bsngo zhing sems la mngon par 'du
analyzed: ji ltar dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad nas mngon par sangs rgyas ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pas mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur cig ces bsngo zhing sems la mngon par 'du
translated: Just as the Tathagatas of the three times attained manifest enlightenment by practicing the six perfections, so too may I attain manifest enlightenment by practicing the six perfections.

original: byed de / de ni ji ltar byang chub la mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed de / de ni ji ltar byang chub la mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attention of aspiration for enlightenment.

original: rnam pa bzhi pa'i mthu 'di yis //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pa'i mthu 'di yis //
translated: By this power of the four aspects,

original: bdag dang mi skyo nges pa des //
analyzed: bdag dang mi skyo nges pa des //
translated: one is not discouraged and is certain.

original: mi mthun dang ni gnyen po la //
analyzed: mi mthun dang ni gnyen po la //
translated: And the antidotes to the discordant factors.üîΩ

original: sgrub pa dag ni rnam bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub pa dag ni rnam bzhi'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The practice is fourfold:üîΩwith regard to the unfavorable, with regard to the antidote,üîΩwith regard to the two aims, and with regard to power.

original: gzhan yang mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / bdag dang sems can smin par bya ba la nges par mi skyo ba yid la bya ba mi mthun pa dang gnyen po sgrub pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / bdag dang sems can smin par bya ba la nges par mi skyo ba yid la bya ba mi mthun pa dang gnyen po sgrub pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The practice is fourfold: with regard to the unfavorable, with regard to the antidote, with regard to the two aims, and with regard to power.

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By these attentions, the element of the transcendences is developed.

original: gong du bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu mos par bya'o zhes bshad do //üîΩde la byang chub tu mos pa'i rjes la mthu'i dga' ba yid @206a * //
analyzed: gong du bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu mos par bya'o zhes bshad do // de la byang chub tu mos pa'i rjes la mthu'i dga' ba yid @206a * //
translated: It was said above that one should be intent on enlightenment in order to enter into the aims of self and other and to understand reality in order to avoid affliction.

original: la byed pa'i skabs bshad cing 'brel bas na /
analyzed: la byed pa'i skabs bshad cing 'brel bas na /
translated: After that, the attention of delight in power is explained, because it is the occasion and the connection.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med kyang mthu dang mi ldan na ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub mi nus kyi mthu dang ldan na gdod sgrub nus pas na byang chub la mos pa'i 'og tu mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa bstan par 'brel to
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med kyang mthu dang mi ldan na ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub mi nus kyi mthu dang ldan na gdod sgrub nus pas na byang chub la mos pa'i 'og tu mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa bstan par 'brel to
translated: Thus, although one is free from defilement, if one does not have power, one is not able to accomplish the aims of self and other. But if one has power, then one is able to accomplish them. Therefore, after the aspiration for enlightenment, the attention to the joy of power is taught, because it is connected with that.

original: // de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa'i dus na bdag la mthu rnam pa bzhi yod par mthong nas dga' ba ni mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ste mthu rnam pa bzhi ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: // de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa'i dus na bdag la mthu rnam pa bzhi yod par mthong nas dga' ba ni mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ste mthu rnam pa bzhi ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The joy of power is the joy that one feels when one sees that one has four kinds of power while one is practicing the six perfections. The four kinds of power will be explained below.

original: de ltar mthu dang ldan na bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa la skyo ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar mthu dang ldan na bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa la skyo ba med de /
translated: If one has such power, one is not discouraged in bringing the Buddha qualities to maturity and in bringing beings to maturity.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu nges par mi skyo ba'i yid la byed pa bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu nges par mi skyo ba'i yid la byed pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, after that, the attention to the absence of discouragement is explained.

original: de ltar skyo ba med na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar skyo ba med na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If one is not discouraged in that way, then in order to attain supreme enlightenment, one must have the attention to the great armor.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spang ba dang / gnyen po sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi yid la byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spang ba dang / gnyen po sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi yid la byed do //
translated: One keeps in mind the four kinds of keeping in mind the avoidance of the resistances stinginess, etc. and the practice of the remedies generosity, etc.

original: de bas na nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa'i rjes la mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po sgrub pa yid la byed pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa'i rjes la mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po sgrub pa yid la byed pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: Therefore, after the keeping in mind of indefatigability, the four keeping in mind the avoidance of resistances and the practice of remedies are taught.

original: mthu rnam pa bzhi bstan pas dga' bas na /üîΩmthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mthu rnam pa bzhi bstan pas dga' bas na / mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po spyod pa'i tshe /

original: bdag nyid la mthu rnam pa bzhi yod par mthong nas dga' ba ni mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid la mthu rnam pa bzhi yod par mthong nas dga' ba ni mthu'i dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The keeping in mind of delight in power is the delight in seeing the fourfold power of the bodhisattvas when they practice the six perfections.üîΩThe keeping in mind of delight in power

original: mthu rnam pa bzhi ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna dang / ngan pa'i ngang tshul dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mthu rnam pa bzhi ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna dang / ngan pa'i ngang tshul dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four kinds of power are: the elimination of adverse elements, the ability to eliminate the adverse elements of the six perfections, such as stinginess, immorality, and anger,

original: sbyin pas ni ser sna sel nus par mthong /
analyzed: sbyin pas ni ser sna sel nus par mthong /
translated: because one sees that generosity is able to eliminate stinginess,

original: tshul khrims kyis ni ngan pa'i ngang tshul gyi dri ma sel nus par mthong /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni ngan pa'i ngang tshul gyi dri ma sel nus par mthong /
translated: that morality is able to eliminate the stain of immorality,

original: bzod pas ni khong khro ba sel nus par mthong /
analyzed: bzod pas ni khong khro ba sel nus par mthong /
translated: that tolerance is able to eliminate anger,

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni le lo sel nus par mthong /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni le lo sel nus par mthong /
translated: that effort is able to eliminate laziness,

original: bsam gtan gyis ni sems g-yeng ba sel nus par mthong /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni sems g-yeng ba sel nus par mthong /
translated: that contemplation is able to eliminate distraction,

original: shes rab kyis ni rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pa la sogs 'chal pa'i shes rab sel nus par mthong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pa la sogs 'chal pa'i shes rab sel nus par mthong ste /
translated: and that wisdom is able to eliminate the immorality of wisdom, such as the holding of eternalism and nihilism.

original: 'di ni mthu rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni mthu rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first kind of power.

original: tshogs smin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshogs smin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The maturation of the accumulations,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing smin @206b par mthong ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing smin @206b par mthong ste /
translated: One sees that the practice of the six perfections accumulates and perfects the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: spyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang gsum spyad pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs par mthong /
analyzed: spyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang gsum spyad pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs par mthong /
translated: One sees that the practice of the three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience accumulates the collection of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis spyad pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs sogs par mthong /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis spyad pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs sogs par mthong /
translated: One sees that the practice of the two perfections of meditative stabilization and wisdom accumulates the collection of knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus spyad pas ni gnyis ka'i tshogs bsags pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus spyad pas ni gnyis ka'i tshogs bsags pa mthong ba ste /
translated: One sees that the practice of effort accumulates both collections.

original: 'di ni mthu rnam pa gnyis so //üîΩbdag dang pha rol la phan btags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa na /
analyzed: 'di ni mthu rnam pa gnyis so // bdag dang pha rol la phan btags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa na /
translated: This is the two kinds of power.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par mthong ste /
translated: When one practices the six perfections, one sees that one benefits oneself and others.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nam sbyin pa gtong ba'i dus na /
analyzed: nam sbyin pa gtong ba'i dus na /
translated: When it is time to practice generosity,

original: sbyin pa btang bar dga' ba dang / sbyin pa btang ba dang / btang nas 'gyod pa med de /
analyzed: sbyin pa btang bar dga' ba dang / sbyin pa btang ba dang / btang nas 'gyod pa med de /
translated: one is happy to practice generosity, and after practicing generosity, one has no regrets.

original: dus gsum du yang dga' bas ni bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang dga' bas ni bdag la phan btags so //
translated: And in the three times, he has helped me with joy.

original: bza' ba dar bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing gis phan btags te phongs pa med par byas pas ni gzhan la phan btags so //
analyzed: bza' ba dar bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing gis phan btags te phongs pa med par byas pas ni gzhan la phan btags so //
translated: He has helped others by giving them material things such as food, drink, clothes, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ngan pa'i ngang tshul gyis ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i brdeg pa dang bcing pa la sogs pa med par gyur pas bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ngan pa'i ngang tshul gyis ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i brdeg pa dang bcing pa la sogs pa med par gyur pas bdag la phan btags so //
translated: He has helped me by not having the causes of bad conduct, such as taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, beating, binding, etc.

original: gzhan gyi srog dang nor dang chung ma la gnod pa ma byas pas gzhan la phan btags so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog dang nor dang chung ma la gnod pa ma byas pas gzhan la phan btags so //
translated: He has helped others by not harming the life, wealth, or wives of others.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang bzod pa la gnas na zhe sdang gi mes sems ma dkrugs pas na sems bde ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang bzod pa la gnas na zhe sdang gi mes sems ma dkrugs pas na sems bde ba'o //
translated: In the perfection of patience, he has helped me by not disturbing my mind with the fire of hatred while abiding in patience.

original: sems bde na sems kyi rjes su lus 'brang ba'i phyir lus kyang bde bas bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: sems bde na sems kyi rjes su lus 'brang ba'i phyir lus kyang bde bas bdag la phan btags so //
translated: And since the body follows the mind, he has helped me by making my body happy.

original: gnod pa byed pa la lan ma byas pas gzhan la phan btags so //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la lan ma byas pas gzhan la phan btags so //
translated: By not retaliating against those who harm you, you help others.

original: brtson 'grus la nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus spyad pas tshe 'dir dge ba rgyun du 'phel ba'i phyir bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus spyad pas tshe 'dir dge ba rgyun du 'phel ba'i phyir bdag la phan btags so //
translated: By practicing the diligence of listening, reflection, and so forth, you help yourself, for virtue increases in your mindstream in this life.

original: sems can rnams kyi las su bya ba rnams kyi grogs byas pas gzhan la phan btags so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las su bya ba rnams kyi grogs byas pas gzhan la phan btags so //
translated: By helping sentient beings with their work, you help others.

original: bsam gtan la yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir bdag la phan btags so //
translated: By abiding in the concentration that is free of the distraction of discursive thought, you help yourself, for it pacifies the afflictions.

original: bsam gtan gyi mthus lo nyes dang nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pas gzhan la phan btags so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mthus lo nyes dang nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pas gzhan la phan btags so //
translated: By pacifying famine, disease, and so forth through the power of concentration, you help others.

original: shes rab kyis kyang shes bya'i chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du shes te sems kyi rgyud la ma rig pa'i mun @207a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyis kyang shes bya'i chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du shes te sems kyi rgyud la ma rig pa'i mun @207a * //
translated: By means of wisdom, you help yourself, for you know all knowable phenomena as they are and dispel the darkness of ignorance in your mindstream.

original: pa bsal bas na bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: pa bsal bas na bdag la phan btags so //
translated: By means of wisdom, you help others, for you teach the Dharma to others.

original: shes rab kyi chos phyin ci ma log par bshad cing sems can gyi the tshom bsal nas gzhan la phan btags te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi chos phyin ci ma log par bshad cing sems can gyi the tshom bsal nas gzhan la phan btags te /
translated: The Dharma of wisdom is explained without error, and having cleared away the doubts of sentient beings, one benefits others.

original: 'di ni mthu rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthu rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third power.üîΩThe ripened result and the result resembling the cause will ripen in the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshe rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu 'dra ba'i 'bras bu smin pa'o zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshe rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu 'dra ba'i 'bras bu smin pa'o zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad na /
translated: Having practiced the six perfections,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas na ma 'ongs pa na longs spyod chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas na ma 'ongs pa na longs spyod chen por 'gyur /
translated: by practicing the perfection of generosity, in the future one will have great wealth.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni lha dang mi'i lus thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni lha dang mi'i lus thob par 'gyur /
translated: By ethics, one will obtain a human or divine body.

original: bzod pas ni 'khor g-yog phun sum tshogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzod pas ni 'khor g-yog phun sum tshogs par 'gyur /
translated: By patience, one will have a perfect retinue.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni las kyi mtha' thams cad 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni las kyi mtha' thams cad 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: By diligence, all one's activities will be accomplished.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nad med par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nad med par 'gyur /
translated: By concentration, one will be free from illness.

original: shes rab kyis ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: By wisdom, one will become skilled in all the sciences.

original: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the ripened result.

original: tshe rabs gang dang gang du skyes par smin par byed pa la dga' bas na shes rab sgrub pa la dga' bas ni rgyu 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gang dang gang du skyes par smin par byed pa la dga' bas na shes rab sgrub pa la dga' bas ni rgyu 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: One delights in accomplishing wisdom.

original: 'di ni mthu rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthu rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth power.

original: nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The conscientious attitude of not being discouraged

original: sems can thams cad dang bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos sbyin pa las brtsams nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos sbyin pa las brtsams nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: is based on the giving of the Buddha qualities to all sentient beings and to oneself.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byas pa las brtsams te /üîΩsems la skyo ba med pa ni nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byas pa las brtsams te / sems la skyo ba med pa ni nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is not discouraged in mind with regard to the maturation of sentient beings through the means of gathering, with regard to listening to the holy Dharma through reliance on a spiritual guide, and with regard to the maturation of oneself in the Buddha qualities through reflection and so on.üîΩThis is called the conscientious attitude of not being discouraged.

original: ci'i phyir nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed ce na /
translated: Why is it called the conscientious attitude of not being discouraged?

original: de'i phyir / sems can gyi log par spyod pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal thams cad byung yang nges par mi skyo bar mngon par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems can gyi log par spyod pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal thams cad byung yang nges par mi skyo bar mngon par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of definitely not being discouraged by any of the sentient beings‚Äô perverse conduct and by all the sufferings that occur.‚Äù

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na /
translated: Because of bringing sentient beings to full maturity,

original: yang sems can la phan btags pa dag gnod par byed pa dang / nyes pa med par yang nyes par byed la /
analyzed: yang sems can la phan btags pa dag gnod par byed pa dang / nyes pa med par yang nyes par byed la /
translated: Again, in helping sentient beings, they are harmed, and they are blamed even though they are innocent.üîΩThey are not discouraged by any of the sentient beings‚Äô perverse conduct, and they do not abandon sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi log par spyod pa thams cad kyis skyo ba med cing sems can mi gtong ba dang / bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi mos pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa la @207b sogs pa byed pa'i tshe na phyi'i gnod pa grang ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi log par spyod pa thams cad kyis skyo ba med cing sems can mi gtong ba dang / bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi mos pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa la @207b sogs pa byed pa'i tshe na phyi'i gnod pa grang ba dang /
translated: When they are listening to the sacred Dharma from spiritual masters in order to bring about their own full maturity in interest in the Buddha, and when they are reflecting on it and so on, they are not discouraged by the physical harm they may suffer, such as being burned or cut.

original: tsha ba la sogs pa byung ba dang / nang gi gnod pa bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa byung yang mnyan pa la sogs pa mi btang ngo snyam du sems la mngon par 'du byed pas ni nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tsha ba la sogs pa byung ba dang / nang gi gnod pa bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa byung yang mnyan pa la sogs pa mi btang ngo snyam du sems la mngon par 'du byed pas ni nges par mi skyo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental attention that is definitely not discouraged is called the mental attention of non-discouragement.

original: byang chub mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po sgrub pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po sgrub pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are four kinds of mental attention that accomplish the unfavorable and favorable for attaining supreme enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa ser sna nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa ser sna nas /
translated: For the sake of attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, one should abandon stinginess, which is unfavorable to generosity, up to faulty wisdom, which is unfavorable to wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi bar spangs pa dang / gnyen po sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar dag sgrub par yid la bya ba rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi bar spangs pa dang / gnyen po sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar dag sgrub par yid la bya ba rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and accomplish the favorable, which is generosity up to wisdom. There are four kinds of mental attention. This is the meaning.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa ser sna la sogs pa bshags pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa ser sna la sogs pa bshags pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mental attention of confessing the unfavorable such as stinginess in regard to generosity and so on, and

original: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna nas shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi bar dag ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna nas shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi bar dag ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ste ;
translated: From stinginess, which is the antithesis of generosity, up to false wisdom, which is the antithesis of wisdom, are called sinful, unwholesome dharmas.

original: de dag byung na yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag byung na yang so sor bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And when they occur, one should confess them individually.

original: gnyen po sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang zhes bya ba la ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po ni sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: gnyen po sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang zhes bya ba la ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po ni sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du ste /
translated: One rejoices in the antidotes, generosity, etc. Stinginess, etc., are the antidotes to generosity, etc., up to wisdom.

original: de dag bdag dang gzhan gyi don spyad pa mthong nas dga' zhing mos pa skyes pa ni rjes su yi rang bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bdag dang gzhan gyi don spyad pa mthong nas dga' zhing mos pa skyes pa ni rjes su yi rang bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one sees that they are engaged in the benefit of self and other, one gives rise to joy and interest, and this is called ‚Äúrejoicing.‚Äù

original: de'i ched kyis chos bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams la gsol ba gdab pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i ched kyis chos bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams la gsol ba gdab pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to hear that Dharma, one requests the Buddhas to teach.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dbang du byas nas bshad pa'i chos ni de'i ched kyi chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dbang du byas nas bshad pa'i chos ni de'i ched kyi chos zhes bya ste /
translated: The Dharma that is explained in terms of the six perfections is called ‚Äúthe Dharma for that purpose.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos mnyan cing bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos mnyan cing bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to listen to and explain the Dharma of the six perfections,üîΩone supplicates the tathagatas to turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba 'debs pa ni sangs rgyas rnams la gsol ba gdab pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba 'debs pa ni sangs rgyas rnams la gsol ba gdab pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is called supplicating the buddhas.

original: de dag kyang byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag kyang byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of those is as follows.

original: sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang bar bya ba'am /
translated: Confessing negative actions, rejoicing in virtue,üîΩor supplicating the buddhas, one dedicates those to unsurpassable enlightenment, thinking, ‚ÄúMay I attain buddhahood.‚Äù

original: gsol ba gdab pa dag gis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par gyur cig ces bsngo ba ni de dag kyang byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa dag gis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par gyur cig ces bsngo ba ni de dag kyang byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called dedicating those to enlightenment.

original: tshig de rnams kyang mdo sde dag las sdig pa thams cad slar bshags pa dang / dge ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / @208a * //
analyzed: tshig de rnams kyang mdo sde dag las sdig pa thams cad slar bshags pa dang / dge ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / @208a * //
translated: Those words are also found in the sutras, where it says, ‚ÄúI confess all my negative actions, I rejoice in all virtue, I supplicate all buddhas,

original: bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas par shog shig ces gsungs pa'i tshigs bcad dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas par shog shig ces gsungs pa'i tshigs bcad dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: May I attain unexcelled enlightenment!üîΩFaith, full acceptance,

original: dang ba yang dag blangs pa dang // sbyin sred dag ni gzhan dag la //
analyzed: dang ba yang dag blangs pa dang // sbyin sred dag ni gzhan dag la //
translated: and longing for generosity toward others,

original: go cha smon lam dang ba ni //
analyzed: go cha smon lam dang ba ni //
translated: armor, aspiration, and faith,

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed //
translated: are the mental attentions of delight.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gzhan la dbang ba yid la byed pa dang / yang dag par blang ba yid la byed pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa sred pa yid la byed pa dang / go cha yid la byed pa dang / smon lam yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan la dbang ba yid la byed pa dang / yang dag par blang ba yid la byed pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa sred pa yid la byed pa dang / go cha yid la byed pa dang / smon lam yid la byed pa dang /
translated: the mental attention of mastery, the mental attention of full acceptance, the mental attention of longing for generosity toward others, the mental attention of armor, the mental attention of aspiration,

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ste /
translated: and the mental attention of delight.

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By these mental attentions, the element of the perfections is developed. This is the meaning.

original: dad pa'i mthu las brtsams nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ched kyi don la dang bar yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad pa'i mthu las brtsams nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ched kyi don la dang bar yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is mental attention that is clear about the meaning of the perfections, beginning with the power of faith.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la rgyur gyur pa la ni chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la rgyur gyur pa la ni chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma is that which causes the perfections to arise.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'bras bu la ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'bras bu la ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is the result of the six perfections.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'chad pa la ni chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'chad pa la ni chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the Dharma is the explanation of the six perfections.

original: des mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po la ni don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po la ni don zhes bya ste /
translated: The meaning is the thing that is illustrated by that explanation.

original: dang ba dang dang bas rgyu byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag rgyur gyur pa spyad na ni de'i 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes yid ches pa ni dang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang ba dang dang bas rgyu byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag rgyur gyur pa spyad na ni de'i 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes yid ches pa ni dang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Mental attention that is clear is the conviction that if one practices the six perfections, which are the cause, one will certainly obtain their result.

original: chos tshol ba las brtsams nas yang dag par len par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos tshol ba las brtsams nas yang dag par len par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the correct taking up of the Dharma, beginning with the search for the Dharma.

original: chos tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te /
analyzed: chos tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te /
translated: With regard to the search for the Dharma, one relies on a spiritual master.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang / chos la sogs pa nyan cing bsams pa ni yang dag par len pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang / chos la sogs pa nyan cing bsams pa ni yang dag par len pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One listens to and reflects upon the meaning of the perfections, the Dharma, etc. This is the attention of correct adoption.

original: ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does one correctly adopt?

original: de'i phyir chos de'i de dag nyid mi spong ba'i tshul gyis gzung bas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de'i de dag nyid mi spong ba'i tshul gyis gzung bas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äúby holding them through the method of not rejecting those dharmas.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos de dag nyid la skur pa mi 'debs shing nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa mi 'dor ba ni mi spong ba'i tshul gyis gzung ba zhes bya ste /
