analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos de dag nyid la skur pa mi 'debs shing nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa mi 'dor ba ni mi spong ba'i tshul gyis gzung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: One does not deny those very dharmas of the perfections, and one does not abandon listening to and reflecting upon them, etc. This is called ‚Äúholding them through the method of not rejecting them.‚Äù

original: de dag yang dag par len pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par len pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: This is the attention of correct adoption.

original: bshad pa las brtsams nas sbyin pa la sred pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa las brtsams nas sbyin pa la sred pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: With regard to the explanation, there is the attention of craving for generosity.

original: gzhan la chos dang don rab tu bsgrags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la bshad pa'i don du byas nas sems can gzhan la pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'chad par 'dod pa ni sbyin pa la sred pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la chos dang don rab tu bsgrags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la bshad pa'i don du byas nas sems can gzhan la pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'chad par 'dod pa ni sbyin pa la sred pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The conscientious attitude of craving generosity is the desire to explain the six perfections to other sentient beings, taking them as the object of the explanation.

original: ji ltar 'chad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chad ce na /
translated: How does one explain?

original: sems @208b can gzhan dag la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos dang don phyin ci ma log par sgrogs shing 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems @208b can gzhan dag la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos dang don phyin ci ma log par sgrogs shing 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one proclaims and explains to other sentient beings the teaching and its import, the six perfections, without error.

original: bsgrubs pa las brtsams nas go cha'i yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrubs pa las brtsams nas go cha'i yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The conscientious attitude of armoring is based on practice.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir go cha bgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa'i ched du byas nas de drug bsgrub pa ni go cha yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir go cha bgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa'i ched du byas nas de drug bsgrub pa ni go cha yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The conscientious attitude of armoring is the practice of the six perfections, because one dons the armor in order to perfect generosity and so on.

original: ji ltar sgrub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub ce na /
translated: How does one practice?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa gtong zhing go gyon nas shes rab sgrub cing go gyon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa gtong zhing go gyon nas shes rab sgrub cing go gyon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they give gifts, they put on the armor in order to complete and perfect the six perfections, and because they practice and put on the armor of wisdom.

original: smon lam yid la byed pa ni de rdzogs pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smon lam yid la byed pa ni de rdzogs pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attentiveness to aspiration is because it possesses the conditions for completing them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / nye du gnyen bshes dang lus dang longs spyod la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen dang ldan par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs ba ni smon lam yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / nye du gnyen bshes dang lus dang longs spyod la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen dang ldan par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs ba ni smon lam yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In order to complete the six perfections, wherever they are born in their series of lives, they make the aspiration, ‚ÄúMay I possess the conditions of the causes and effects of completing the six perfections, such as spiritual masters, relatives, friends, body, possessions and so on.‚Äù This is called attentiveness to aspiration.

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni kye ma sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang / yang dag par sgrub par shog shig ces smon par dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni kye ma sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang / yang dag par sgrub par shog shig ces smon par dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conscientious attitude of delight is the delight of wishing, ‚ÄúOh, may I practice generosity and so forth, and may I accomplish them perfectly!‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ma bsgrubs par ni mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur bas na gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub dgos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ma bsgrubs par ni mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur bas na gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub dgos pa'i phyir /
translated: Since one does not become fully enlightened without accomplishing the transcendences, wherever one is born one must practice the six transcendences.

original: ae ma tshe rabs de dang de dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub nus pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na legs so snyam du sems pa ni mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ae ma tshe rabs de dang de dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub nus pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na legs so snyam du sems pa ni mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of delight is the thought, ‚ÄúOh, how good it would be if I were able to practice the six transcendences in all those lives!‚Äù

original: de ltar yid la byed pa de gsum gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa de gsum gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: These three conscientious attitudes should be applied to the instructions and teachings.

original: bsgrub pa'i rjes la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa bshad de /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i rjes la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa bshad de /
translated: The instructions and teachings are explained after the practice.

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: And later:

original: de bzhin rab tu bsgrubs pa dang // yang dag gdams dang bstan pa'o //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin rab tu bsgrubs pa dang // yang dag gdams dang bstan pa'o // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the vow, and the delight in teaching and instruction.

original: de la go cha dang / smon lam dang / mngon par dga' ba'i yid la byed pa gsum ni gdams pa dang bstan pa'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de la go cha dang / smon lam dang / mngon par dga' ba'i yid la byed pa gsum ni gdams pa dang bstan pa'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The armor, the vow, and the delight in teaching and instruction are to be connected with the occasion of teaching and instruction.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gdams pa dang bstan pa thob pa'i phyir go cha gyon par byed do //
analyzed: gdams pa dang bstan pa thob pa'i phyir go cha gyon par byed do //
translated: One puts on the armor because one has obtained teaching and instruction.

original: smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: smon lam 'debs so //
translated: One makes a vow.

original: mngon par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar byed do //
translated: One delights in it.

original: ae ma'o 'di ltar bdag la ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gdams pa dang bstan pa ston @209a * //
analyzed: ae ma'o 'di ltar bdag la ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gdams pa dang bstan pa ston @209a * //
translated: One makes the vow, ‚ÄúOh, may the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas teach and instruct me in this way.‚Äù

original: par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs shing de ltar dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs shing de ltar dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One delights in it in this way.

original: thabs dang ldan pa'i las yid la byed pa ni rtog pa dag gis rnam pa thams cad sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor zhing yid la byed pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa'i las yid la byed pa ni rtog pa dag gis rnam pa thams cad sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor zhing yid la byed pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conscientious attitude of activity associated with the means is the conscientious attitude of the bodhisattva who is engaged in all the activities of giving, etc.,

original: gdams pa dang bstan pa'i 'og tu thabs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bshad do //üîΩde la thabs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis lag nas sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas su zin kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa dag mthong na yid kyi rtogs pas rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: gdams pa dang bstan pa'i 'og tu thabs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa bshad do // de la thabs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis lag nas sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas su zin kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa dag mthong na yid kyi rtogs pas rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: After the instructions and teachings, the mental attention endowed with means is explained.

original: mngon par dga' ba dang / ro myong bar byed pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par bya ba la sbyor zhing yid la rtog pa ni thabs dang ldan pa'i las yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba dang / ro myong bar byed pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par bya ba la sbyor zhing yid la rtog pa ni thabs dang ldan pa'i las yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the mental attention endowed with means is as follows: Even if one has not personally performed generosity and so on, when one sees others practicing the six perfections, one rejoices mentally, one delights, and one savors it. By means of this, one connects with the perfection of generosity and so on, and one mentally imagines completing the perfections. This is called the mental attention endowed with the means of the mental attention of the six perfections.

original: mthu thob pas ni spro ba ste //
analyzed: mthu thob pas ni spro ba ste //
translated: Through obtaining power, one is enthusiastic.

original: sbyin pa la sogs drug stug po //üîΩyongs su sbyin dang mchod pa ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs drug stug po // yongs su sbyin dang mchod pa ste //
translated: The six perfections are the thickets.üîΩGenerosity and worship

original: brten pa dang ni snying brtse ba'o //
analyzed: brten pa dang ni snying brtse ba'o //
translated: are the supports and compassion.

original: zhes bya'o // thabs dang ldan pa'i las yid la byed pa'i 'og tu spro ba yid la byed pa bshad pa'i skabs yin pas de bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // thabs dang ldan pa'i las yid la byed pa'i 'og tu spro ba yid la byed pa bshad pa'i skabs yin pas de bshad do //
translated: After the attention to the activity associated with the means, the attention to enthusiasm is explained, because it is the occasion for explaining it.

original: spro ba yid la byed pa la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /üîΩde la sbyin pa la yang sbyin pa'i sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar du drug yod pa dang / shes rab la yang shes rab kyi sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi shes rab kyi bar du drug drug yod do //
analyzed: spro ba yid la byed pa la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de / de la sbyin pa la yang sbyin pa'i sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar du drug yod pa dang / shes rab la yang shes rab kyi sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi shes rab kyi bar du drug drug yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of attention to enthusiasm.üîΩThere are six kinds of generosity, from the generosity of generosity up to the generosity of wisdom. There are six kinds of morality, from the morality of generosity up to the morality of wisdom. There are six kinds of patience, from the patience of generosity up to the patience of wisdom. There are six kinds of effort, from the effort of generosity up to the effort of wisdom. There are six kinds of meditation, from the meditation of generosity up to the meditation of wisdom. There are six kinds of wisdom, from the wisdom of generosity up to the wisdom of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gcig cing yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug drug yod pas na sbyin pa la sogs pa drug drug stug po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gcig cing yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug drug yod pas na sbyin pa la sogs pa drug drug stug po zhes bya ste /
translated: Since each of the perfections has six perfections, generosity and so on are called the six times six.

original: gcig pa drug yod pa'i mthu thob pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gcig pa drug yod pa'i mthu thob pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa dang po'o //
translated: The attainment of the power of having the six ones is the first attention to enthusiasm.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid bsdu pa'i dngos po'i tshul du bzhag nas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa gnyis pa'o //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byed /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid bsdu pa'i dngos po'i tshul du bzhag nas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa gnyis pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byed /
translated: The second attention is the attention of delight, which is the maturation of sentient beings by means of the six perfections, which are established as the means of gathering disciples.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma lngas ni sgrub pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byed pa 'di ni spro ba yid la byed pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma lngas ni sgrub pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byed pa 'di ni spro ba yid la byed pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third attention is the attention of delight, which is the worship of the Tathagata by means of the six perfections, the worship of the Tathagata with gifts and honors by means of the perfection of generosity, and the worship of the Tathagata with practice by means of the remaining five perfections.

original: pha rol ru phyin pa phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brtan pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol ru phyin pa phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brtan pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth attention is the attention of delight, which is the stability in the spiritual friend in order to seek the spiritual friend who teaches the perfections without error.

original: snying brtse ba yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of attention to compassion:

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang @209b dga' ba dang btang snyoms te /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang @209b dga' ba dang btang snyoms te /
translated: love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid zhib tu ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid zhib tu ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of these will be explained in detail below.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug sbyin pa'i sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du mthu rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug sbyin pa'i sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du mthu rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The six perfections beginning with generosity are the power to give, etc.

original: sbyin pa la yang drug ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la yang drug ste /
translated: Generosity is sixfold:

original: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: the generosity of generosity, up to the generosity of wisdom.

original: de ltar drug yod pas na sdug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar drug yod pas na sdug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since there are six of these, it is called ‚Äúbeautiful.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i mthu rnyed pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mthu rnyed pa ni spro ba yid la byed pa dang po'o //
translated: The attainment of such power is the first mental attention of enthusiasm.

original: de ltar sbyin pa la ji ltar drug yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa la ji ltar drug yod ce na /
translated: How is generosity sixfold?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i rang bzhin gyi phung po lngas ni sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i rang bzhin gyi phung po lngas ni sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Generosity is called the five aggregates which have the nature of virtue.

original: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi phung po lngas ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po sbyin bar 'dod pa ni sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi phung po lngas ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po sbyin bar 'dod pa ni sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The generosity of generosity is the desire to give external and internal things by means of the five aggregates which have the nature of generosity.

original: yang na nor dang 'bru la sogs pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na nor dang 'bru la sogs pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, generosity is called wealth, grain, etc.

original: de nam gzhan la gtong zhing sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nam gzhan la gtong zhing sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the giving of giving which is given to others.

original: sbyin pa'i tshul khrims ji lta bu zhe na nam sems can rnams tshul khrims la bkod pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshul khrims ji lta bu zhe na nam sems can rnams tshul khrims la bkod pa'am /
translated: What is the morality of giving? It is the giving of morality when one establishes sentient beings in morality,

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims bshad pa'i tshul khrims sbyin pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims bshad pa'i tshul khrims sbyin pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: or when one explains morality to others.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa rnam pa drug la yang sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa rnam pa drug la yang sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the same way, the six kinds of morality, etc. should be applied.

original: sbyin pa la drug yod pa de bzhin du tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar du re re la yang drug drug yod par sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa la drug yod pa de bzhin du tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar du re re la yang drug drug yod par sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as there are six kinds of giving, so there are six kinds of morality, etc. up to six kinds of wisdom.

original: ji lta zhen /
analyzed: ji lta zhen /
translated: What are they?

original: tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba nas tshul khrims kyi shes rab ces bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //üîΩde la gzhan gyi nor dang srog dang chung ma la gnod pa ma byas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba nas tshul khrims kyi shes rab ces bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro // de la gzhan gyi nor dang srog dang chung ma la gnod pa ma byas te /
translated: The giving of morality, up to the wisdom of morality.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the giving of morality is the giving of fearlessness when one does not harm the wealth, life, or wife of another.

original: srog gcod pa dang ma byin bar len pa la sogs pa bsdams te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang ma byin bar len pa la sogs pa bsdams te /
translated: One restrains oneself from killing, stealing, and so forth.üîΩ

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pa ni tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pa ni tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: Morality is the restraint of killing, stealing, and so on, and the observance of morality.

original: tshul khrims la gnas ba rnams gshe ba las slar mi gshe ba dang / brdeg pa las slar mi brdeg pa la sogs pa byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas ba rnams gshe ba las slar mi gshe ba dang / brdeg pa las slar mi brdeg pa la sogs pa byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience in morality is the patience of one who abides in morality, who does not retaliate with abuse for abuse, or with anger for anger, and so on.

original: tshul khrims rgyun du bsrungs pa ni tshul khrims kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rgyun du bsrungs pa ni tshul khrims kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: Effort in morality is the constant observance of morality.

original: rtag tu tshul khrims la sems rtse gcig tu 'dzog pa ni tshul khrims kyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu tshul khrims la sems rtse gcig tu 'dzog pa ni tshul khrims kyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: Meditation in morality is the one-pointed focus of the mind that is always moral.

original: ltung ba mi ltung ba'i bye brag phyed pa ni tshul khrims kyi shes rab ces bya'o //üîΩbzod pa la yang bzod pa la gnas pa rnams brdeg pa la slar mi brdeg pa la sogs pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pa ni bzod pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba mi ltung ba'i bye brag phyed pa ni tshul khrims kyi shes rab ces bya'o // bzod pa la yang bzod pa la gnas pa rnams brdeg pa la slar mi brdeg pa la sogs pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pa ni bzod pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Wisdom in morality is the discernment of what is and is not a downfall.

original: bzod @210a * //
analyzed: bzod @210a * //
translated: Generosity of patience is the giving of fearlessness by one who abides in patience, who does not retaliate with abuse for abuse, or with anger for anger, and so on.

original: pa la gnas pa rnams srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed pa ni bzod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: pa la gnas pa rnams srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed pa ni bzod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of patience is the patience of one who abides in the stage of patience, and who does not commit actions such as killing.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang zhe mi sdang ba ni bzod ba'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang zhe mi sdang ba ni bzod ba'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience of patience is the non-hatred of one who is harmed by another.

original: rtag tu bzod pa'i sems 'ba' zhig 'byung ba ni bzod pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: rtag tu bzod pa'i sems 'ba' zhig 'byung ba ni bzod pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort of patience is the constant occurrence of the mere thought of patience.

original: zha sdang gi sems ma g-yengs pa ni bzod pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: zha sdang gi sems ma g-yengs pa ni bzod pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The meditation of patience is the non-distraction of the thought of patience.

original: sems can gzhan la gnod pa byas na ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal myong bar mthong pa ni bzod pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la gnod pa byas na ma 'ongs pa na sdug bsngal myong bar mthong pa ni bzod pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom of patience is the insight that if one harms another being, one will experience suffering in the future.

original: brtson 'grus la yang sems can gzhan gyi grogs byas shing btang ba ni brtson 'grus kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la yang sems can gzhan gyi grogs byas shing btang ba ni brtson 'grus kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of effort is the assistance and release of another being through one's own effort.

original: dge ba la brtson 'grus rtsom pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa ni brtson 'grus kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dge ba la brtson 'grus rtsom pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa ni brtson 'grus kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of effort is the undertaking of effort in virtue and the non-engagement in non-virtue.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i dus na grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i nyams su len pa ni brtson 'grus kyi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i dus na grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i nyams su len pa ni brtson 'grus kyi bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience of effort is the practice of the bodhisattva who, when he begins to make effort, does not turn back even if he encounters cold, heat, and so on.

original: dge ba la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: dge ba la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort of effort is the delight in virtue of the one who has begun to make effort.

original: le los sems ma g-yengs pa ni brtson 'grus kyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //üîΩbrtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid phyed par shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: le los sems ma g-yengs pa ni brtson 'grus kyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o // brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid phyed par shes par 'gyur te /
translated: The meditation of effort is the nondistraction of the mind of the one who has begun to make effort and who is free from laziness.

original: de ni brtson 'grus kyi shes rab bo //üîΩbsam gtan la yang bsam gtan gyi mthu lo nyes dang nad la sogs pa med par byas te ;
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus kyi shes rab bo // bsam gtan la yang bsam gtan gyi mthu lo nyes dang nad la sogs pa med par byas te ;
translated: The wisdom of effort is the knowledge of the characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue of the one who has begun to make effort.

original: gnod pa bsal nas phan pa sbyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa bsal nas phan pa sbyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of meditation is the giving of the one who has attained meditation, who, by the power of meditation, removes the calamities of famine, disease, and so on, and, having removed them, bestows benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa'i tshe srog gcod pa la mi rtog pa ni bsam gtan gyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa'i tshe srog gcod pa la mi rtog pa ni bsam gtan gyi tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of meditation is the non-reflection on killing, etc. , of the one whose mind is one-pointed.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams ni rtag tu sems 'jam pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams ni rtag tu sems 'jam pa ste /
translated: The meditator always has a gentle mind.

original: zhe sdang gi 'khrug pa mi 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi 'khrug pa mi 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience of meditation is the non-arising of the disturbance of hatred.

original: sems rtse gcig pa rgyun du mi gtong ba ni bsam gtan gyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa rgyun du mi gtong ba ni bsam gtan gyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort of meditation is the non-abandonment of the continuity of one-pointedness of mind.

original: dmigs par bya ba la sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan gyi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba la sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan gyi bsam gtan no //
translated: The meditation of meditation is the one-pointedness of mind on the object of meditation.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i chos sems la gsal ba ni bsam gtan gyi shes rab bo //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i chos sems la gsal ba ni bsam gtan gyi shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom of meditation is the clarity of the mind in the Dharma to be cultivated.

original: shes rab la yang gzhan chos rnams phyin ci ma log par bshad pa ni shes rab kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab la yang gzhan chos rnams phyin ci ma log par bshad pa ni shes rab kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of wisdom is the unmistaken explanation of other dharmas.

original: shes rab can rnams blang ba dang spang bar bya ba rnams ngo shes pas spang bar bya ba la mi 'jug pa ni shes rab kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: shes rab can rnams blang ba dang spang bar bya ba rnams ngo shes pas spang bar bya ba la mi 'jug pa ni shes rab kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of wisdom is the recognition of what is to be accepted and rejected by the wise, and not engaging in what is to be abandoned.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid ma nor ba la sems dga' ba ni shes rab kyi bzod ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid ma nor ba la sems dga' ba ni shes rab kyi bzod ba'o //
translated: The patience of wisdom is the delight in the unmistaken characteristics of phenomena.

original: mnyan pa dang sems pa la sogs @210b pa spro ba ni shes rab kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang sems pa la sogs @210b pa spro ba ni shes rab kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort of wisdom is the enthusiasm for listening, reflection, and so forth.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa rnams la ma nor ba yin no snyam du sems g-yengs pa med pa ni shes rab kyi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa rnams la ma nor ba yin no snyam du sems g-yengs pa med pa ni shes rab kyi bsam gtan no //
translated: The meditative concentration of wisdom is the absence of distraction of mind, thinking, ‚ÄúI am unmistaken with regard to the unerring characteristics of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni shes rab kyi shes rab po //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni shes rab kyi shes rab po //
translated: The wisdom of wisdom is the unerring knowledge of the individual and universal characteristics of the dharmas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The maturation of sentient beings through the means of gathering the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug sbyin pa dang ngag snyan pa dang / don mthun pa dang don spyod bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid du bzhag ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug sbyin pa dang ngag snyan pa dang / don mthun pa dang don spyod bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid du bzhag ste /
translated: The six perfections are generosity, pleasant speech, beneficial activity, and sameness of purpose, which are established as having the characteristic of practicing the meaning.

original: de dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni spro pa yid la byed pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni spro pa yid la byed pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The maturation of sentient beings through them is the second attention, that of delight.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ji ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po'i tshul du bzhag ce na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ji ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po'i tshul du bzhag ce na /
translated: How are the perfections established as the means of gathering?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa ni sbyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa ni sbyin pa nyid do //
translated: From among the six perfections, generosity is generosity itself.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nam gzhan la 'chad pa ni ngag snyan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nam gzhan la 'chad pa ni ngag snyan pa'o //
translated: The pleasant voice is the teaching of the six perfections to others.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sems can gzhan spyod du bkod pa ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sems can gzhan spyod du bkod pa ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: The service of meaning is the establishment of other sentient beings in the practice of the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po gang la sems can bkod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de nyid la bdag nyid kyang spyod pa ni don mthun pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po gang la sems can bkod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de nyid la bdag nyid kyang spyod pa ni don mthun pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The service of sameness of purpose is the practice of the six perfections by oneself in the very same six perfections in which one has established other sentient beings.

original: mchod pa ni sbyin pas ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni sbyin pas ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti spyod pa'o //
translated: The worship is the service of gain and honor by means of generosity.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The remaining perfections are the worship of practice.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of worship of the Tathagatas:

original: zang zing gi mchod pa dang / sgrub pas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pa dang / sgrub pas mchod pa'o //
translated: worship with material things and worship with practice.

original: zang zing gi mchod pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Worship with material things is also of two kinds:

original: rnyed pas mchod pa dang / bkur stis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pas mchod pa dang / bkur stis mchod pa'o //
translated: worship with gain and worship with honor.

original: de la chos gos dang / lhung bzed 'bul ba ni rnyed pas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos gos dang / lhung bzed 'bul ba ni rnyed pas mchod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the offering of robes and alms-bowls is worship with gain.

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba la sogs pa byed pa ni bkur stis mchod pa ste /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba la sogs pa byed pa ni bkur stis mchod pa ste /
translated: Worship by respect is worship by homage, circumambulation, etc.

original: sbyin pas ni rnyed pa dang / bkur stis mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni rnyed pa dang / bkur stis mchod pa byed do //
translated: One worships by giving and by respect.

original: tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar du lnga sgrub pas mchod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar du lnga sgrub pas mchod pa ste /
translated: Worship by practice is worship by accomplishing the five perfections, from morality up to wisdom.

original: 'di ni spro ba yid la byed pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spro ba yid la byed pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third mental attention, the one of delight.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa btsal ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa btsal ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should rely on a spiritual teacher in order to seek the teaching of the unerring perfections.

original: phyin ci ma log pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: The unerring perfections are the unerring perfection of giving, up to the unerring perfection of wisdom.

original: de la kha cig sbyin pa yin yang phyin ci log yod de /
analyzed: de la kha cig sbyin pa yin yang phyin ci log yod de /
translated: Some give, but err.

original: shan pa la mtshon cha sbyin pa dang / smad 'tshong ma la nor sbyin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shan pa la mtshon cha sbyin pa dang / smad 'tshong ma la nor sbyin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, butchers give weapons, and pimps give money.

original: kha cig shes rab yin yang phyin ci log @211a * //
analyzed: kha cig shes rab yin yang phyin ci log @211a * //
translated: Some have wisdom, but err.

original: yod de / mu stegs pa bdag dang rtag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod de / mu stegs pa bdag dang rtag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Yes, for example, the tƒ´rthikas' self, permanence, etc.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa phyin ci ma log pa dang / shes rab phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal ba'i phyir de ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur byed pa ni bsten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa phyin ci ma log pa dang / shes rab phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal ba'i phyir de ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur byed pa ni bsten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, in order to seek out a spiritual friend who teaches unerring generosity and unerring wisdom, one goes to the presence of a spiritual friend who teaches that, and one serves by prostrating, circumambulating, and so on. This is called reliance.

original: 'di ni spro ba yid la byed pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spro ba yid la byed pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth mental contemplation of enthusiasm.

original: snying brtse ba yid la byed pa ni tshad med pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems la ni snying brtse ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying brtse ba yid la byed pa ni tshad med pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems la ni snying brtse ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mental contemplation of compassion is the four immeasurables. The meaning is that the mind endowed with the four immeasurables is called the mental contemplation of compassion.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i stobs dang byams par byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i stobs dang byams par byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of generosity, etc., and the power of love, etc.

original: byams pa ni sems can rnams bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces sems pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bde bar gyur cig ces sems par ma zad kyi bde ba la yang 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: byams pa ni sems can rnams bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces sems pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bde bar gyur cig ces sems par ma zad kyi bde ba la yang 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: Love is the thought, ‚ÄúMay sentient beings come to possess happiness,‚Äù and the bodhisattvas not only think, ‚ÄúMay the bodhisattvas come to possess happiness,‚Äù but they also establish them in happiness.

original: de la spyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni longs spyod la sogs pa 'grub par byed pa yin pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstabs te pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa ni sems can
analyzed: de la spyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni longs spyod la sogs pa 'grub par byed pa yin pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstabs te pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa ni sems can
translated: Therein, the six perfections such as giving are the means of accomplishing enjoyments, etc. Therefore, the giving, etc. are the six perfections. The establishment of sentient beings in the six perfections is the bestowal of the six perfections. The bestowal of the six perfections is the lovingkindness toward sentient beings.

original: la byams par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la byams par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ser sna la sogs pa dang ldan pa la snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar gyur cig ces sems pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa dang ldan pa la snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar gyur cig ces sems pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the thought, ‚ÄúMay sentient beings come to be separated from suffering.‚Äù

original: ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni dbul po la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas ser sna la sogs pa dang ldan pa la byang chub sems dpa' snying rje skye ba'o //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni dbul po la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas ser sna la sogs pa dang ldan pa la byang chub sems dpa' snying rje skye ba'o //
translated: The causes of the suffering of poverty, etc., are the resistances to the six perfections, such as stinginess, etc. Thus, the bodhisattva generates compassion for those who are stingy, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje ba tsam du yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje ba tsam du yang ma zad kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva not only feels compassion,

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i chos 'dor du 'jug ste 'di ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'i chos 'dor du 'jug ste 'di ni snying rje'o //
translated: but also causes them to reject the qualities of stinginess, etc. This is compassion.

original: sbyin pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la dga' bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la dga' bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: He rejoices in the sentient beings who possess generosity, etc.

original: sems can bde ba mthong nas sems la mos pa skyes pa la ni dga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can bde ba mthong nas sems la mos pa skyes pa la ni dga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When one sees the happiness of sentient beings, one generates a mental aspiration, which is called ‚Äúsympathetic joy.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa mthong nas dga' bar gyur pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa mthong nas dga' bar gyur pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: When one sees sentient beings practicing the six perfections, such as generosity, etc., one generates sympathetic joy.

original: de la nyon mongs pa med pa mos pa ni btang snyoms so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med pa mos pa ni btang snyoms so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absence of affliction in that is equanimity.

original: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin ni gang la yang chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / sbyin @211b pa la sogs pa longs spyod dang ldan nam /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin ni gang la yang chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / sbyin @211b pa la sogs pa longs spyod dang ldan nam /
translated: The nature of equanimity is the absence of attachment and aversion to anything.üîΩEquanimity is the thought: ‚ÄúMay attachment not arise for sentient beings who have wealth and are happy, and who are practicing generosity and so on.

original: bde bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la yang 'dod chags skye bar ma gyur cig ces smon pa dang / longs spyod rnams phrogs nas sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la yang zhe sdang bar ma gyur cig ces sems pa ni btang snyoms so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la yang 'dod chags skye bar ma gyur cig ces smon pa dang / longs spyod rnams phrogs nas sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la yang zhe sdang bar ma gyur cig ces sems pa ni btang snyoms so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: May aversion not arise for sentient beings who have lost their wealth and are suffering.‚ÄùüîΩThe thought of non-exhaustion, of praise, of shame,üîΩof practice, of delight in the object,

original: ma byas smad dang ngo tsha dang // bgyid dang yul la dga' ba dang // mi skyo ba dang 'god pa dang // brjod pa yi ni blo gros te //
analyzed: ma byas smad dang ngo tsha dang // bgyid dang yul la dga' ba dang // mi skyo ba dang 'god pa dang // brjod pa yi ni blo gros te //
translated: of non-discouragement, of establishment,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and of expression is the thought of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang ngo tsha ba yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / mi skyo ba yid la byed pa dang / 'god pa yid la byed pa dang / brjod pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo tsha ba yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / mi skyo ba yid la byed pa dang / 'god pa yid la byed pa dang / brjod pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, there is the thought of shame, the thought of delight, the thought of non-discouragement, the thought of establishment, and the thought of expression.

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And by these mental attentions, the element of the transcendences is increased.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa ye ma byas pa dang / rdzogs par ma byas pa ni ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa ye ma byas pa dang / rdzogs par ma byas pa ni ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The unpracticed transcendences are those not yet undertaken and not yet completed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la phyin ci log tu byas pa la ni smad pa byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la phyin ci log tu byas pa la ni smad pa byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The disparaged transcendences are those undertaken and completed in a distorted manner.

original: de ltar ye ma byas pa dang / rdzogs par ma byas pa dang / smad par byas na mtshar byas zhes ngo tsha zhing 'gyod pa ni ngo tsha ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye ma byas pa dang / rdzogs par ma byas pa dang / smad par byas na mtshar byas zhes ngo tsha zhing 'gyod pa ni ngo tsha ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the mental attention of conscientious attitude is the shame and scruple at not having undertaken, not having completed, and having disparaged the transcendences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rgyun du spyad par bya'o snyam du sems spro ba'i dbang du byas nas spyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rgyun du dmigs shing de 'ba' zhig la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog gi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rgyun du spyad par bya'o snyam du sems spro ba'i dbang du byas nas spyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rgyun du dmigs shing de 'ba' zhig la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog gi /
translated: The mental attention of enthusiasm is the mental attention of one who is enthusiastic about the transcendences, who is eager to practice the six transcendences.

original: sems gzhan du ma g-yengs pa ni dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan du ma g-yengs pa ni dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not letting the mind be distracted elsewhere is called keeping joy in mind.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyor ba'i tshe /
translated: When one is engaged in the six perfections such as generosity,

original: spyod par mi 'dod pa'i sems skye ba skyes na sems 'di ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i bar du gcod pa yin pas dgra yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes skye ba ni mi skyo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod par mi 'dod pa'i sems skye ba skyes na sems 'di ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i bar du gcod pa yin pas dgra yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes skye ba ni mi skyo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: if the thought of not wanting to practice arises, one should think, ‚ÄúThis thought is an enemy, an obstacle to attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.‚Äù This is called keeping non-discouragement in mind.

original: sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'brel pa'i chos ston pas skyob par bya'o snyam du sems shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi gtsug lag dang gzhung du 'dri zhing 'jog pa ni 'god pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'brel pa'i chos ston pas skyob par bya'o snyam du sems shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi gtsug lag dang gzhung du 'dri zhing 'jog pa ni 'god pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúFor the sake of sentient beings, I will teach the Dharma connected with the six perfections and protect them,‚Äù and writing and establishing the scriptures and treatises of the six perfections is called keeping establishment in mind.

original: dper na mdo sde'i rgyan 'di nyid kyi nang nas grangs dang mtshan nyid go rims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul du gtsug lag tu 'god pa'o //üîΩsems can so so'i snod dang sbyar nas sems can gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang bshad par 'os pa'i @212a * //
analyzed: dper na mdo sde'i rgyan 'di nyid kyi nang nas grangs dang mtshan nyid go rims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul du gtsug lag tu 'god pa'o // sems can so so'i snod dang sbyar nas sems can gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang bshad par 'os pa'i @212a * //
translated: For example, in this Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras itself, it is arranged as a treatise in the manner of enumeration, characteristics, sequence, and so on.

original: sems can de la pha rol tu phyin pa de 'chad pa ni brjod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de la pha rol tu phyin pa de 'chad pa ni brjod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In accordance with the individual vessels of sentient beings, it is the mental attention of expression to explain to a sentient being which perfections are suitable to be explained.

original: ngo tsha ba'i chos las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha bas rgyu byas nas she'am /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba'i chos las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha bas rgyu byas nas she'am /
translated: Beginning from the Dharma of shame means that having made shame the cause, or having taken shame as the basis.

original: ngo tsha ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is called the mental attention of shame.

original: ma byas pa'am zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: ma byas pa'am zhes bya ba la //
translated: Not having done, or not having completed, means

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug thams cad nas thams cad du cung zad kyang ma byas pa'o //üîΩyongs su ma rdzogs pa'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug thams cad nas thams cad du cung zad kyang ma byas pa'o // yongs su ma rdzogs pa'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: not having done at all any of the six perfections at all.

original: sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Giving is threefold:

original: zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos sbyin pa gsum las gnyis tsam byed kyi gsum char tshang bar mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos sbyin pa gsum las gnyis tsam byed kyi gsum char tshang bar mi byed pa'am /
translated: The three types of generosity are material generosity, the generosity of fearlessness, and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: zang zing sbyin pa las kyang cung zad tsam gtong gi kun mi gtong ba dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la yang snying nas skyabs mi byed kyi tshig tsam du byed pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa la yang kha cig 'chad kyi kha cig mi 'chad de /
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pa las kyang cung zad tsam gtong gi kun mi gtong ba dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la yang snying nas skyabs mi byed kyi tshig tsam du byed pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa la yang kha cig 'chad kyi kha cig mi 'chad de /
translated: One who practices two of these but not all three, or who practices material generosity but not the other two, or who practices material generosity but gives only a little and not everything, or who practices the generosity of fearlessness but does not give protection from the heart but only with words, or who practices the generosity of the Dharma but teaches some but not others,

original: slob dpon bcabs pa ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon bcabs pa ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is said to be a teacher who is incomplete.

original: log par spyod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: log par spyod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wrong practice is as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa tsam smra ba'i dngos po mi gtong ba dang / shan pa la mtshon sbyin par byed pa dang / smad 'tshong ma la nor sbyin pa dang / brkus nas sbyin pa dang g-yo dang sgyus byin pa ni log par sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa tsam smra ba'i dngos po mi gtong ba dang / shan pa la mtshon sbyin par byed pa dang / smad 'tshong ma la nor sbyin pa dang / brkus nas sbyin pa dang g-yo dang sgyus byin pa ni log par sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not giving the thing that one is praising as a gift, giving a weapon to an executioner, giving money to a prostitute, giving after stealing, and giving deceitfully or deceptively is called wrong generosity.

original: ngo tsha nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo tsha nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: From shame is as follows:

original: de ltar ma byas pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dang / smad par byas par mthong nas sems la gnod pa ni ngo tsha ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dang / smad par byas par mthong nas sems la gnod pa ni ngo tsha ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When he sees that he has not done so, that he has not done it completely, and that he has done it contemptibly, he is tormented in mind. This is called shame.

original: 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to engagement,

original: de ltar ngo tsha nas ma byas pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa de spangs te /
analyzed: de ltar ngo tsha nas ma byas pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa de spangs te /
translated: having been ashamed in this way, he abandons what he has not done and what he has not completed.

original: byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He engages in doing it and in completing it. This is the meaning.

original: ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to turning away,

original: smad pa dang log par bya ba las ni ldog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smad pa dang log par bya ba las ni ldog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he turns away from contempt and from doing it wrongly. This is the meaning.

original: yun mi ring bar 'gyod par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yun mi ring bar 'gyod par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: He regrets it for a long time.

original: gal te 'gyod pa zhig bskyed na yang rgyun du 'gyod pa bskyed par mi bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te 'gyod pa zhig bskyed na yang rgyun du 'gyod pa bskyed par mi bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he does arouse regret, he should not let it continue. This is the meaning.

original: 'gyod pa dang rgyun du ldan na dge ba nyid la 'jug par mi nus pas de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa dang / smad pa byas pa na bdag gis sems can rnams la sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang rgyun du ldan na dge ba nyid la 'jug par mi nus pas de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa dang / smad pa byas pa na bdag gis sems can rnams la sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa dang /
translated: One should think, I have not given, etc., to sentient beings, and I have disparaged, etc., them.

original: smad pa byas pa ni mtshar byas so snyam thang cig gcig 'gyod pa bskyed nas 'gyod pa spong ngo //üîΩde la de bas @212b 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smad pa byas pa ni mtshar byas so snyam thang cig gcig 'gyod pa bskyed nas 'gyod pa spong ngo // de la de bas @212b 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: One should think, I have done wrong.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ye ma byas pa dang / rdzogs par ma byas nas 'gyod par gyur na 'gyod pa de bzlog ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ye ma byas pa dang / rdzogs par ma byas nas 'gyod par gyur na 'gyod pa de bzlog ste /
translated: In this way, one should think, If I have not given, etc., at all, or if I have not completed giving, etc., I should stop that regret.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa byas ba dang / rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba dang / rgyun du bsgrub pa la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa byas ba dang / rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba dang / rgyun du bsgrub pa la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: I should engage in respect and constant practice in order to give, etc., and to complete giving, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa smad pa dang / log par byas pa la phyis log pa la 'jug par mi bya'o zhes ldog par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa smad pa dang / log par byas pa la phyis log pa la 'jug par mi bya'o zhes ldog par bya ste /
translated: One should stop by thinking, I should not engage in disparaging, etc., giving, etc., and in doing them wrongly.

original: de ltar na yang the tshom yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang the tshom yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, doubt is also eliminated.

original: 'jig rten rig par byas pa las brtsams nas brjod pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig par byas pa las brtsams nas brjod pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attentiveness associated with what is known in the world.

original: sems can so so'i sems dang sbyar bas sems can gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang bshad pa'i rig pa'i sems can de dag la pha rol tu phyin pa de 'chad pa ni brjod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can so so'i sems dang sbyar bas sems can gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang bshad pa'i rig pa'i sems can de dag la pha rol tu phyin pa de 'chad pa ni brjod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Attentiveness associated with what is said is the teaching of the transcendent perfections to those beings who are receptive to them, in accordance with the individual minds of beings.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this point,

original: ston skyob de nyid ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i phyir 'jig rten la brjod par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ston skyob de nyid ji ltar snod du gyur pa'i phyir 'jig rten la brjod par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the text says: ‚ÄúIn order to make known the teaching and protection of the world, he acts in the world.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i gtsug lag byas pa de dag so so'i snod dang sbyar nas sems can gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang bshad par 'os shing snod du gyur pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i gtsug lag byas pa de dag so so'i snod dang sbyar nas sems can gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang bshad par 'os shing snod du gyur pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad de /
translated: In accordance with the individual receptivity of those beings who are receptive to the teaching of the six transcendent perfections, he teaches the transcendent perfections to those beings who are receptive to them and who are suitable vessels for them.

original: dper na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa'i snod du gyur pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa'i snod du gyur pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa'o //
translated: The attention of reliance is the understanding that one attains unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on the six perfections such as giving,üîΩbut that one does not attain unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on Ishvara, Prajapati, Brahma, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs brten nas su //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs brten nas su //
translated: One should understand that enlightenment comes from relying on giving, etc.,üîΩnot from Ishvara, etc.üîΩThe attention of reliance is the understanding that one attains unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on the six perfections such as giving,

original: byang chub 'gyur gyis dbang phyug min //
analyzed: byang chub 'gyur gyis dbang phyug min //
translated: but that one does not attain unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on Ishvara, Prajapati, Brahma, etc.üîΩOne should understand that enlightenment comes from relying on giving, etc.,üîΩnot from Ishvara, etc.üîΩThe attention of reliance is the understanding that one attains unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on the six perfections such as giving,üîΩbut that one does not attain unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on Ishvara, Prajapati, Brahma, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la brten pa'i yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la brten pa'i yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One should understand that enlightenment comes from relying on giving, etc.,üîΩnot from Ishvara, etc.üîΩThe attention of reliance is the understanding that one attains unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on the six perfections such as giving,üîΩbut that one does not attain unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on Ishvara, Prajapati, Brahma, etc.

original: dbang phyug dang gtso bo'ang tshangs pa la sogs pa la brten nas ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ma yin par khong du chud pa ni brten pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gtso bo'ang tshangs pa la sogs pa la brten nas ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ma yin par khong du chud pa ni brten pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One should understand that enlightenment comes from relying on giving, etc.,

original: skyon dang yon tan dag la yang //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan dag la yang //
translated: not from Ishvara, etc.üîΩThe attention of reliance is the understanding that one attains unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on the six perfections such as giving,üîΩbut that one does not attain unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on Ishvara, Prajapati, Brahma, etc.

original: gnyis po de ni rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis po de ni rtog par 'gyur //
translated: One should understand that enlightenment comes from relying on giving, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: not from Ishvara, etc.üîΩThe attention of reliance is the understanding that one attains unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on the six perfections such as giving,üîΩbut that one does not attain unsurpassed enlightenment by relying on Ishvara, Prajapati, Brahma, etc.üîΩOne should understand that enlightenment comes from relying on giving, etc.,üîΩnot from Ishvara, etc.

original: rtog pa yid la byed pa ni ser sna la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni skyon du rtogs te /
analyzed: rtog pa yid la byed pa ni ser sna la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni skyon du rtogs te /
translated: Attention to the idea is the idea of the faults in the resistances, such as stinginess,üîΩand the idea of the virtues in the remedies, such as generosity.üîΩThe idea of the faults is the idea that one will become poor, etc.

original: dbul po la sogs par gyur par mthong sbyin pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i phyogs la ni yon tan du rtogs te /
analyzed: dbul po la sogs par gyur par mthong sbyin pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i phyogs la ni yon tan du rtogs te /
translated: The idea of the virtues is the idea that one will become rich, etc.

original: phyug po la sogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba ni rtog pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyug po la sogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba ni rtog pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called attention to the idea.üîΩThe accumulation of virtue, the recollection of joy,

original: bsags pa dga' ba dran pa dang // che ba'i don ni mthong ba dang // rnal 'byor @213a * //
analyzed: bsags pa dga' ba dran pa dang // che ba'i don ni mthong ba dang // rnal 'byor @213a * //

analyzed: 'dod dang mi rtog pa //

analyzed: de 'dzin pa dang rkyen thob pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the retention of the vows, and the attainment of the conditions,üîΩare the six kinds of attention in the practice of the transcendences.üîΩThe accumulation of virtue is the accumulation of the transcendences.üîΩThe recollection of joy is the recollection of the joy of the transcendences.üîΩThe vision of the great meaning is the vision of the great result of the transcendences.

original: zhes yang bsags pa dran nas dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / don chen po mthong ba yid la byed pa dang / 'dod pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes yang bsags pa dran nas dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / don chen po mthong ba yid la byed pa dang / 'dod pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The desire for yoga is the desire for the yoga of the transcendences.üîΩThe absence of ideas is the absence of the ideas of the resistances to the transcendences.üîΩThe retention of the vows is the retention of the vows of the transcendences.üîΩThe attainment of the conditions is the attainment of the conditions for the transcendences.

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These six kinds of attention cause the growth of the constituent of the transcendences.

original: 'dod pa yid la byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa yid la byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of attention to desire:

original: rnal 'byor 'dod pa yid la byed pa dang / mi rtog pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa dang / de 'dzin pa yid la byed pa dang / rkyen thob pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'dod pa yid la byed pa dang / mi rtog pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa dang / de 'dzin pa yid la byed pa dang / rkyen thob pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: attention to desire for yoga, attention to desire for nonconceptuality, attention to its retention, and attention to the obtainment of conditions.

original: bsags pa dran pas dga' ba yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsags nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsags pa dran pas dga' ba yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsags nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attention to joy from seeing the accumulation is attention to joy from seeing the accumulation of the collections of merit and knowledge through accumulating generosity and so on.

original: sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar drug bsags nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa mthong ba ni bsags pa mthong nas dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar drug bsags nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa mthong ba ni bsags pa mthong nas dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having accumulated the six perfections from generosity to wisdom, one sees the accumulation of the collections of merit and knowledge. This is called attention to joy from seeing the accumulation.

original: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum bsags pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum bsags pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur /
translated: Among them, the accumulation of the three perfections of generosity, ethics, and patience is the collection of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur /
translated: Concentration and wisdom are the collection of knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ga'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ga'i tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Effort is the accumulation of both.

original: don mthong ba yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dngos po'i don gyis byang chub chen po thob par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /

translated: The attention of seeing the benefit is the seeing of the attainment of great enlightenment by the benefit of the entities of the factors of enlightenment, such as generosity.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la ni byang chub chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la ni byang chub chen po zhes bya'o //
