original: rnal 'byor 'dod pa yid la byed pa ni lhag mthong dang zhi gnas sbyor ba bsgom par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'dod pa yid la byed pa ni lhag mthong dang zhi gnas sbyor ba bsgom par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attention of desiring yoga is the desire to cultivate the union of insight and calm abiding.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The attention of desiring

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba bsgom par 'dod pa ni rnal 'byor 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba bsgom par 'dod pa ni rnal 'byor 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention of desiring yoga is the desire to cultivate the union of serenity and insight.

original: mi rtog par 'dod pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir thabs mkhas pa la 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rtog par 'dod pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir thabs mkhas pa la 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attention of desiring nonconceptuality is the desire for skill in liberative art in order to perfect the transcendences.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: Nonconceptual intuition is the liberative art for perfecting the transcendences.

original: de @213b bas na pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan par bya ba ni mi rtog par 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de @213b bas na pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan par bya ba ni mi rtog par 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the attention of desiring nonconceptuality is the desire to be endowed with nonconceptual intuition in order to perfect the six transcendences.

original: yang na dang po sbyor ba'i dus na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang na dang po sbyor ba'i dus na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or else, at the time of initial preparation, one should think as follows:

original: mi rtog rnam par mi rtog par pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par gyur cig ces smon lam btab sems la mngon par 'dus byas pa las mngon par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: mi rtog rnam par mi rtog par pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par gyur cig ces smon lam btab sems la mngon par 'dus byas pa las mngon par sangs rgyas te /
translated: May I enter into the perfections without thought and without discrimination!

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa na mi rtog rnam par mi rtog par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa na mi rtog rnam par mi rtog par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: When he attains nonconceptual intuition, he enters into the perfections without thought and without discrimination.

original: de ni mi rtog par 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mi rtog par 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attention of the desire for nonconceptuality.üîΩ The attention of retention is because of the retention of the Dharma and the meaning for the sake of the perfections.

original: 'dzin pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi ched kyi chos dang don 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'chad pa'i chos dang / don sems la mi brjed par 'dzin pa ni yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi ched kyi chos dang don 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'chad pa'i chos dang / don sems la mi brjed par 'dzin pa ni yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma and the meaning that explain the six perfections are retained in the mind without being forgotten. This is called attention.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rgyur gyur pa ni chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rgyur gyur pa ni chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma is that which is the cause of the perfections.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa la ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa la ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the result of the perfections.

original: rkyen thob pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkyen thob pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attention to the acquisition of conditions is the full accomplishment of the perfections and the creation of the right aspirations in conformity with them.

original: tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par 'gyur pa dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ; nye du gnyen bshes dang / lus dang longs spyod dang ldan par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa ni rkyen thob pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs par 'gyur pa dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ; nye du gnyen bshes dang / lus dang longs spyod dang ldan par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa ni rkyen thob pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The creation of the right aspirations is the attention to the acquisition of conditions, because one thinks, Wherever I am born in my successive lives, may I have spiritual benefactors, relatives, and friends who are in conformity with the full accomplishment of the six perfections, and may I have a body and possessions.

original: rnam bdun phyin ci log 'dzin dang // spangs pa'i mthu ni shes pa dang // ngo mtshar dang ni ngo mtshar min //
analyzed: rnam bdun phyin ci log 'dzin dang // spangs pa'i mthu ni shes pa dang // ngo mtshar dang ni ngo mtshar min //
translated: The seven aspects of attention are: attention to the antidotes, attention to the lack of error, attention to the lack of differentiation, attention to the lack of incompleteness, attention to the acquisition of conditions, attention to the accomplishment of one's own goal, and attention to the accomplishment of others' goals.üîΩThe attention of the bodhisattva who is established in the perfection of wisdom is sevenfold.üîΩWhat are the seven?üîΩThey are attention to the antidotes, attention to the lack of error, attention to the lack of differentiation, attention to the lack of incompleteness, attention to the acquisition of conditions, attention to the accomplishment of one's own goal, and attention to the accomplishment of others' goals.

original: 'du shes de bzhin rnam bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes de bzhin rnam bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Attention to the antidotes is the attention to the four close mindfulnesses.üîΩAttention to the lack of error is the attention to the four right efforts.üîΩAttention to the lack of differentiation is the attention to the four bases of magical abilities.üîΩAttention to the lack of incompleteness is the attention to the five faculties and the five powers.üîΩAttention to the acquisition of conditions is the attention to the seven factors that are aids to enlightenment.üîΩAttention to the accomplishment of one's own goal is the attention to the noble eightfold path.üîΩAttention to the accomplishment of others' goals is the attention to the three gateways to liberation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams bsgom pa cha phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bdun spong pa'i mthu mthong ba yid la byed pa dang // ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes yid la byed pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du ngo mtshar ma yin pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pas kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams bsgom pa cha phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bdun spong pa'i mthu mthong ba yid la byed pa dang // ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes yid la byed pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du ngo mtshar ma yin pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pas kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the element increases through the four attentions: attention regarding the power to abandon the seven mistaken graspings of the six perfections, attention regarding the power to abandon the seven mistaken graspings of the four noble truths, attention regarding the power to abandon the seven mistaken graspings of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and attention regarding the power to abandon the seven mistaken graspings of the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four unobstructednesses, and eighteen exclusive qualities of a buddha.

original: med pa la yod par 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos ni med pa yin na de la dngos po yod par lta ba ni med pa la yod par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa la yod par 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos ni med pa yin na de la dngos po yod par lta ba ni med pa la yod par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Grasping what is nonexistent as existent refers to the view that the imputed person and the imputed phenomena are existent, although they are nonexistent.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log gcig go //üîΩnyes pa can la yon tan can du 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba @214a * //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log gcig go // nyes pa can la yon tan can du 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba @214a * //
translated: This is one mistaken view.üîΩGrasping what is faulty as having good qualities refers to

original: la ; 'khor ba'i chos ni nyes pa can yin te /
analyzed: la ; 'khor ba'i chos ni nyes pa can yin te /
translated: the view that the phenomena of cyclic existence have good qualities, although they are faulty.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gcang ba dang bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gcang ba dang bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are impermanent, painful, impure, and not a self.

original: de la rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang bar 'dzin pa ni yon tan du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang bar 'dzin pa ni yon tan du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Among these, the grasping of permanence, pleasure, and purity is the grasping of a good quality.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log gnyis so //
translated: This is the second error.

original: yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The grasping of what has good qualities as not having good qualities.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa na nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad sbangs pas zhi ba dang / bde ba yin pa'i phyir yon tan can yin na de la byis pa rnams chad pa dang g-yang sar lta ba ni yon tan can ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa na nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad sbangs pas zhi ba dang / bde ba yin pa'i phyir yon tan can yin na de la byis pa rnams chad pa dang g-yang sar lta ba ni yon tan can ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since nirvana is the pacification and the bliss of all the afflictions and suffering, it has good qualities. But the childish view it as annihilation and a precipice, and so it is said that it does not have good qualities.

original: de ni phyin ci log gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni phyin ci log gsum mo //
translated: This is the third error.

original: 'du byed thams cad la rtag pa dang bde bar 'dzin pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la rtag pa dang bde bar 'dzin pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The grasping of all formations as permanent and blissful.

original: thams cad kyi sgra 'dir phyogs gcig tu drangs te 'dus ma byas bkol nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed thams cad dang / zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa thams cad ni 'di skad cig ma 'jig pas mi rtag pa yin na de la brtan par 'du shes pa ni 'du byed thams cad la rtag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra 'dir phyogs gcig tu drangs te 'dus ma byas bkol nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed thams cad dang / zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa thams cad ni 'di skad cig ma 'jig pas mi rtag pa yin na de la brtan par 'du shes pa ni 'du byed thams cad la rtag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since all of these are impermanent because they are momentary, the conception that they are permanent is called the grasping of all conditioned states as permanent.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log bzhi'o //
translated: This is the fourth error.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang brgyad kyis gzar bas sdug bsngal ba yin na de la gya nom par 'dzin pa ni bde bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang brgyad kyis gzar bas sdug bsngal ba yin na de la gya nom par 'dzin pa ni bde bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since all conditioned states that are contaminated are afflicted by the three or eight types of suffering, they are suffering. The conception that they are sublime is called the grasping of suffering as a blissful state.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log lnga pa'o //üîΩchos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log lnga pa'o // chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the fifth error.üîΩThe grasping of the impure as pureüîΩand the grasping of the self in all entities.

original: thams cad kyi sgra 'di'i skabs sum lus pa'i don drangs te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra 'di'i skabs sum lus pa'i don drangs te /
translated: The term all in the above refers to all entities.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad ni gang zag pa dang chos kyi dbyings nyid du bdag med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad ni gang zag pa dang chos kyi dbyings nyid du bdag med pa yin no //
translated: All conditioned and unconditioned, all defiled and undefiled dharmas are the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de la ngo bo yod par 'dzin pa ni chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo yod par 'dzin pa ni chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The grasping at the existence of an essence is called the grasping at a self of dharmas.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log drug go //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log drug go //
translated: These are the six errors.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ma zhi bar log par 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma zhi bar log par 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The error of grasping at nirvana as not being peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khrug pas nyon mongs pa'i 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pas zhi ba yin na de la mi bde ba'i gnas su 'dzin pa yin na ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma zhi bar log par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khrug pas nyon mongs pa'i 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pas zhi ba yin na de la mi bde ba'i gnas su 'dzin pa yin na ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma zhi bar log par 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Nirvana is peace because it is the pacification of all the disturbances of the afflictions and all suffering. To grasp it as a state of unhappiness is called the error of grasping at nirvana as not being peace.

original: 'di ni log par 'dzin pa bdun no //
analyzed: 'di ni log par 'dzin pa bdun no //
translated: This is the seventh error.

original: de dag gi gnyen por stong @214b pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum dang / chos bsdu bas yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩmed pa la yod par 'dzin pa dang / nyes pa can la yon tan du 'dzin pa dang / yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por stong @214b pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum dang / chos bsdu bas yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la / med pa la yod par 'dzin pa dang / nyes pa can la yon tan du 'dzin pa dang / yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: The three concentrations such as emptiness and the four summaries of the Dharma are their antidotes.üîΩThe three concentrations such as emptiness, the concentration of aspirationlessness and the concentration of signlessness are explained as the antidotes of the four errors:üîΩgrasping nonexistence as existent,üîΩgrasping the faulty as virtuous,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bshad do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bshad do //
translated: grasping the virtuous as not virtuous.üîΩThe four summaries of the Dharma are taught as the antidotes of the four errors:üîΩgrasping the composite as permanent,üîΩgrasping it as blissful,

original: 'dus byas la rtag pa dang / bde bar 'dzin pa dang / chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la ma zhi bar log pa'i gnyen por chos bsdu ba bzhi bo bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus byas la rtag pa dang / bde bar 'dzin pa dang / chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la ma zhi bar log pa'i gnyen por chos bsdu ba bzhi bo bstan to //
translated: grasping all phenomena as a self andüîΩgrasping nirvana as not peace.

original: ji lta zhe na ;
analyzed: ji lta zhe na ;
translated: How so?

original: med pa la yod par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni stong ba nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad de /
analyzed: med pa la yod par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni stong ba nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad de /
translated: The concentration of emptiness is explained as the antidote of grasping nonexistence as existent.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa dang bdag med par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin pas gang zag dang chos la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por 'gyur re //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa dang bdag med par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin pas gang zag dang chos la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por 'gyur re //
translated: The concentration of emptiness has the aspects of emptiness and selflessness, so it is the antidote to the conception of a self of persons and of phenomena.

original: nyes pa can la yon tan du 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad de smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang / lam gyi rnam pa bzhi'i steng du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba gnyis kyis bsnan te /
analyzed: nyes pa can la yon tan du 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad de smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang / lam gyi rnam pa bzhi'i steng du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba gnyis kyis bsnan te /
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is explained as the antidote to apprehending faults as good qualities. The concentration of wishlessness has ten aspects: the four aspects of the truth of origin, the four aspects of the truth of the path and the two aspects of the truth of suffering, impermanence and suffering.

original: rnam pa bcu yin pas rnam pa bcu ltar khong du chud na nyes pa can la yon tan du 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu yin pas rnam pa bcu ltar khong du chud na nyes pa can la yon tan du 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one comprehends it in terms of these ten aspects, one will not apprehend faults as good qualities.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dang po mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal mthong nas skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal mthong nas skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: First, one sees impermanence and suffering and becomes disenchanted.

original: de nas de'i rgyu gang yin zhes brtags na kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi yin par mthong ngo //üîΩkun 'byung de'ang gang gis spang //
analyzed: de nas de'i rgyu gang yin zhes brtags na kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi yin par mthong ngo // kun 'byung de'ang gang gis spang //
translated: Then, if one investigates what its cause is, one sees that it has the four aspects of origination.

original: zhes brtags na lam gyi rnam pa bzhis spong bar mthong ste /
analyzed: zhes brtags na lam gyi rnam pa bzhis spong bar mthong ste /
translated: If one investigates how that origination is abandoned, one sees that it is abandoned by the four aspects of the path.

original: lam yang dgos pa'i don grub nas yang dgos par mthong ste /
analyzed: lam yang dgos pa'i don grub nas yang dgos par mthong ste /
translated: And one sees that the path is also necessary once the purpose is achieved.

original: de dag thams cad la mi smon pa ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la mi smon pa ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: The non-aspiration for all of these is called the concentration of no-aspiration.

original: yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad de /
analyzed: yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad de /
translated: The concentration of signlessness is explained as the antidote to apprehending the virtuous as non-virtuous.üîΩThe concentration of signlessness has the four aspects of cessation as its characteristics. Therefore, having realized the four aspects, one conceives of the virtuous as non-virtuous.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'gog par rnam pa bzhi lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pas rnam pa bzhi ltar rtogs nas yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par rtog go /'du byed thams cad la rtag par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni 'du byed
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'gog par rnam pa bzhi lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pas rnam pa bzhi ltar rtogs nas yon tan can la yon tan can ma yin par rtog go /'du byed thams cad la rtag par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni 'du byed
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is explained as the antidote to apprehending the non-virtuous as virtuous.

original: thams cad ni mi rtag ces bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gsungs so //üîΩbde bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni zag pa dang @215a * //
analyzed: thams cad ni mi rtag ces bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gsungs so // bde bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni zag pa dang @215a * //
translated: He taught the Dharma discourse on impermanence.

original: bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal pa zhes bya ba'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal pa zhes bya ba'i don gsungs so //
translated: As an antidote to the conception of pleasure, he taught the meaning of all contaminated things being suffering.

original: chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gsungs so //
translated: As an antidote to the conception of a self in all phenomena, he taught the Dharma discourse on the selflessness of all phenomena.üîΩAs an antidote to the conception that nirvana is not peace, he taught the Dharma discourse on nirvana being peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ma zhi bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gsungs so //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spangs pa'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma zhi bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por ni zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gsungs so // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spangs pa'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four conceptions that are antidotes are the conception that the perfections are to be abandoned,üîΩthe conception that the levels are to be made manifest,üîΩthe conception that the powers are to be made manifest,üîΩand the conception that the branches of enlightenment are to be made manifest.

original: ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes bzhi 'chad de /
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes bzhi 'chad de /
translated: The four conceptions that are antidotes are the conception that the perfections are to be abandoned,üîΩthe conception that the levels are to be made manifest,üîΩthe conception that the powers are to be made manifest,üîΩand the conception that the branches of enlightenment are to be made manifest.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spangs pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa yang ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes yin no ci zhig ngo mtshar zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spangs pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa yang ngo mtshar gyi 'du shes yin no ci zhig ngo mtshar zhe na /
translated: What is the conception that the perfections are to be abandoned?

original: thang cig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la phyi'i dngos po dngos por gtong bar ma zad kyi bdag gi lus kyang yongs su gtong ba ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
analyzed: thang cig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la phyi'i dngos po dngos por gtong bar ma zad kyi bdag gi lus kyang yongs su gtong ba ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
translated: In the perfection of generosity, it is astonishing that one gives away not only external things but also one's own body.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang /
translated: In the perfection of morality,

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir nye du gnyen bshes dang / longs spyod yongs su gtong ba ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir nye du gnyen bshes dang / longs spyod yongs su gtong ba ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
translated: it is astonishing that one gives away one's relatives, friends, and wealth in order to take up morality.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang gdol bu dang / rigs ngan pa la sogs pas gnod pa byas kyang mi khro zhing nyams su len pa ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang gdol bu dang / rigs ngan pa la sogs pas gnod pa byas kyang mi khro zhing nyams su len pa ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
translated: In the perfection of patience, it is astonishing that one does not get angry at those who harm one, such as outcastes and lowlifes, and that one practices patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni ngo mtshar du bya'o //
translated: In the perfection of effort, it is astonishing that one undertakes effort without regard for one's body or life.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bsam gtan gyi rol ma chags pa ngo mtshar du bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bsam gtan gyi rol ma chags pa ngo mtshar du bya ba'o //
translated: In the perfection of concentration, it is astonishing that one is not attached to the taste of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang chos thams cad stong bar rtogs pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang chos thams cad stong bar rtogs pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba'o //
translated: The realization that all phenomena are empty in the perfection of wisdom is also a wonder.

original: yun ring po'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rgya chen po la spyad kyang 'bras bu myur du mi 'thob kyi bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du 'du shes pa yang ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yun ring po'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rgya chen po la spyad kyang 'bras bu myur du mi 'thob kyi bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du 'du shes pa yang ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no //
translated: The idea of a long period of time: even though one practices the vast perfections in that way, one does not quickly attain the result, but rather for three measureless kalpas.

original: lan re ba med pa'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lan re ba med pa'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The idea of not expecting anything in return:

original: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sems can bkod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sems can bkod de /
translated: the bodhisattva establishes sentient beings in the six perfections,

original: sems can de la phan btags kyang tshe 'di la phan btags pa'i lan la re ba med pa yang ngo mtshar du bya ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can de la phan btags kyang tshe 'di la phan btags pa'i lan la re ba med pa yang ngo mtshar du bya ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and even though he benefits those sentient beings, he does not expect any benefit in return in this life.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i 'du shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i 'du shes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The idea of not hoping for a karmic result:

original: las su bya ba thams cad la ni 'bras bu'i don du byed pa yin na /
analyzed: las su bya ba thams cad la ni 'bras bu'i don du byed pa yin na /
translated: all actions are done for the sake of the result.

original: tshe 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad kyi tshe phyi mar longs spyod chen po la @215b sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la mi re ba bzhin du spyod pa yang ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad kyi tshe phyi mar longs spyod chen po la @215b sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la mi re ba bzhin du spyod pa yang ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is also amazing to practice the six perfections in this life without hoping for the fruitional effect in the next life, such as great wealth and so on.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa spangs pa dang / yun ring bor gyur nas sangs rgyas pa'i 'bras bur 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes bzhi 'chad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa spangs pa dang / yun ring bor gyur nas sangs rgyas pa'i 'bras bur 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes bzhi 'chad de /
translated: The four ideas that are not amazing are explained as follows:

original: sa bon du 'bras btab la 'bras bu yang 'bras skye ba ni ngo mtshar mi che ste /
analyzed: sa bon du 'bras btab la 'bras bu yang 'bras skye ba ni ngo mtshar mi che ste /
translated: It is not amazing that a rice seed produces a rice sprout,üîΩand a rice sprout produces rice.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rgya chen po la yang spyad yun ring por yang spyad nas mjug 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rgya chen po la yang spyad yun ring por yang spyad nas mjug 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is not amazing that one practices the vast perfections for a long time and then attains the result of unexcelled enlightenment.

original: rgyu chad med pa la spyad nas 'bras bu tshad med pa thob pa ni ngo mtshar du mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu chad med pa la spyad nas 'bras bu tshad med pa thob pa ni ngo mtshar du mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having practiced the cause without measure, the attainment of the result without measure is not a great wonder.üîΩWhen those two exist, the mind is equal with regard to self and others.

original: gnyis po de yod na bdag dang pha rol la sems mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la spangs pa dang yun ring po dang mi ldan pa rnams la bdag bzhin du gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni ngo mtshar du bya pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnyis po de yod na bdag dang pha rol la sems mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la spangs pa dang yun ring po dang mi ldan pa rnams la bdag bzhin du gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni ngo mtshar du bya pa yin gyi /
translated: The benefit of others like oneself is a wonder for those who have long been without the perception of abandonment.

original: spangs pa dang yun ring po'i 'du shes dang ldan pa rnams bdag dang pha rol sems mnyam ste /
analyzed: spangs pa dang yun ring po'i 'du shes dang ldan pa rnams bdag dang pha rol sems mnyam ste /
translated: The mind is equal with regard to self and others for those who have the perception of abandonment and long-term practice.üîΩThe benefit of other sentient beings like oneself is not a great wonder.

original: bdag bzhin du sems can gzhan la phan par byed pa ni ngo mtshar du mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag bzhin du sems can gzhan la phan par byed pa ni ngo mtshar du mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: de dag pas mchog brgya byin la sogs pa mchod pa la sogs pa rnyed du zin kyang slar lan re ba med pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag pas mchog brgya byin la sogs pa mchod pa la sogs pa rnyed du zin kyang slar lan re ba med pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though they have obtained the worship, etc. of Indra, etc., they are not desirous of a reward in return.

original: de dag gi sgras ni phan btags pa'i sems can phal pa la snyegs so //
analyzed: de dag gi sgras ni phan btags pa'i sems can phal pa la snyegs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers to ordinary sentient beings who have been benefited.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa la phan btags nas brgya byin dang tshangs pas lan du mchod pa phul ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang lan re ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa la phan btags nas brgya byin dang tshangs pas lan du mchod pa phul ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la yang lan re ba med de /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva has benefited Indra, Brahma, and so on, he does not expect any reward in return for the offerings and respect he receives from Indra and Brahma.

original: mchil ma'i rdog gu tsam du sems na sems can phal pas phan btags pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti ngan pa la lan re ba med pa lta ci zhig ngo mtshar che ste mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchil ma'i rdog gu tsam du sems na sems can phal pas phan btags pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti ngan pa la lan re ba med pa lta ci zhig ngo mtshar che ste mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not expect any reward in return for the inferior offerings and respect he receives from ordinary beings, whom he regards as no more than a drop of water.

original: bdag gi dngos po dang longs spyod 'jig rten las 'phags pa thob par rnam par smin pa mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po dang longs spyod 'jig rten las 'phags pa thob par rnam par smin pa mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: He does not wish for the maturation of obtaining a body and resources superior to those of the world.

original: byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad na ma 'ongs pa las bdag gi lus sku gsum gyi mtshan nyid thob pa dang longs spyod kyang 'jig rten kun las 'phags te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad na ma 'ongs pa las bdag gi lus sku gsum gyi mtshan nyid thob pa dang longs spyod kyang 'jig rten kun las 'phags te /
translated: If bodhisattvas practice the six transcendent perfections, in the future they will obtain a body with the characteristics of the three buddha bodies and resources that are superior to those of the whole world.

original: khyad zhugs pa thob pas lha'i lus cam dang / longs spyod can gyis rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ni ngo mtshar mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad zhugs pa thob pas lha'i lus cam dang / longs spyod can gyis rnam par smin pa la mi re ba ni ngo mtshar mi che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not surprising that one who has attained the special quality of the body of a god, and who has the enjoyment of wealth, should not hope for a maturation.

original: sems can dag ni snyoms @216a * //
analyzed: sems can dag ni snyoms @216a * //
translated: Beings are equal,üîΩand the object is of great value,üîΩone hopes for a return of benefit to others,

original: pa dang // chen po'i bdag nyid dmigs pa dang // gzhan gyi yon tan lan re dang // gsum du re zhing rgyun du'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa dang // chen po'i bdag nyid dmigs pa dang // gzhan gyi yon tan lan re dang // gsum du re zhing rgyun du'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and for the continuity of the three.

original: gzhan yang snyoms pa yid la byed pa dang chen po'i bdag nyid dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / lan 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa dang / re ba yid la byed pa dang / rgyun du yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang snyoms pa yid la byed pa dang chen po'i bdag nyid dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / lan 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa dang / re ba yid la byed pa dang / rgyun du yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, there is the attention of equality, the attention of the object of great value, the attention of hoping for a return, the attention of hope, and the attention of continuity.

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By these attentions, the element increases. This is the meaning.

original: sems can la la ni pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog la la mi 'jog pa ma yin gyi sems can thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog pa ni snyoms pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can la la ni pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog la la mi 'jog pa ma yin gyi sems can thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog pa ni snyoms pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not the case that some sentient beings are established in the perfections and some are not. To establish all sentient beings in the perfections is called the mental attention of impartiality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad na bde ba dang pan pa 'ba' zhig du 'gyur gyi gnod pa'i dngos po ni cung zad mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mthong ba ni bdag nyid chen po dmigs pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad na bde ba dang pan pa 'ba' zhig du 'gyur gyi gnod pa'i dngos po ni cung zad mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mthong ba ni bdag nyid chen po dmigs pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To see that if one practices the six perfections, there is only happiness and benefit and not the slightest harm is called the mental attention of observing the great self.

original: sems can pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pa las pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan dang ldan pa mthong na sems can 'di dag gis ni bdag la phan btags so snyam du sems pa ni lan 'dod pa yid la byed pa'o zhes bya'o
analyzed: sems can pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pa las pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan dang ldan pa mthong na sems can 'di dag gis ni bdag la phan btags so snyam du sems pa ni lan 'dod pa yid la byed pa'o zhes bya'o
translated: To see that sentient beings who have been induced to practice the perfections possess the qualities of the six perfections and to think, these sentient beings have benefited me, is called the mental attention of desiring repayment.

original: // pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams gnas gsum thob par shog shig ces re ba ni yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: // pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams gnas gsum thob par shog shig ces re ba ni yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The hope that beings who practice the six perfections will attain the three abodes is called attention.

original: gnas gsum ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar thug par re ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mthar thug par re ba dang / sems can gyi don re ba'o //
analyzed: gnas gsum ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar thug par re ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mthar thug par re ba dang / sems can gyi don re ba'o //
translated: The three abodes are the hope for the ultimate of the bodhisattva stages, the hope for the ultimate of the buddha stage, and the hope for the benefit of beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar thug par re ba ni sbyin pas sa dang mthar thug par re ba nas ye shes kyi sa bcu'i mthar thug par re ba'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar thug par re ba ni sbyin pas sa dang mthar thug par re ba nas ye shes kyi sa bcu'i mthar thug par re ba'o //
translated: The hope for the ultimate of the bodhisattva stages is the hope for the ultimate of the stages through generosity, and the hope for the ultimate of the ten stages through wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mthar thug par reb ni sa bcu 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par shog shig ces re ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mthar thug par reb ni sa bcu 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par shog shig ces re ba'o //
translated: The hope for the ultimate of the buddha stage is the hope to attain the buddha stage after passing beyond the ten stages.

original: sems can don re ba ni sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba byed par shog shig ces zer ba'o //
analyzed: sems can don re ba ni sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba byed par shog shig ces zer ba'o //
translated: The hope for the benefit of beings is the hope to benefit and gladden all beings after attaining buddhahood.

original: bar 'ga' pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par 'ga' mi spyod pa lta bu ma yin gyi chu'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par spyod pa ni rgyun du yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar 'ga' pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par 'ga' mi spyod pa lta bu ma yin gyi chu'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par spyod pa ni rgyun du yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Sometimes one does not practice the perfections, but it is not like that. Practicing without interruption like the flow of a river is called constant attention.üîΩFrom the time of accomplishing the Buddha's teachings

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa sgrub tshun chad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa sgrub tshun chad //
translated: up to the end,

original: mi gnas pa yi sems pa ste //
analyzed: mi gnas pa yi sems pa ste //
translated: it is the non-abiding thought

original: de 'grib 'phel ba'i sems can la //
analyzed: de 'grib 'phel ba'i sems can la //
translated: toward sentient beings who increase and decrease.

original: mi dga' dang ni dga' ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dga' dang ni dga' ba'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Dislike and liking.

original: gzhan yang dag par sbyor ba yid la @216b byed pa dang / mi dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dag par sbyor ba yid la @216b byed pa dang / mi dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Here, there is attention to proper application, attention to dislike, and attention to liking.

original: des kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that, the element increases - this is the meaning.

original: de la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yid la byed pa ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Among them, attention to proper application is from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment,

original: mnyan pa dang sems par byed pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: mnyan pa dang sems par byed pa las brtsams te /
translated: starting from listening and reflecting.

original: mthar sangs rgyas pa ma thob kyi bar du bar ma dor brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar sangs rgyas pa ma thob kyi bar du bar ma dor brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of right application is the conscientious attitude of never abandoning effort in the interval until one finally attains buddhahood.

original: sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa las pha rol tu phyin pa nyams par mthong na /üîΩsems la ma mos pa ni mi dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa las pha rol tu phyin pa nyams par mthong na / sems la ma mos pa ni mi dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of displeasure is the conscientious attitude of displeasure when one sees that sentient beings are not practicing the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa 'phel zhing rgya che bar gyur pa mthong nas sems la mos pa ni dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa 'phel zhing rgya che bar gyur pa mthong nas sems la mos pa ni dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of pleasure is the conscientious attitude of pleasure when one sees that the practice of the perfections such as generosity is increasing and expanding.üîΩThe conscientious attitude of nonacceptance is the conscientious attitude of not accepting the six perfections as one‚Äôs own practice.üîΩThe conscientious attitude of acceptance is the conscientious attitude of accepting the six perfections as one‚Äôs own practice.

original: gzugs brnyan dang ni yang dag la //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang ni yang dag la //
translated: The conscientious attitude of the reflection of the image is the conscientious attitude of reflecting on the image of the six perfections.üîΩThe conscientious attitude of meditation is the conscientious attitude of meditating on the six perfections.

original: bsgom pa dang ni mos pa spyod //üîΩdang du mi len yid la byed //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang ni mos pa spyod // dang du mi len yid la byed //
translated: The conscientious attitude of the practice of conviction is the conscientious attitude of practicing the six perfections with conviction.

original: lung bstan pa dang nges par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: lung bstan pa dang nges par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la /
translated: The conscientious attitude of the prediction is the conscientious attitude of being predicted to the supreme enlightenment by the Buddhas.üîΩThe conscientious attitude of certainty is the conscientious attitude of being certain of attaining the supreme enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang mi mos pa yid la byed pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa dang / dang du mi len pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod pa yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi mos pa yid la byed pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa dang / dang du mi len pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod pa yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the element of the perfections is increased by the attention of non-faith, the attention of faith, the attention of non-acceptance, and the attention of desire.üîΩThe meaning is that the element of the perfections is increased.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan bsgom pa la ma dad pa ni mi mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste ;üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni dper na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang mtshon cha dang dug la sogs pa sbyin pa yin yang pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan bsgom pa la ma dad pa ni mi mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste ; pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni dper na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang mtshon cha dang dug la sogs pa sbyin pa yin yang pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang /
translated: Therein, non-faith in the cultivation of the semblance of the perfections is called the attention of non-faith.

original: bdag dang rtag pa la sogs pa yod par lta ba shes rab yin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa lta bu ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang rtag pa la sogs pa yod par lta ba shes rab yin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa lta bu ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o //
translated: The semblance of the perfections is, for example, the giving of weapons, poison, etc., which is giving but not the perfection, and in the perfection of wisdom, the wisdom which is the view that the self, permanence, etc. exist, but which is not the perfection of wisdom. This is called the semblance of the perfections.

original: yang dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dga' ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dga' ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The delight in cultivating the true perfections is called the attention of aspiration.

original: yang dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang phyi dang nang gi dngos po kun gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang phyi dang nang gi dngos po kun gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'o //
translated: The true perfections are the perfection of giving, which is the giving of all internal and external things, and the perfection of wisdom, which is the unerring knowledge of the general and particular characteristics of things.

original: dang du mi len pa yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa byung na sbyin pas 'dul bar byed pas na 'chal pa'i shes rab byung na shes rab kyis 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang du mi len pa yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa byung na sbyin pas 'dul bar byed pas na 'chal pa'i shes rab byung na shes rab kyis 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The attention of non-acceptance is the attention of subduing the arising of stinginess, etc., which are the resistances to giving, etc.

original: @217a * // 'dod pa yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: @217a * // 'dod pa yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attention of desire is twofold:

original: lung bstan pa 'dod pa dang / nges pa'i sa la gnas pa thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa 'dod pa dang / nges pa'i sa la gnas pa thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: the desire for prophecy and the desire to attain the stage of certain destiny.

original: lung bstan pa 'dod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rigs kyi bu khyod dus ji srid cig nas pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa 'dod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rigs kyi bu khyod dus ji srid cig nas pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire for prediction is the desire to be predicted by the Tathagatas, Son of good family, after so long you will complete the perfections and attain supreme enlightenment.

original: yang na sa brgyad pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: yang na sa brgyad pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: Or else, at the time of the eighth stage, the Tathagatas predict supreme enlightenment.

original: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pas sa brgyad pa ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur zhes 'dod pa ni lung bstan par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pas sa brgyad pa ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur zhes 'dod pa ni lung bstan par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to be predicted is the desire to attain the eighth stage by practicing the perfections.

original: nges pa'i sa la 'thob pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nges pa'i sa la 'thob pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Attainment on the stages of certainty is twofold:

original: longs spyod nges par 'dod pa dang / skye ba nges par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod nges par 'dod pa dang / skye ba nges par 'dod pa'o //
translated: the desire for certainty in resources and the desire for certainty in rebirth.

original: de la longs spyod nges par 'dod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sa dang po thob pa nas /
analyzed: de la longs spyod nges par 'dod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sa dang po thob pa nas /
translated: The desire for certainty in resources is the desire to attain the first stage by means of the perfection of generosity.

original: skad cig ma gcig pa 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar nus pa ni mthu la 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod chen po thob par 'dod pas na yi shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas kyang sa bcu thob nas 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i bye ma'i klung snyed g-yo bar byed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'dod pas na rig pa'i
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig pa 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar nus pa ni mthu la 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod chen po thob par 'dod pas na yi shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas kyang sa bcu thob nas 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i bye ma'i klung snyed g-yo bar byed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'dod pas na rig pa'i
translated: The desire to have the power to shake a hundred world systems in a single instant is the desire for power.

original: gnas thams cad la mkhas par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas thams cad la mkhas par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire to be skilled in all the branches of knowledge is the desire for knowledge.

original: skye ba nges par 'dod pa ni sa bcu thob nas skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba nges par 'dod pa ni sa bcu thob nas skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire to be certain about one's rebirth is the desire to attain the state of a bodhisattva who is only one birth away from Buddhahood after attaining the tenth bodhisattva level.

original: ma nges dus na mjug mthong ba //
analyzed: ma nges dus na mjug mthong ba //
translated: The desire to see the end of samsara is the desire to see the end of samsara when one is not yet certain of one's enlightenment.

original: yid byed dang ni mnyam rtog pa //üîΩmchog gi chos la 'jug pa na //
analyzed: yid byed dang ni mnyam rtog pa // mchog gi chos la 'jug pa na //
translated: The desire to be the best is the desire to be the best in the eyes of others.üîΩThe desire to be the highest is the desire to be the highest in the eyes of others.

original: bdag nyid mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: The desire to be the most excellent is the desire to be the most excellent in the eyes of others.üîΩThe desire to be the most powerful is the desire to have the power to shake as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River after attaining the tenth bodhisattva level.üîΩThe desire to be skilled in all the branches of knowledge is the desire to be skilled in all the branches of knowledge.üîΩThe desire to be certain about one's rebirth is the desire to attain the state of a bodhisattva who is only one birth away from Buddhahood after attaining the tenth bodhisattva level.üîΩThe desire to see the end of samsara is the desire to see the end of samsara when one is not yet certain of one's enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mthong bas 'jug pa yid la byed pa dang / mnyam par rtog pa yid la byed pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mthong bas 'jug pa yid la byed pa dang / mnyam par rtog pa yid la byed pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, one should know that the elements increase through the mental attentions of engaging through seeing in the future, the mental attention of thinking of equality and the mental attention of holding as supreme.

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis kyang khams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those mental attentions cause the elements to increase.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩbyang chub tu sems bskyed nas bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod na lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rgyud gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad dogs par mthong nas 'di snyam du yun bsrings te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te / byang chub tu sems bskyed nas bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod na lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rgyud gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad dogs par mthong nas 'di snyam du yun bsrings te /
translated: In this regard, bodhisattvas think as follows.

original: ji zhig byas tshe 'di kho na nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus mthong bas 'jug pa yid @217b la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji zhig byas tshe 'di kho na nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus mthong bas 'jug pa yid @217b la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having generated the mind of enlightenment, if one wishes for unsurpassable enlightenment, then wherever one is born in the continuum of gods, humans and so on, one should see that one practices the six perfections. Thinking this, one extends the time, thinking, ‚ÄúWhen I have done this, I will practice the six perfections right now.‚Äù This is called the mental attention of engaging through seeing the future.

original: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gus par spyad pa dang / rgyun du spyad na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag dang lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gus par spyad pa dang / rgyun du spyad na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag dang lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mnyam pa yin no //
translated: If I practice the perfections respectfully and practice them continuously, then I am equal to other bodhisattvas in body, speech, and mind.üîΩIf I practice the six perfections and practice them continuously, then I am equal to other bodhisattvas in body, speech, and mind.

original: bdag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / rgyun du spyad pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mnyam mo snyam du rtog pa ni mnyam par rtog pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / rgyun du spyad pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mnyam mo snyam du rtog pa ni mnyam par rtog pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thinking in this way is called attention that is equalizing thought.

original: bdag ni spyod pa'i mchog pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: bdag ni spyod pa'i mchog pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la spyod pas /
translated: I am practicing the supreme practice, the practice of the perfections.

original: 'jig rten kun las 'phags pa'i lus //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun las 'phags pa'i lus //
translated: My body is superior to the world.

original: lus dang longs spyod thob bar 'dod pa ni bdag mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod thob bar 'dod pa ni bdag mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought that wishes to obtain a body and enjoyments is called attention that is self-conceited.

original: yid la byed pa gong du bshad pa rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gong du bshad pa rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the above-mentioned attentions, it is said:

original: dge ba yid byed de dag ni //
analyzed: dge ba yid byed de dag ni //
translated: These virtuous attentions

original: rgyu ni pha rol phyin pa bcu //
analyzed: rgyu ni pha rol phyin pa bcu //
translated: The cause is the ten perfections.

original: mdor na byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: mdor na byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva

original: khams ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khams ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: develops the element.

original: zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rgyu mthong nas dga' pa yid la byed pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rgyu mthong nas dga' pa yid la byed pa nas brtsams te /
translated: From the mental attention of joy upon seeing the cause,

original: bdag mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa'i bar du yid la byed pa 'di dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: bdag mchog tu 'dzin pa yid la byed pa'i bar du yid la byed pa 'di dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin pas /
translated: up to the mental attention of holding oneself as supreme, these mental attentions are the mental attentions that bring about the completion of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: dge ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: dge ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ste //
translated: Therefore, they are called virtuous mental attentions.

original: yid la byed pa de dag kyang //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag kyang //
translated: And these mental attentions

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la dmigs shing brten nas yid la byed pas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la dmigs shing brten nas yid la byed pas /
translated: are mental attentions that focus on and rely on the ten perfections.

original: rgyu ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause is the ten perfections.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa bon dang rigs rgyas shing brtas par 'gyur bas na khams rgyas par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa bon dang rigs rgyas shing brtas par 'gyur bas na khams rgyas par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since those mental attentions cause the seed and lineage of the perfections to develop and expand, they are called the development of the element.

original: chos tshol ba'i bye brag la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la chos la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos tshol ba'i bye brag la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la chos la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the search for Dharma.üîΩ

original: bshad pa'i chos dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: Two verses on the varieties of the search for the teaching. The teaching is of two kinds: the teaching as statement and the teaching as understanding.

analyzed: de la bshad par bya ba'i chos ni ji ltar btsal /
translated: How is the teaching as statement to be sought?üîΩHow is the teaching as understanding to be sought?üîΩThe two verses show this.

analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba'i chos ni ji ltar btsal brtag pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The steadfast seek the teaching

original: rgyas dang lhag pa'i bsam dad che //üîΩbrtan pa rnams kyis btsal bar 'dod //
analyzed: rgyas dang lhag pa'i bsam dad che // brtan pa rnams kyis btsal bar 'dod //
translated: with extensive, superior, and intense aspiration.

original: bar chad bcas dang bar chad yin //
analyzed: bar chad bcas dang bar chad yin //
translated: With obstacles and without,

original: de bzhin 'byor pa de dag gis //
analyzed: de bzhin 'byor pa de dag gis //
translated: and likewise with and without resources.üîΩBodhisattvas seek the teaching

original: lus med lus bcas lus rnyed lus rdzogs pa //
analyzed: lus med lus bcas lus rnyed lus rdzogs pa //
translated: with bodies, with no bodies, with bodies attained, and with bodies fully developed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis te //üîΩnga rgyal med dang nga rgyal phra //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis te // nga rgyal med dang nga rgyal phra //
translated: Bodhisattvas seek the teaching

original: nga rgyal med pa rnams su dgongs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩbyang chub sems @218a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa rnams su dgongs // zhes bya ba la / byang chub sems @218a * //
translated: with no pride, with pride, and with no pride.

original: dpa' chos btsal ba ni rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: dpa' chos btsal ba ni rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
translated: The bodhisattvas' search for the teaching is thirteenfold.

original: de la chos kyi sgras ni bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i chos chos kyi sku la bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sgras ni bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i chos chos kyi sku la bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù refers to the twelve branches of the scriptures, which are to be explained, and to the Dharma Body, which is to be realized.

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i dus na dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i dus na dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa nas brtsams te ;
translated: In the stage of ordinary people, from the time of listening to and reflecting on the true Dharma,

analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chad na nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa ni rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: up to the supreme worldly dharma of the stage of action in faith, listening, reflecting, etc. are called ‚Äúextensive.‚Äù

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi tshe chos kyi sgo'i rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin rnyed nas sa dang po'i dus nas brtsams te /

translated: At the time of the supreme worldly dharma of the stage of action in faith, having attained the meditative stabilization of the stream of the door of Dharma, from the time of the first stage,

analyzed: sa bdun man chad kyi tsha na ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: up to the time of the seventh stage, it is called ‚Äúhaving superior intention.‚Äù

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pa dang / bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi tshe sems rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pa dang / bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi tshe sems rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has attained the mind that realizes the selflessness of persons and things and the equality of self and others.

original: sa brgyad nas sa bcu man chad kyi chos rtogs pa la che ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad nas sa bcu man chad kyi chos rtogs pa la che ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The realization of the Dharma from the eighth stage up to the tenth stage is called ‚Äúgreat.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because one obtains the nonconceptual, spontaneously accomplished intuition.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos btsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni de lta bu yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩso so'i spyi bo'i dus nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos btsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni de lta bu yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to // so so'i spyi bo'i dus nas brtsams te /
translated: This is held to be the characteristic of the bodhisattvas‚Äô search for the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chad kyi tshe chos mthong ba ni bar chad dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chad kyi tshe chos mthong ba ni bar chad dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the time of the first stage up to the supreme mundane level, the vision of the Dharma is said to be ‚Äúwith obstacles,‚Äù

original: bsam pa mi brtan pa dang / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bslur zug pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gar drangs pa der 'jug pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir bar chad dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mi brtan pa dang / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bslur zug pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gar drangs pa der 'jug pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir bar chad dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because one‚Äôs attitude is unstable, one is deceived by nonvirtuous friends, one is led by virtuous friends, and one has not eliminated the obstacles of the passions and of the knowable.

analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bcu man chad kyi tshe chos rtogs pa la ni bar chad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the first stage up to the tenth stage, the realization of the Dharma is called unobstructed,

original: de phan chad bsam pa brtan pa dang mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bslur mi zug pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gar drangs par mi 'jug pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rim gyis spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang par bya ba shas kyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa brgyad na sa bcu man chad kyi tshe /
analyzed: de phan chad bsam pa brtan pa dang mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bslur mi zug pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gar drangs par mi 'jug pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rim gyis spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang par bya ba shas kyis spangs pa'i phyir ro // sa brgyad na sa bcu man chad kyi tshe /
translated: because from then on, one is firm in one's resolve, cannot be deceived by bad friends, cannot be led around by bad friends, gradually eliminates the afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing, and partially eliminates those to be eliminated by cultivation.

original: chos rtogs pa ni 'byor pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos rtogs pa ni 'byor pa zhes bya ste /
translated: On the eighth stage, the realization of the Dharma from the ninth stage up is called mastery,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mngon par shes pa la dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar bya ba lhun gyis grub pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mngon par shes pa la dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar bya ba lhun gyis grub pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains spontaneous realization of the nondiscriminative, the superknowledges, and the purification of the buddhaverse.

original: so so'i skye bo'i dus na nyan @218b pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dus na ni lus med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dus na nyan @218b pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dus na ni lus med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the ordinary man, at the time of listening and reflection, etc., it is called bodiless,

original: chos kyi sku mngon sum du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku mngon sum du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the dharmakƒÅya is not actualized.

analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na ni lus dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: gzung 'dzin spangs pa'i chos kyi sku shas kyis rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has obtained a part of the dharmakƒÅya free from subject and object.

analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi tshe na ni lus rnyed pa zhes bya ste /

translated: because one has obtained the nonconceptual gnosis free from the view of the transitory composite and from subject and object, but one still has to strive for it.

original: sa brgyad nas sa bcu man chad kyi tshe na ni lus rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad nas sa bcu man chad kyi tshe na ni lus rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the eighth stage up to the tenth stage, it is called ‚Äúhaving a perfect body‚Äù

original: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //

original: so so'i skye bo'i dus nas mos pa spyod pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chad kyi tshe na ni nga rgyal mang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dus nas mos pa spyod pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos mchog man chad kyi tshe na ni nga rgyal mang ba zhes bya ste /

original: nga dang bdag tu yid la yod cing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga dang bdag tu yid la yod cing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have not abandoned the stain of the subject-object dichotomy, which is the mental attitude of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi nang na ni nga rgyal phra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: From the first stage up to the seventh, it is called ‚Äúsubtle pride,‚Äù

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa ma thob cing btsal 'bad pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has not yet attained spontaneous nonconceptual intuition, and because one is still engaged in the search for and cultivation of nonconceptual intuition.

analyzed: sa brgyad nas sa bcu man chad kyi tshe na ni nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the eighth stage up to the tenth, it is called ‚Äúabsence of pride,‚Äù

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos kyi rgyu'i ngo bo brtag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: chos de dag gi rgyu 'di dang 'di 'dra yin no zhes shes par bya zhing brtag pa la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
