original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la zad pa dang med pa'i 'jigs par 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon bar shes pa drug dang / med par 'gyur pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu yang dam pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis byed pas na dam pa'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la zad pa dang med pa'i 'jigs par 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon bar shes pa drug dang / med par 'gyur pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i rgyu yang dam pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis byed pas na dam pa'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas have no fear of the extinction and nonexistence of Nirvana, in the same way, the six superknowledges and the Bodhisattvas have no fear of nonexistence. The cause of that is the holy Dharma, the twelve divisions of the scriptures. Therefore, one should generate the notion of Nirvana with regard to the holy Dharma.

original: @220b rnam par rtog pa btsal ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @220b rnam par rtog pa btsal ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In seeking the conceptualization, there is a verse.

original: ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' sems la rnam par rtog pa byung ba de tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' sems la rnam par rtog pa byung ba de tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin te /
translated: To the extent that the Bodhisattva has conceptualization in his mind, to that extent he has an obstacle to the realization of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa 'di dang 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin no zhes brtag par bya ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa 'di dang 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin no zhes brtag par bya ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that they are taught in one verse.

original: med yod sgro 'dogs skur 'debs rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: med yod sgro 'dogs skur 'debs rnam rtog pa //
translated: Conceptualization of non-existence and existence, superimposition and denial,üîΩConceptualization of oneness and separateness, self and distinction, and attachment to names and meanings,

original: gcig dang tha dad bdag dang khyad par rtog / ji ltar ming dang don la mngon chags rtog / rgyal ba'i sras kyis yongs su spang bar bya //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad bdag dang khyad par rtog / ji ltar ming dang don la mngon chags rtog / rgyal ba'i sras kyis yongs su spang bar bya //
translated: The Victor's heirs should completely abandon.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bcu ste /
translated: the conceptualizations that are obstacles to understanding the meaning of the perfection of wisdom are ten.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: med par rnam par rtog pa dang / yod par rnam par rtog pa dang / sgro 'dogs par rnam par rtog pa dang / skur pa 'debs par rnam par rtog pa dang / gcig par rnam par rtog pa dang / tha dad par rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: med par rnam par rtog pa dang / yod par rnam par rtog pa dang / sgro 'dogs par rnam par rtog pa dang / skur pa 'debs par rnam par rtog pa dang / gcig par rnam par rtog pa dang / tha dad par rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: The conception of non-existence, the conception of existence, the conception of superimposition, the conception of denial, the conception of singularity, the conception of multiplicity,

original: bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / khyad par du rnam par rtog pa dang / ji ltar ming bzhin du don la mngon par rtogs nas rnam par rtog pa dang / ji ltar don bzhin du ming la mngon par chags nas rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / khyad par du rnam par rtog pa dang / ji ltar ming bzhin du don la mngon par rtogs nas rnam par rtog pa dang / ji ltar don bzhin du ming la mngon par chags nas rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: the conception of self, the conception of distinction, the conception of realizing the object in accordance with the name, and the conception of being attached to the name in accordance with the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag byang chub sems dpas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag byang chub sems dpas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These conceptions should be abandoned by the bodhisattva.

original: med pa la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: med pa la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: The antidote to the conception of non-existence is the perfection of wisdom, as stated in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' nyid kyi yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' nyid kyi yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, the very being, says it exists.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid dang yongs su grub pa ni yod pa yin la de'ang thams cad du med do zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid dang yongs su grub pa ni yod pa yin la de'ang thams cad du med do zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las byang chub sems dpa'
translated: In order to remedy the conception that they are nonexistent, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas says:üîΩThe bodhisattva

original: bos nas / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis yod pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bos nas / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis yod pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: asked, ‚ÄúIs the thoroughly established nature existent?‚ÄùüîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva, the thoroughly established nature is not nonexistent.‚Äù

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the emptiness that is free from the imputed person and the thoroughly established nature are not nonexistent.üîΩIn order to remedy the conception that they are things, it is said that the bodhisattva does not observe them and so on.

original: dngos po la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la /üîΩkun @221a * //
analyzed: dngos po la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la /üîΩkun @221a * //
translated: The meaning of the statement that the bodhisattva does not observe them is that the bodhisattva does not observe the imputed nature.

original: brtags kyi gang zag dngos po dang / rang bzhin yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: brtags kyi gang zag dngos po dang / rang bzhin yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines also says, ‚ÄúA bodhisattva is not apprehended,‚Äù as an antidote to the conception that the imputed person and things have intrinsic reality.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag gi mtshan nyid du ni byang chub sems dpa' yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag gi mtshan nyid du ni byang chub sems dpa' yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a bodhisattva does not exist as the characteristic of the imputed person.

original: 'di yan chad du tshig gnyis kyis gang zag yod par rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gang zag la bdag med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad du tshig gnyis kyis gang zag yod par rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gang zag la bdag med par bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, two phrases have taught the selflessness of persons as an antidote to the conception that the person exists.

original: sgro 'dogs par rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs par rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: As an antidote to the conception of superimposition, the Buddha said, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, form is empty by intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: kun brtags kyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yod par rtog pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yod par rtog pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The conception that imputed form, sound, and so on exist is called the conception of superimposition.

original: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: As an antidote to that, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas says, ‚ÄúForm is empty by nature.‚Äù

original: kun brtags kyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that imputed form, sound, and so on do not exist.

original: skur pa 'debs pa rnam par rtog pa de'i gnyen por stong pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa rnam par rtog pa de'i gnyen por stong pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: As an antidote to the conception that is a denial, it says, ‚ÄúIt is not empty.‚Äù

original: kun brtags kyi chos dang bral ba'i yongs su grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos dang bral ba'i yongs su grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The consummate, which is free from imputed phenomena, does not exist.

original: de'ang thams cad nas thams cad du med do zhes rtog pa ni skur pa 'debs par rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang thams cad nas thams cad du med do zhes rtog pa ni skur pa 'debs par rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: And the thought that it does not exist in every way is called the conception that is a denial.

original: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum la sogs par med pa yang ma yin no zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum la sogs par med pa yang ma yin no zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: As an antidote to that, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas says, ‚ÄúIt is not nonexistent.‚Äù

original: don du na gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i stong pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad nas thams cad du med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgcig la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs kyi stong pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don du na gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i stong pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad nas thams cad du med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gcig la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs kyi stong pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In fact, the characteristic of the perfected, which is emptiness free from subject and object, is not totally and completely nonexistent.üîΩIn order to counteract the notion that they are one, it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines:üîΩThe emptiness of form is not form.

original: chos can gzugs dang chos nyid stong pa nyid dang / kun brtags kyi chos dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis su rang bzhin gcig go zhes rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: chos can gzugs dang chos nyid stong pa nyid dang / kun brtags kyi chos dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis su rang bzhin gcig go zhes rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin /
translated: In order to counteract the notion that the reality of form and the emptiness of form are two different things, it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines:

original: gzugs gang yin pa de stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes bka' stsal te //
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa de stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes bka' stsal te //
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.

original: don du kun brtags kyi gzugs dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du kun brtags kyi gzugs dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In fact, it is not the case that the imagined form and the perfected are the same nature.üîΩIn order to counteract the notion that they are different, it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines:üîΩForm is not other than emptiness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs @221b ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin la yongs su grub pa ni ma 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs @221b ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin la yongs su grub pa ni ma 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form is the nature of error, and the perfected nature is the nature of non-error.

original: tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong ba nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong ba nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin te /
translated: As an antidote to the conception of difference, it is said, ‚ÄúForm is not other than emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: emptiness is form.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyang logs shig na yod stong pa nyid logs shig na yod ces gzugs dang stong pa nyid tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyang logs shig na yod stong pa nyid logs shig na yod ces gzugs dang stong pa nyid tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas, it says, ‚ÄúForm is not other than emptiness,

original: gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin te /
translated: emptiness is not other than form.

original: gang gzugs de stong pa stong pa de gzugs te zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gang gzugs de stong pa stong pa de gzugs te zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: That which is form is emptiness, that which is emptiness is form.‚Äù

original: gzugs las ma gtogs par gzugs kyi stong pa logs shig na med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs las ma gtogs par gzugs kyi stong pa logs shig na med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that apart from form, the emptiness of form does not exist elsewhere.

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs ni ming tsam mo zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs ni ming tsam mo zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: As an antidote to the conception of the characteristics of the self, it is said, ‚Äúform is merely a name.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong ba can dang / sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs pa de bzhin du yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs ni ming tsam mo zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong ba can dang / sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs pa de bzhin du yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs ni ming tsam mo zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: As an antidote to the conception that the characteristics of form are obstructive, the characteristics of feeling are experience, the characteristics of earth are solidity, and so on, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas declares, ‚ÄúForm is merely a name.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa sra ba dang / gsher ba'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyang ming tsam brda tsam tha snyad tsam du zad kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sra ba dang / gsher ba'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyang ming tsam brda tsam tha snyad tsam du zad kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all the characteristics of form and so on, such as solidity and fluidity, are merely names, mere symbols, mere conventions, and they do not exist as characteristics.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa de'i gnyen por gzugs ni skye ba yang ma yin 'gag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa de'i gnyen por gzugs ni skye ba yang ma yin 'gag pa yang ma yin /
translated: As an antidote to the conception of their specific characteristics, it is said, ‚ÄúForm is not produced and does not cease.

original: nyon mongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not afflicted and is not purified.‚Äù

original: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor is it purification.

original: gzugs la skye ba yod do zhes bya ba la 'gag pa yod do zhes rtog pa dang / gzugs nyon mongs par rtog pa dang / gzugs rnam par byang bar rtog pa ni khyad par du rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la skye ba yod do zhes bya ba la 'gag pa yod do zhes rtog pa dang / gzugs nyon mongs par rtog pa dang / gzugs rnam par byang bar rtog pa ni khyad par du rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The conception that form has arising and cessation, the conception that form is afflicted, and the conception that form is purified is called the conception of distinctions.

original: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs ni skye ba yang ma yin 'gag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te don dam par ni gzugs la skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las gzugs ni skye ba yang ma yin 'gag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te don dam par ni gzugs la skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The antidote to that is the statement in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas that ‚Äúform is not arisen and does not cease,‚Äù and so on. The meaning is that ultimately form does not arise, does not cease, is not afflicted,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and is not purified.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don yin no mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa de'i gnyen por ming ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don yin no mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa de'i gnyen por ming ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is just as the name is. The antidote to the conception that is attached to that is the statement that ‚Äúthe name is false,‚Äù and so on.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming ni rang bzhin yod pa @222a * //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming ni rang bzhin yod pa @222a * //
translated: The names pot, cloth, and so on are imputed to things that exist by way of their intrinsic nature.üîΩJust as the names exist by way of their intrinsic nature, so too the things that are indicated by those names, such as pots and cloth, exist in the same way.

original: yin la ; ming rang bzhin yod pa bzhin du des mtshon par bya ba'i bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po yang de bzhin du yod do zhes rtog pa ni ming ji lta ba bzhin du don la mngon par chags nas rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yin la ; ming rang bzhin yod pa bzhin du des mtshon par bya ba'i bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po yang de bzhin du yod do zhes rtog pa ni ming ji lta ba bzhin du don la mngon par chags nas rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The conception that conceives of things in this way is called the conception that manifestly clings to objects in accordance with their names.

original: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa las ming ni brdzun pa'o zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa las ming ni brdzun pa'o zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: The antidote to that is the statement in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas that names are false.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming du btags pa rnams brdzun pa sgyu ma rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming du btags pa rnams brdzun pa sgyu ma rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is that the imputations of names such as pot and cloth are false, they are illusions and do not exist by way of their intrinsic nature.

original: don ji ltar ming la chags pa'i gnyen por ming de dang thams cad pa byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs te /
analyzed: don ji ltar ming la chags pa'i gnyen por ming de dang thams cad pa byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs te /
translated: The antidote to clinging to objects in accordance with their names is the statement in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas that ‚Äúthe name is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pas na mngon par mi chags so zhes bya ba la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yod pa bzhin du de'i ming la yang rang bzhin yod do zhes mngon par chags shing yod par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi
analyzed: mi dmigs pas na mngon par mi chags so zhes bya ba la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yod pa bzhin du de'i ming la yang rang bzhin yod do zhes mngon par chags shing yod par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyi
translated: In order to remedy the idea that the names of things such as pots and cloth exist by their intrinsic nature just as the things themselves do, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines says,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las ming de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so mi dmigs pas na mngon par mi chags so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum las ming de dag thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so mi dmigs pas na mngon par mi chags so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattvas do not observe any of those names and, since they do not observe them, they do not settle down on them.‚Äù

original: don du na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la yod par byang chub sems dpas mthong ste /
analyzed: don du na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la yod par byang chub sems dpas mthong ste /
translated: In fact, bodhisattvas see that the intrinsic nature of phenomena exists.

original: de ltar ming la rang bzhin yod par ma mthong bas na don la yang rang bzhin yod par mi chags mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ming la rang bzhin yod par ma mthong bas na don la yang rang bzhin yod par mi chags mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: So the meaning of the above passage is that, since they do not see any intrinsic nature in the names, they do not settle down on, or assert, any intrinsic nature in the things themselves.

original: da ni chos btsal ba'i mjug sdud pa dang / chos tshol ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos btsal ba'i mjug sdud pa dang / chos tshol ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude the search for the Dharma and to show the qualities of bodhisattvas who abide in the search for the Dharma, the text says:

original: mjug sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan to //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan to //
translated: The concluding verse is taught.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de'i bsdus pa'i don yang thabs che ba'i bdag nyid dang / gzhan gyi don che ba dang / bdag gi don che ba'o //üîΩdge ba'i blo gros brtson 'grus mchog thob blo //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de'i bsdus pa'i don yang thabs che ba'i bdag nyid dang / gzhan gyi don che ba dang / bdag gi don che ba'o // dge ba'i blo gros brtson 'grus mchog thob blo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The summary meaning of that verse is: the greatness of the means, the greatness of the benefit for others, and the greatness of the benefit for oneself.

original: chos tshol ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas na tshes chol ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos tshol ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas na tshes chol ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: The one with virtuous intellect, who attains supreme effort, whose mind is free from the faults of laziness, and who is endowed with the qualities of seeking the Dharma, is called the bodhisattva who abides in seeking the Dharma.

original: chos tshol ba'i tshe 'bad pa dang rtsol ba dang zhum pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa'i brtson 'grus la gnas pas na brtson 'grus mchog thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos tshol ba'i tshe 'bad pa dang rtsol ba dang zhum pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa'i brtson 'grus la gnas pas na brtson 'grus mchog thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When seeking the Dharma, he abides in effort that is free from discouragement and agitation, and is called one who attains supreme effort.

original: nan dang mthus byas pa'i brtson 'grus can ni ma yin gyi thabs dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus thob ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩbden pa gnyis ldan chos nyid dmigs bas na //
analyzed: nan dang mthus byas pa'i brtson 'grus can ni ma yin gyi thabs dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus thob ces bya ba'i don to // bden pa gnyis ldan chos nyid dmigs bas na //
translated: He is not one who exerts effort through compulsion and force, but one who attains effort endowed with means.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: By observing reality endowed with the two truths, he is called the one who attains the supreme Dharma.üîΩBy observing reality endowed with the two truths, he is called the one who attains the supreme Dharma.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus mchog thob pas na bden pa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus mchog thob pas na bden pa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, because he has attained supreme effort, he is called ‚Äúendowed with the two truths.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i bden @222b pa dang ldan pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden @222b pa dang ldan pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the ultimate truth and he is endowed with the conventional truth.

original: de ltar bden pa gnyis dang ldan pas na chos nyid dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa gnyis dang ldan pas na chos nyid dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, because he is endowed with the two truths, he is called ‚Äúobserving reality.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i bden par mthong ba dang / kun rdzob kyi bden par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par mthong ba dang / kun rdzob kyi bden par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he sees the ultimate truth and he sees the conventional truth.

original: brtson 'grus mchog thob pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa thabs che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mchog thob pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa thabs che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: The attainment of supreme effort and the observation of the conventional and ultimate truths show his nature of great means.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba dag gi skyabs 'gyur te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba dag gi skyabs 'gyur te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, he becomes a refuge for the world.

original: brtson 'grus mchog thob pa dang / bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa shes rab dang ldan pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las sgrol ba'i skyabs su 'gyur te 'dis ni gzhan gyi don che ba bstan to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mchog thob pa dang / bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa shes rab dang ldan pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las sgrol ba'i skyabs su 'gyur te 'dis ni gzhan gyi don che ba bstan to //
translated: And because he has attained the highest effort and has the wisdom that focuses on the two truths, therefore that bodhisattva becomes a refuge for all beings, to free them from suffering. This shows the greatness of his benefit for others.

original: yon tan dag ni rgya mtsho 'dra bar rdzogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan dag ni rgya mtsho 'dra bar rdzogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: His qualities are perfected like an ocean.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'gro ba'i skyabs su 'gyur bar yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'gro ba'i skyabs su 'gyur bar yang ma zad kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva not only becomes a refuge for beings.

original: dper na rgya mtsho chus rdzogs shing bya ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems kyi rgyud la yang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi chus rgyas shing rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chus rdzogs shing bya ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems kyi rgyud la yang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi chus rgyas shing rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the ocean is filled with water, so the stream of that bodhisattva's mind is filled and perfected with the water of good qualities such as the powers and fearlessnesses. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni bdag gi don chen po bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag gi don chen po bstan to //
translated: This shows the greatness of his benefit for himself.

original: mdo sde'i rgyan bam po gsum pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mdo sde'i rgyan bam po gsum pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the third chapter of Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras is now complete.

original: // / chos btsal ba'i rjes la chos bstan pa'i skabs bshad par ji ltar 'brel ce na /
analyzed: // / chos btsal ba'i rjes la chos bstan pa'i skabs bshad par ji ltar 'brel ce na /
translated: How is the present section on teaching Dharma connected to the previous section on seeking Dharma?

original: sngar gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab pa dang / gang gis bslab pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o zhes bshad pa las ji ltar bslab pa yang chos la mos pa mang ba dang / chos btsal ba dang / chos bstan pa'i rnam pas bslab par bya'o zhes gleng ba na sbyor ba'i sa nas bslab pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par la bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab pa dang / gang gis bslab pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o zhes bshad pa las ji ltar bslab pa yang chos la mos pa mang ba dang / chos btsal ba dang / chos bstan pa'i rnam pas bslab par bya'o zhes gleng ba na sbyor ba'i sa nas bslab pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par la bslab pa yin no //
translated: In the previous section, it was explained that the bodhisattva's training is what is to be trained in, how it is to be trained in, and the means by which it is to be trained in. When it was said that how it is to be trained in is to be trained in by way of the many kinds of interest in the Dharma, by seeking the Dharma, and by teaching the Dharma, then from the stage of action one is trained in the distinctive aspects of the training.

original: bslab pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par yang bsam pa'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bdag la phan pa'i khyad par dang / gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par yang bsam pa'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bdag la phan pa'i khyad par dang / gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par la sogs pa ste /
translated: The distinctive aspects of the training are the distinctive aspects of attitude, the distinctive aspects of application, the distinctive aspects of benefit to oneself, the distinctive aspects of benefit to others, and so on.

original: de la bsam pa'i khyad par mos pa mang ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i khyad par mos pa mang ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: Of these, the distinctive aspects of attitude have been explained in the section on the many kinds of interest.

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bdag la phan pa'i khyad par yang chos btsal ba'i skabs su bshad zin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bdag la phan pa'i khyad par yang chos btsal ba'i skabs su bshad zin te /
translated: The special qualities of application and the special qualities of benefit to oneself have already been explained in the section on searching for the Dharma.

original: da ni gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par bshad par skabs su bab ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par bshad par skabs su bab ste /
translated: Now the special qualities of benefit to others are explained.

original: gzhan la phan par bya ba yang bdag gis ji ltar chos btsa la ba gzhan la phyin ci ma log par bshad pas gzhan la phan par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan par bya ba yang bdag gis ji ltar chos btsa la ba gzhan la phyin ci ma log par bshad pas gzhan la phan par gyur te /
translated: And benefit to others is that, by my unmistaken explanation of the Dharma to others, I have become one who benefits others.

original: de bas na @223a * //
analyzed: de bas na @223a * //
translated: Therefore,
